title: National Theatre Live: Best of Enemies
description: In 1968 America, as two men fight to become the next president, all eyes are on the battle between two others: the cunningly conservative William F. Buckley Jr., and the unruly liberal Gore Vidal. During a new nightly television format, they debate the moral landscape of a shattered nation. As beliefs are challenged and slurs slung, a new frontier in American politics is opening and television news is about to be transformed forever. Jeremy Herrin (All My Sons) directs this blistering political thriller, filmed live in London's West End.

title: Victim/Suspect
description: On her first solo investigation, journalist Rae de Leon travels nationwide to uncover a shocking pattern: Young women tell the police they've been sexually assaulted, but instead of finding justice, they're charged with the crime of making a false report, arrested, and even imprisoned by the system they believed would protect them.

characteristics.Producer:: Christopher Clements, Rachel De Leon, Julie Goldman, Alice Henty, Amanda Pike, Nancy Schwartzman
characteristics.Production Co:: Center for Investigative Reporting Studios, Motto Pictures

reviews.name: Nick Allen
reviews.message: A document of superb journalism but is unfortunately told in a sludgy, distracting fashion.

reviews.name: Jordan Lyon
reviews.message: To call Victim/Suspect hard-hitting and infuriating is a massive understatement. This documentary will leave you angry beyond words, but you should watch it nonetheless.

reviews.name: Natalia Winkelman
reviews.message: The film, which examines cases in which sexual assault survivors are charged with false reporting, is the rare entry whose revelations feel cogent, earned and memorable.

reviews.name: Christopher Llewellyn Reed
reviews.message: Watch, learn, take action. Reform won’t happen unless we demand it.

reviews.name: Chris Joyce
reviews.message: The information is harrowing and disgusting, but it’s also inspiring to see how one journalist’s dogged investigation shed light on a troubling pattern in law enforcement leading to actionable changes for the better.

reviews.name: Romey Norton
reviews.message: Unfortunately, this documentary is another example of how the systems put in place to protect us can fail us miserably.

reviews.name: Nick Schager
reviews.message: A film about a police culture that doesn’t seem to take rape charges seriously—or, at the very least, doesn’t think that thoroughly examining accusations is worth the hassle when intimidation and humiliation will facilitate their jobs.

reviews.name: Brianna Zigler
reviews.message: Victim/Suspect manages to be at once fascinating, improperly focused and somewhat redundant.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: An artless documentary that feels overwritten and orchestrated to a fault. The topic is important and infuriating, but it’s not a particularly well-made film.

reviews.name: Kent Turner
reviews.message: [A] powerful, hard-hitting investigative documentary.

reviews.name: Sheri Flanders
reviews.message: This documentary doesn’t offer much in terms of craft, but one could perhaps make the argument that the subject matter necessitates no-frills storytelling that soberly focuses on facts and video evidence.

reviews.name: Juan Carlos Ugarelli
reviews.message: A revealing study on two sides of journalism: the tabloid press that accuses without evidence and sows disinformation, further stigmatizing these women; and investigative journalism that digs into minefields... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: It’s easy to feel overwhelmed with sadness and empathy for the victims. Easy to feel proud that a young reporter and documentarian turned wrong into right. That takes courage.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: [Victim/Suspect] suffers from the Netflix brand of overproduction, looking just a little too flashy and sinking everything with voiceover and interview sound bites that have been scripted to death.

reviews.name: Barbara Goslawski
reviews.message: Yes, the film generates a sense of the anger at the system that has perpetrated this injustice but not enough to warrant much further thought or even action.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: A very solid, depressing piece of accessible documentary journalism about a very troubling trend.

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: A heartbreaking but eye-opening piece of filmmaking.

reviews.name: Sheri Linden
reviews.message: Measured and sometimes muddled, but unquestionably important.

reviews.name: Sebastian Zavala Kahn
reviews.message: A strong, powerful documentary that, despite feeling a tad neat and cold at times, benefits from De Leon's presence. And most importantly: it is a film that will remain engraved in your memories for a long time. Full review in Spanish.

reviews.name: Sarah Bea Milner
reviews.message: An upsetting documentary.

reviews.name: Andrew Parker
reviews.message: Victim/Suspect ends up being a vital and eye opening examination of widespread injustice that still leaves a lot on the table thanks to its strangely narrow focus.

reviews.name: Lena Wilson
reviews.message: You may need to take a month-long depression nap after you finish watching it, but this documentary will stick with you.

reviews.name: Kate Erbland
reviews.message: It’s all so very sober, so deeply sobering, that when actual emotion pops, that’s what jars. It shouldn’t be the case -- all of this should rattle us and move us into action.

reviews.name: Fran Hoepfner
reviews.message: That these stories are worth being told is inarguable, but is this the proper lens to go about it?

title: Mem Famous
description: A high-energy, youthful journey filled with amazing moments of friendship, love and family, set in a beautiful and colorful village.

characteristics.Producer:: Chandru Manoharan, Anurag Reddy, Sharath Chandra

title: Roger Waters: This Is Not a Drill - Live Broadcast from Prague
description: For one night only, Roger Waters, the creative force behind the golden years of Pink Floyd, presents his first Farewell Tour, "This Is Not A Drill", Live from Prague, in cinemas around the world. This cinematic extravaganza is a stunning indictment of the corporate dystopia in which we all struggle to survive and will include 20 Pink Floyd and Roger Waters classic songs, including: "Us & Them", "Comfortably Numb", "Wish You Were Here", and "Is This The Life We Really Want?". Waters will also debut his new song, "The Bar". Waters will be joined on stage by Jonathan Wilson, Dave Kilminster, Jon Carin, Gus Seyffert, Robert Walter, Joey Waronker, Shanay Johnson, Amanda Belair and Seamus Blake to deliver an unforgettable performance with a call to action to love, protect, and share our precious planet home.

title: The Little Mermaid
description: The youngest of King Triton's daughters, and the most defiant, Ariel longs to find out more about the world beyond the sea, and while visiting the surface, falls for the dashing Prince Eric. While mermaids are forbidden to interact with humans, Ariel must follow her heart. She makes a deal with the evil sea witch, Ursula, which gives her a chance to experience life on land, but ultimately places her life -- and her father's crown -- in jeopardy.

characteristics.Producer:: Marc Platt, Lin-Manuel Miranda, John DeLuca, Rob Marshall
characteristics.Production Co:: Walt Disney Pictures, Lucamar, Marc Platt Productions
characteristics.Sound Mix:: Dolby Digital, Dolby Atmos, DTS, Dolby

reviews.name: Peter Gray
reviews.message: [Halle] Bailey’s casting and presence makes far more of an impact than the story does, but in spite of its superfluous nature, it’s charming and entertaining enough whilst it’s here.

reviews.name: Wendy Lee Szany
reviews.message: Halle Bailey is a total powerhouse in this, and will make you weep with her rendition of “A Part Of Your World”. Melissa McCarthy is fantastic as Ursula. Some (new) songs were a bit forgettable…

reviews.name: Jorge Rivera Rubio
reviews.message: Telling the same story but with its own personality, and a wonderful Caribbean touch. Halle Bailey is charmingly charismatic... a fun, heartwarming experience, & the only adaptation that left me wanting to see it soon again. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Travis DeShong
reviews.message: Without any nostalgic connection to the original property, The Little Mermaid is a peculiarly ambivalent experience, all its elevating touches counterbalanced by its new flaws.

reviews.name: Eric Marchen
reviews.message: Disney’s unsightly live action-remake of the 1989 classic drowns in the murky waters of ill-conceived VFX.

reviews.name: Theolin Tembo
reviews.message: The Little Mermaid is at its simplest the quintessential story of an outsider that everyone can connect with. In this modern retelling, many will walk away having fallen in love with Bailey’s Ariel, and feeling not only seen but also moved by her story.

reviews.name: Niamh Jiménez
reviews.message: As valuable as this representation is, Hailey’s performance highlights that the spirit and character of Ariel transcend superficial differences -- qualities like independence, determination and ambition have no racial signature.

reviews.name: John Lui
reviews.message: A fun if forgettable piece of entertainment.

reviews.name: Graeme Tuckett
reviews.message: There are plenty of moments and scenes that work beautifully... but none of it adds up to much more than a piece of merchandise, produced by a corporation too big to risk originality.

reviews.name: Morgan Shaunette
reviews.message: Bailey’s performance is a stunning, starmaking endeavor, proving herself a vividly talented name in the making (and her chemistry with Hauer-King helps sell the story).

reviews.name: Chris Rovzar
reviews.message: Here’s an inescapable fact that’s been known by humans ever since they were bold enough to sail the seven seas: When you drag something from underwater to the surface, it ends up a limp, bedraggled mess.

reviews.name: Alastair McKay
reviews.message: Bailey may have a good voice, but she doesn’t have the requisite on-screen charisma to break through Rob Marshall’s leaden direction and the uncanny valley sheen of all the CGI-augmented action.

reviews.name: Andrew Parker
reviews.message: Disney’s latest live action remake of one of their own animated classics, The Little Mermaid, is another bit of wading into the shallow end of the creativity pool.

reviews.name: Adam Graham
reviews.message: It's flat, dramatically vacant and visually inert, with a lead performance that all too closely resembles a fish out of water.

reviews.name: Carson Timar
reviews.message: While The Little Mermaid is far from being a complete disaster in the same way the remakes of Aladdin and Dumbo were, the film is a massive mixed bag.

reviews.name: Christopher Llewellyn Reed
reviews.message: So maybe this "The Little Mermaid" has more to recommend it than I initially thought. If only it were cut down and sped up.

reviews.name: Wesley Morris
reviews.message: It reeks of obligation and noble intentions. Joy, fun, mystery, risk, flavor, kink — they’re missing. The movie’s saying, “We tried!” Tried not to offend, appall, challenge, imagine.

reviews.name: Brandon Zachary
reviews.message: The Little Mermaid benefits from its expanded run-time, and by committing to a showy tone that (mostly) works for a fun time.

reviews.name: Sarah Marloff
reviews.message: Some poor, unfortunate souls will want more from Disney’s latest remake, but Halle Bailey shines even if the script stays pretty true to the animated original.

reviews.name: Caryn James
reviews.message: The film's diverse casting has already made the point about unity, and done so much more eloquently. The Little Mermaid mostly avoids preaching, though. It remains what it always was: a charming, escapist fairy tale.

reviews.name: Caryn James
reviews.message: The film's diverse casting has already made the point about unity, and done so much more eloquently. The Little Mermaid mostly avoids preaching, though. It remains what it always was: a charming, escapist fairy tale.

reviews.name: Leo Brady
reviews.message: We get to witness the rise of a star and The Little Mermaid becomes more swim than sink.

reviews.name: Ann Hornaday
reviews.message: An on-the-other-fin mixed bag of a movie that honors its source material with a big, color-saturated production, while never precisely proving that it ever needed to exist.

reviews.name: Leila Latif
reviews.message: Halle Bailey’s charms can’t distract from all the bizarre choices at the heart of this underwhelming live-action remake.

reviews.name: Paul McGuire Grimes
reviews.message: I was all in after seeing Halle Bailey’s stunning work as Ariel. She absolutely nails the part. Her rendition of “Part of Your World” is breathtaking with its build and the passion and drive Bailey puts into it.

reviews.name: Jason Best
reviews.message: Happily, [its] flaws aren’t enough to sink the film. Bailey’s Ariel is radiant throughout and, in places, Marshall’s hyper-stylized visuals add oomph and dazzle to the songs.

reviews.name: Doug Jamieson
reviews.message: Led by a star-making performance from the luminous Halle Bailey, the undeniably magical and terrifically delightful 'The Little Mermaid' hits that sweet spot between reinvention and nostalgia.

reviews.name: James Berardinelli
reviews.message: Although money was undoubtedly the primary driver for remaking The Little Mermaid, at least on this occasion the filmmakers have proven able to engage in something more than nostalgia-mining.

reviews.name: Don Shanahan
reviews.message: When you hear Halle Bailey sing, there is no doubt. She crushes it and aces the biggest test this movie needed to pass.

reviews.name: Jeanne Kaplan
reviews.message: So much to love in director Rob Marshall’s live- action adaptation of THE LITTLE MERMAID. Not only does he have a splendid cast, but the entire film is amazing from beginning to end.

reviews.name: David Kaplan
reviews.message: Guaranteed to enthrall a whole new generation of movie lovers as well as Baby Boomers on up. It has it all --- an engaging story, a tremendously likeable cast, glorious cinematography, a superb musical score, and a singular performance from Halle Bailey.

reviews.name: Grant Watson
reviews.message: There may not be any compelling reason for The Little Mermaid to exist, but it at least manages to be broadly entertaining while it is here.

reviews.name: Dave Lee
reviews.message: A joyous delight! Halle Bailey is tremendous, an absolute superstar! Despite some pacing issues, and middling new songs, it's amongst the best Disney remakes, and leaves you smiling from beginning to end. The movie is like a big warm hug.

reviews.name: Lex Briscuso
reviews.message: The live-action “Little Mermaid” is a fresh take on a beloved classic that isn’t afraid to take a fairy tale and make it as real as it can, inviting its audience to dive into uncharted waters alongside its engaging and charming central characters.

reviews.name: Susan Kamyab
reviews.message: If there was any reason for this remake in particular, it was to have Halle Bailey as Ariel!

reviews.name: Sandie Angulo Chen
reviews.message: While none of Disney's live-action reboots are strictly necessary, there's a lot to enjoy about The Little Mermaid.

reviews.name: Jon Negroni
reviews.message: Flipping its fins doesn’t get The Little Mermaid too far, but it’s one of the least surface-level Disney live-action remakes in a while.

reviews.name: Kayla Harrington
reviews.message: While The Little Mermaid is not the first live-action Disney movie ever put on the big screen, it’s definitely the best one yet.

reviews.name: Kristen Maldonado
reviews.message: Halle Bailey was born to play Ariel! Her “Part Of Your World” is a true revelation. I love the new additions to the story that let her and Eric form a real connection. They were able to add suspense to a classic story we all know and love.

reviews.name: Rebecca Murray
reviews.message: Ozempic Flounder aside, most of the alterations made to bring this tale of a curious young woman who longs to expand her universe, exchange her fins for feet, and stand tall are a positive step forward.

title: You Hurt My Feelings
description: Beth (Julia Louis-Dreyfus), a popular writer, and her husband Don, a well-liked teacher, share the kind of relationship that truly, seriously, for the love of God cannot be real: that is, they're actually in love. Even after decades of marriage, parenting, and their own successful careers, their physical spark has somehow not diminished; in fact, they seem to relish the opportunity to share a single ice cream cone and drive others -- including their son, Charlie -- mad. Should it come as a surprise then that his own marriage is in crisis? But when Beth discovers that Don has been untruthful to her about his opinion of her work for years -- Beth's world comes crashing down. Has their whole relationship been one Big Fat Lie?

characteristics.Producer:: Stefanie Azpiazu, Anthony Bregman, Nicole Holofcener, Julia Louis-Dreyfus

reviews.name: Adam Graham
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings knows there are bigger problems in the universe than a miscommunication or a bruised ego. But just because they're first-world problems doesn't mean they're not huge problems in the tiny bubble we all create for ourselves.

reviews.name: Steve Erickson
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings’ topical touches are witty but a little shallow.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Edalatpour
reviews.message: [The central] conflict wears thin almost immediately, but is supplemented by the director’s characteristic skill at managing a variety of sardonic subplots.

reviews.name: Jorge Ignacio Castillo
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings is an adult comedy about relationships -- the kind of movie you rarely see at the multiplex anymore.

reviews.name: Richard Roeper
reviews.message: Julia Louis-Dreyfus delivers smashingly good work...

reviews.name: Dmitry Samarov
reviews.message: Definitely one to watch the way most people do with SNL: wait till the highlights hit YouTube and skip the rest.

reviews.name: Dan Scully
reviews.message: Consistently laugh-out-loud funny without necessarily being predictable or crass in its comedy.

reviews.name: Randy Myers
reviews.message: The radiant, immensely approachable dramedy takes a kind look at the fragility of our egos and about how one offhand opinion can snowball into an avalanche of resentment, doubts and eventually introspection.

reviews.name: Robert Denerstein
reviews.message: Slender but enjoyable, You Hurt My Feelings doesn't feel like a movie that wants to change anyone's life. Even better, it only takes Holofcener a refreshing one hour and 33 minutes to involve us with characters...

reviews.name: Leo Brady
reviews.message: It’s the genius writing of conflict by Holofcener and a career-best performance from Julia Louis-Dreyfus that makes this an authentic film to spend time with.

reviews.name: Ann Hornaday
reviews.message: As a slice of life spiked with mordant, uncynical humor, it’s deliciously entertaining.

reviews.name: Emily Zemler
reviews.message: Louis-Dreyfus is pitch perfect and hilariously relatable as Beth.

reviews.name: Barry Hertz
reviews.message: A much-needed reminder of the almost forgotten pleasures of sitting inside a movie theatre, watching smart, funny people work through thorny, relatable problems on a distinctly human scale.

reviews.name: Josh Larsen
reviews.message: ...a wise comedic drama about the necessary lies we tell each other (and ourselves).

reviews.name: Moira MacDonald
reviews.message: Perhaps “You Hurt My Feelings” is almost too small, but its pinpoint precision is what makes it work...

reviews.name: Robert Kojder
reviews.message: With piercing observations, a cutting script, and hilariously honest performances, the film stings its viewers just as much as it does its characters

reviews.name: Joanna Langfield
reviews.message: In the sea of superheroes and huge budget extravaganzas, this latest treat from Nicole Holofcener and Julia Louis-Dreyfus feels like a gift. And, for some of us, a very relatable gift.

reviews.name: Avi Offer
reviews.message: A captivating, witty and perceptive portrait of a marriage.

reviews.name: Mick LaSalle
reviews.message: Those who want to be unfriendly could call “You Hurt My Feelings” trivial. But if they are honest, they might call it something else: life-size.

reviews.name: Brian Orndorf
reviews.message: Elevated by wonderful performances and the deceptive nebulousness of the screenwriting, which ends up a most insightful examination of marital and parental woes.

reviews.name: Kaely Monahan
reviews.message: Sometimes, you just need a witty and sweet movie and Nicole Holofcener delivers it.

reviews.name: Sherin Nicole
reviews.message: What is fascinating is how You Hurt My Feelings digs so deeply while making you laugh so sincerely.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: Holofcener accesses moving material that will make you laugh, possibly cry, and come away feeling a little wiser for it. Such modest pleasures at the cinema feel rare but vital.

reviews.name: Anthony Lane
reviews.message: Well, this setup might possibly furnish a single episode of “Seinfeld.” Whether it’s enough to sustain a whole movie is another matter.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: A twee...slight sociological study that takes navel-gazing New Yorkers into their AARP years, still comfortably discomfitted by the littlest things, still making mountains out of lives littered with molehills.

reviews.name: Erik Childress
reviews.message: Nicole Holofcener just does not miss and her reunion with Julia Louis-Dreyfus is one of her best in hilariously charting the perils of the damage that can be inflicted by false confidence and loving reassurance with characters who feel authentic.

reviews.name: Brian Rowe
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings is as good as Enough Said, if not better, and I hope she makes more films with Louis-Dreyfus. The two have a kinship that works beautifully on a narrative level...

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: Crackerjack writing and a talented cast make this very relatable (and funny) adult comedy-drama achieve its full potential.

reviews.name: Amber Wilkinson
reviews.message: An constant supply of quotable zingers lends energy to almost every scene

reviews.name: Martin Carr
reviews.message: Tried, tested, and uninspiring - this four way relationship drama goes over old ground.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: Delivers with a light touch a well-observed drama.

reviews.name: Piers Marchant
reviews.message: Collectively, these exquisitely rendered moments begin to form a much greater whole, creating a sense of the world for [Nicole Holofcener's] characters that somehow expands far beyond what we actually see of them.

reviews.name: Juan Carlos Ugarelli
reviews.message: Through everyday life situations and seemingly trivial conversations, Holofcener's excellent screenplay and the spot-on performances of the cast explore the theme of personal realization with a sharp sense of humor. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: Especially married couples will be able to relate to this story and its wonderful dialogue

reviews.name: Daniel Joyaux
reviews.message: What ensues is a poignant and funny investigation into the little lies of encouragement we spout to our loved ones and the damage it can do when those built-up fibs are suddenly revealed.

reviews.name: Zoë Rose Bryant
reviews.message: It’s tender, terrifically funny, and endlessly thought-provoking, and it sends you out on a heartfelt high with new knowledge to apply to your own life, so you learn from Beth and Don’s miscommunications instead of repeating their mistakes yourself.

reviews.name: Andrea Thompson
reviews.message: It might be Holofcener’s most tender portrayal yet of a woman whose world is upended just as she’s at a critical crossroads in her life.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: One of [Holofcener's] smartest and funniest films.

reviews.name: Ross Bonaime
reviews.message: You Hurt My Feelings is the type of film that reminds us why Holofcener is one of the best writers of comedies today, and that her ability to write films with such small consequences can often feel like a massive achievement.

reviews.name: Pat Mullen
reviews.message: The film marks Holofcener's best work since 2010’s Please Give for its warm, witty, and wise consideration of relationships.

title: The Machine
description: Bert Kreischer rose to fame as a stand-up comedian known as The Machine, and in his signature set he recounts his true experience with Russian mobsters while on a booze-soaked college trip. Now, 23 years later, that trip has come back to haunt him as he and his estranged father (Mark Hamill) are kidnapped back to Russia by the mob to atone for something they say he did. Together, Bert and his father must retrace the steps of his younger self (Jimmy Tatro) in the midst of a war within a sociopathic crime family, all while attempting to find common ground in their often fraught relationship.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Some Sexual References|Pervasive Language|Drug Use|Strong Violence)
characteristics.Producer:: Bert Kreischer, LeeAnn Kreischer, Judi Marmel, Cale Boyter, Peter Atencio

title: About My Father
description: The hottest comic in America, Sebastian Maniscalco joins forces with legendary Italian-American and two-time Oscar winner, Robert De Niro, in the new comedy ABOUT MY FATHER. The film centers around Sebastian (Maniscalco) who is encouraged by his fiancée (Leslie Bibb) to bring his immigrant, hairdresser father, Salvo (De Niro), to a weekend get-together with her super-rich and exceedingly eccentric family (Kim Cattrall, Anders Holm, Brett Dier, David Rasche). The weekend develops into what can only be described as a culture clash, leaving Sebastian and Salvo to discover that the great thing about family is everything about family.

characteristics.Producer:: Andrew Miano, Paul Weitz, Chris Weitz, Judi Marmel

reviews.name: Fred Topel
reviews.message: Some of the conflicts may have indeed been based on Maniscalco's life, but the film struggles to land the joke.

reviews.name: Danielle Solzman
reviews.message: About My Father is a laugh-out-loud hysterical comedy...

reviews.name: Meredith Loftus
reviews.message: Overall, "About My Father" plays with a story that has been done before; yet, by shifting the focus towards a father and son realizing their depth of love towards each other, Laura Terruso's film manages to stand out from previous iterations.

reviews.name: Brian Orndorf
reviews.message: The production ultimately hopes to hit the heart, which makes the viewing experience all the more taxing.

reviews.name: Todd Gilchrist
reviews.message: Whether or not Maniscalco has a legitimate future as a movie star, he proves a likeable presence as a romantic lead, while director Laura Terruso skillfully delivers comedic payoffs that tap into his wheelhouse while introducing him to a wider audience.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Robert Freakin' DeNiro is staring back at him and they're male-bonding and all of that, and Maniscalo gives as good as he's gets....The rest of the movie? Frankly, that's a bit on the "meh" side

reviews.name: Laura Clifford
reviews.message: With plot developments foreshadowed via spotlight and Laura Terruso’s (TV's 'Dickinson') choppy direction, “About My Father” is the type of entertainment best enjoyed while shutting one’s brain down trying to doze off.

title: Kandahar
description: An undercover CIA operative gets stuck in hostile territory in Afghanistan after his mission is exposed. Accompanied by his translator, he must fight enemy combatants as he tries to reach an extraction point in Kandahar.

characteristics.Producer:: Basil Iwanyk, Brendon Boyea, Erica Lee, Gerard Butler, Alan Siegel, Christian Mercuri, Scott LaStaiti
characteristics.Production Co:: MBC Studios, Thunder Road Pictures, Capstone Studios, G-BASE

reviews.name: Brian Orndorf
reviews.message: Isn’t sharp enough to be taken seriously as an offering of political and religious examination, and not active enough to provide a hard-charging viewing experience.

reviews.name: Courtney Howard
reviews.message: This desert dry actioner is filled with lazy, laughable clichés and poorly orchestrated spectacle.

reviews.name: Julian Roman
reviews.message: Kandahar strikes at the heart of geopolitical and human rights issues embroiling the Middle East. Slick action scenes, especially a spectacular nighttime helicopter chase, rescue the narrative from lulls.

reviews.name: Josh Parham
reviews.message: While occasional bursts of excitement draw one back into the plight, they are short-lived reprieves from the banal displays that not even the actors can salvage.

reviews.name: Mike McGranaghan
reviews.message: What it does in the first hour isn’t particularly good. Neither is what it switches to for the second. That leaves you feeling as though you’ve seen two bad movies when it’s over, rather than just one.

reviews.name: Travis Hopson
reviews.message: While Kandahar can be a bit sluggish at times, it’s all in service of a film that goes to great lengths to be more substantial than the typical action movie or political thriller.

reviews.name: Barry Hertz
reviews.message: By law, every summer movie season should include at least one Gerard Butler film.

reviews.name: Frank Scheck
reviews.message: The year's second best film about an American and his translator in Afghanistan.

reviews.name: Mick LaSalle
reviews.message: It’s an action and suspense film, and, like Butler’s earlier 2023 flick “Plane,” a good one.

reviews.name: Robin Clifford
reviews.message: The script...is too much of a kitchen sink and, often times, the story goes into the weed. The resolution to this dilemma by director Ric Roman Waugh is to just leave the ends loose and hope no one notices. That is sloppy filmmaking, to me.

reviews.name: Randy Myers
reviews.message: It’s solid and gripping and tries to do more with its storyline than you’d expect.

reviews.name: Rob Thomas
reviews.message: Butler is like an old battered suitcase of an action hero — banged-up and rough around the edges, but dependable and durable. "Kandahar" plays to his world-weary strengths.

reviews.name: Robert Kojder
reviews.message: Waugh knows how to stage bombastic destruction and admirably wants to tell a thoughtful story around that, but he also gets lost within too many characters when the compelling dynamic between Tom and translator Mo provides enough riveting drama

reviews.name: Michael O'Sullivan
reviews.message: Kandahar is very much a box-ticking exercise, with Butler playing the same kind of hero he has built a career out of.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: While it isn’t the thrill-a-minute ride the trailer suggests, the action scenes we get are intense and exciting, especially in the riveting final third where things really ratchet up. As for Butler, he’s given a character who fits his strengths nicely.

reviews.name: Ethan Vestby
reviews.message: With this past January’s Plane and now Kandahar, B-movie mainstay Gerard Butler has officially entered his Sad Dad era.

reviews.name: Valerie Complex
reviews.message: For "Kandahar" to be called an action film, there should be action, right?

reviews.name: Jake Cole
reviews.message: For a movie that follows a man stuck in a country where U.S. coalition troops have now finally left, Kandahar never conjures the sense of paranoia and fear.

reviews.name: Chase Hutchinson
reviews.message: More than anything, the greatest problem is how boring it all is. None of the action scenes have any passion to them and, even worse, they can feel downright contrived. That it then pretends to have something more to say strains credulity.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: For a film that surely wants to present itself primarily as an action-packed thriller, its abundance of extraneous details becomes detrimental to the pacing; audiences aren’t likely to care about the premise as much as the excitement.

reviews.name: Laura Clifford
reviews.message: ...Roman Waugh’s direction…elevates “Kandahar” as a production, if not catapulting it above the generic political thriller heap expositorily.

title: The Wrath of Becky
description: Two years after she escaped a violent attack on her family, Becky attempts to rebuild her life in the care of an older woman -- a kindred spirit named Elena. But when a group known as the "Noble Men" break into their home, attack them, and take her beloved dog, Diego, Becky must return to her old ways to protect herself and her loved ones.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Strong Bloody Violence|Gore|Some Sexual References|Pervasive Language)
characteristics.Producer:: Russ Posternak, Raphael Margules, J.D. Lifshitz, Chadd Harbold, Jordan Yale Levine, Jordan Beckerman, Tracy Rosenblum
characteristics.Production Co:: Media Finance Capital, Yale Productions, Post Film, Fluffy Bear Studios, RainMaker Films, BoulderLight Pictures, Quiver Distribution

reviews.name: Emilie Black
reviews.message: The Wrath of Becky is a sequel we didn’t know we needed to a film we never saw coming. It’s violent, it’s brutal, and it’s fun.

reviews.name: Cody Dericks
reviews.message: “The Wrath of Becky” is a quick and definitely-not-painless exercise in cinematic brutality. It makes up for what it lacks in occasional narrative clarity in pure bloody entertainment.

reviews.name: Randy Myers
reviews.message: A nonfat revenge bloodbath, with a running time under and lots of cheer-able moments.

reviews.name: Brent McKnight
reviews.message: What's fun about 'The Wrath of Becky' is a total blast, though the rest is an empty, if serviceable time.

reviews.name: Robert Kojder
reviews.message: Matt Angel and Suzanne Coote know that there should be a sense of humor and that the movie should be fun, above all else, with cleverly painful injuries and kills once the revenge starts

reviews.name: Hope Madden
reviews.message: In fact, every character makes a series of choices that defy the very storyline the film itself is trying to establish. Once or twice is forgivable, but eventually this lapse in internal logic becomes a real burden.

reviews.name: Joey Magidson
reviews.message: The Wrath of Becky is a fun and lean sequel that delivers exactly what it promises.

reviews.name: Avi Offer
reviews.message: Lean and mean, but witless, tedious and often inane.

reviews.name: Andy Crump
reviews.message: That The Wrath of Becky offers slapstick married with a kill tally and not much else is a feature, not a flaw.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: The writer/co-directors don't show any flair for creating moments of jeopardy and logically reasoning/killing one's way of them. Becky problem-solves like she's a 16 year-old screenwriter.

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: Becky is a fascinating anti-heroine, and Lulu Wilson plays her to pitch perfection...

reviews.name: Rod Machen
reviews.message: The Wrath of Becky is literally a bloody good time.

reviews.name: Keri O'Shea
reviews.message: The Wrath of Becky is a crowd pleaser, full of OTT rough charm and gratuitous just desserts; it’s hard not to love its boundless energy.

reviews.name: Brian Orndorf
reviews.message: Isn’t quite as lovably feral as its predecessor, but manages to bring the pain as the main character once again faces off against the worst of American society.

reviews.name: Lee McCoy
reviews.message: Wrath of Becky gives you more of what you loved in the first, while also having fun with the current social divide. But more importantly, it's fun with a capital F.

reviews.name: Dan Scully
reviews.message: Delivers on strong thematic and character work, while also providing no shortage of splattery, cathartic violence to boot.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: Campy fun? Yes. Ultra-violent? You bet! What separates Becky is that it’s not aiming for the “comedy” part of horror comedy. It’s organically funny and while the situations are off the wall, the natural progression of the storyline isn’t.

reviews.name: Dolores Quintana
reviews.message: THE WRATH OF BECKY is a serviceable film with some decent gore, but it has some ideas you have already seen before.

reviews.name: Drew Tinnin
reviews.message: Wrath of Becky is much more than a fantasy revenge tale about getting even with white trash nationalists and dumb-witted domestic terrorists.It’s an official coming out party for star-in-the-making Lulu Wilson.

reviews.name: Dustin Rowles
reviews.message: The tone of the sequel is more cartoonish than the original -- the lighting is brighter and the blood is redder -- but it’s no less satisfying.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: There’s a charming simplicity to a genre film that can be introduced as “Let’s just kill some fascists!” and Angel & Coote know how to pace and deliver this kind of gut punch of a movie.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: The cheeky film has the same fiery revenge tone as the original even with new directors and writers.

reviews.name: J Hurtado
reviews.message: If the first film was Home Alone, this one is a bit more John Wick, only with less martial arts and more exploding fascist rednecks, and that is totally cool with me.

reviews.name: Anton Bitel
reviews.message: Becky’s need for teen kicks delivers enough delinquent destruction of Nazis to bring bloody satisfaction.

reviews.name: Martin Unsworth
reviews.message: Outrageously over the top, The Wrath of Becky goes against the grain when it comes to sequels – particularly when they don’t contain input from the core behind-the-scenes crew – in that it’s even more fun than the original.

reviews.name: Dan Tabor
reviews.message: Wrath of Becky is a blood-drenched blast from start to finish and the perfect film for any genre fan looking for a bit of that ultraviolence.

reviews.name: Matt Donato
reviews.message: A fun-filled slaughter-fest.

reviews.name: Nathaniel Muir
reviews.message: The Wrath of Becky manages to bring everything together and never feels like the importance of the issues are being downplayed. The villains are an immediate threat to Becky, but they will also be recognizable to audiences.

reviews.name: Meagan Navarro
reviews.message: Angel and Coote’s playful tonal shift becomes instrumental in the sequel’s success as an entertaining action-horror-comedy romp, and Wilson is more than game in taking Becky less seriously. It makes for an irreverently delightful time.

reviews.name: Kat Hughes
reviews.message: Lulu Wilson’s Becky is always a fun character to spend time with, but despite the best efforts of all involved, The Wrath of Becky pales in comparison to what came before.

title: The Hole in the Fence
description: At a secluded exclusive summer camp in the Mexican countryside, under the watchful eyes of their adult guardians, boys from a prestigious private school receive physical, moral and religious training to turn them into tomorrow's elite. The discovery of a hole in the fence sets in motion a chain of disturbing events as the boys devolve into a Lord of the Flies-like mob mentality that creates and spreads hysteria in this profoundly disturbing coming-of-age drama that unravels like a horror movie while drawing on actual events.

characteristics.Producer:: Fernanda De la Peza

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Director del Paso was making a statement about Mexico’s heirarchy, the Catholic faith that rewards the rich by keeping the poor meek. But this story could be set in many places at this point in time.

reviews.name: Hugo Lara
reviews.message: [Del Paso] maximizes his main location, a place in the middle of the forest, filmed with an atmosphere that suddenly recharges with psychological terror... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Javier Perez
reviews.message: Lacks a dramatic anchor to bond with the audience despite some unsettling dramatic flashes and tensions. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Alejandro Alemán
reviews.message: Del Paso reinforces his ability to portray chaos, and through its montage, have fear and indignation invade us. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Carlos Bonfil
reviews.message: An intelligent thriller, with agile rhythm, stupendous artistry in photography and sound, and a polarizing theme that is open to discourse. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: The Hole in the Fence is a story that captures [the essence of] what you read about in the papers. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Fernanda Solórzano
reviews.message: The Hole in the Fence manages to build a sinister universe that, on the one hand, is close to us and, on the other, is inserted into a vein of horror mythology. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Carson Timar
reviews.message: It is hard to argue against The Hole in the Fence being anything but one of the best films of the year.

reviews.name: Vassilis Kroustallis
reviews.message: A skillful attempt to bring a reality usually (and understandably) hidden from view; it will mobilize its various actors in an orchestrated way.

reviews.name: Amber Wilkinson
reviews.message: Despite being rather on the nose in terms of his plot beats, del Paso has an eye for a strong image and a psychological feel for the insidious viewpoint of the adults, washing over the children like a bad benediction.

reviews.name: Israel Acosta Aroche
reviews.message: Joaquín del Paso brings us a provocative and shocking film that manages to mix elements of psychological terror and political criticism. [Full review in Spanish]

title: Will-o'-the-Wisp
description: On his deathbed, his royal highness Alfredo, King without a crown, is taken back to distant youth memories and the time he dreamt of becoming a fireman. The encounter with instructor Afonso from the fire brigade, opens a new chapter in the life of the two young men immersed in love and desire, and the will to change the status quo.

characteristics.Producer:: Vincent Wang, João Matos, João Pedro Rodrigues
characteristics.Writer:: João Pedro Rodrigues, João Rui Guerra Da Mata, Paulo Lopes Graça

reviews.name: Fernando Bernal
reviews.message: Rodrigues' musical fantasy is a fascinating cinematic challenge. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Carlos Losilla
reviews.message: Contemplates reality as a delusion worth living and, therefore, as a privilege that no one has the right to take away from us. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Amparo Cabal
reviews.message: A brief but fun and memorable film with a queer perspective and a very unique sense of humor. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jason Shawhan
reviews.message: [It] delivers ample amounts of firehouse choreography and dangling parts.

reviews.name: Ankit Jhunjhunwala
reviews.message: Above all functions as a love story, even though it has a lot of tricks up its sleeve.

reviews.name: Lee Jutton
reviews.message: It’s altogether hilarious and yet still heartfelt, extremely weird but wonderful regardless—just like the rest of Will-o’-the-Wisp.

reviews.name: Jason Adams
reviews.message: A beefcake fantasia of masculine camaraderie that’s spills into dance and forest-floor mutual masturbation

reviews.name: Juan Carlos Ugarelli
reviews.message: Rodrigues conceives a lush tree of a story that feeds off multiple genres: absurdist comedy, musical, coming-of-age, interracial romance, and shameless eroticism. And at its roots, lies an intelligent sociopolitical subtext. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Matthew St. Clair
reviews.message: Rodrigues' ability to condense a myriad of genres into a small package is a grand feat.

reviews.name: Tomas Trussow
reviews.message: It bounces in the interstices of varying genres and critiques, undaunted by the fact that not every strike is cleanly wrought, but confident in being caustic when needed, while also giving satire a breath of much-needed fresh air.

reviews.name: Carlos Esquives
reviews.message: João Pedro Rodrigues isn't subtle in blaming repressions on colonialist heritage and in the process, he continues to pave way for diversity of expression in his homoerotic universe. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Kent Turner
reviews.message: Portuguese director João Pedro Rodrigues goes for it in the low-budget "Fogo-Fátuo," the most audacious, funniest, and unpredictable work seen at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival.

reviews.name: Guy Lodge
reviews.message: “Will-o’-the-Wisp” lives up to the flighty, elusive promise of its title, teasing its viewers in more ways than one...

reviews.name: Ryan Swen
reviews.message: Rodrigues’ concentration of his plot, his ability to elide the parts that would prevent this from taking full flight as a musical fantasy, preserves [Will-o'-the-Wisp's] strange and uncanny spell.

reviews.name: Leslie Felperin
reviews.message: Will light a lot of fires.

reviews.name: Jara Yáñez
reviews.message:
A fun celebration, sophisticated, intelligent, and rich in art… containing a powerful political potency. 
[Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Allan Hunter
reviews.message: Served up with lashings of homoeroticism, Bunuelian satire, a gay love story and an athletic dance number, its uncompromising nature will delight fans of the visionary filmmaker.

reviews.name: Charles Bramesco
reviews.message: A man on his deathbed recounts his youth as a firefighter in João Pedro Rodrigues' queer feature.

title: Close to Vermeer
description: Go behind the scenes of the largest Vermeer exhibition ever mounted, now on view at the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam. Capturing the imagination of the art world -- with glowing reviews, global publicity, and tickets sold out through the entirety of its run -- the Rijksmuseum's Vermeer retrospective is nothing short of an historic event. Suzanne Raes's film follows curators, conservators, collectors, and experts in their joint mission to shine a new light on the elusive Dutch Master. This fascinating documentary reveals everything from the quiet diplomacy required to get the Vermeers to the Netherlands and the new technical knowledge gained by scanning the paintings layer by layer, to the shocking news that one work may not be by Vermeer after all. In the process, we discover how Vermeer was able to depict reality so differently from his contemporaries. But above all, Close to Vermeer shows the infectious love Vermeer's art inspires. As one curator lovingly puts it: "A good exhibition should change your view of the world. Vermeer can really do that."

characteristics.Producer:: Ilja Roomans

title: White Balls on Walls
description: Amsterdam's Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art wants to become more diverse and inclusive. But how to go about that? An honest look behind the scenes into the sometimes-fraught process taking place in many public institutions.

characteristics.Producer:: Elize Kerseboom, Frank van den Engel

reviews.name: Clayton Dillard
reviews.message: Sarah Vos creates a nearly mockumentary effect that neither fully lampoons nor endorses contemporary standards for the art world’s political correctness but lands at a decidedly more ambivalent point.

reviews.name: Sarah Gopaul
reviews.message: This is a surprisingly candid portrayal of an organization striving to be better and recognizing that embracing their discomfort is the only way to move forward.

reviews.name: CJ Sheu
reviews.message: The proceedings keep you on tenterhooks, but nuanced discussions and good faith see them through. ... Vos ... felt it necessary to play devil’s advocate to heighten conflict. Why can’t we just watch a group of conscientious people doing something nice?

title: MobKing
description: After returning home from a lengthy prison sentence, a loyal crime family confidant quickly realizes that he and his family are the targets of the organization that he remained devoted to all of his life. In order to save his family, he must choose whether to run or fight back.

characteristics.Producer:: Antoni Corone, Jokes Yanes, Cristy Trabadass
characteristics.Writer:: Jokes Yanes, J. Bishop, Cristy Trabadass, Ciro Dapagio
characteristics.Production Co:: Button Man Films, Mainman Productions, Ciro Dapagio Films

title: Godday Godday Chaa
description: During the 1990s, women are not allowed to accompany men to baraats or attend pheras. Rani intends to put an end to this and starts building a team with other women to fight for women's rights.

characteristics.Producer:: Varun Arora

title: We Might as Well Be Dead
description: A high-rise building near the forest is famous for its carefully curated community. When a dog disappears and her daughter refuses to leave the bathroom, security officer ANNA faces an absurd battle against an irrational fear, that slowly spreads amongst the residents and rattles this utopia with a view.

characteristics.Production Co:: Kojoten Filmproduktion, Heartwake Films, Filmuniversität Babelsberg Konrad Wolf, Rundfunk Berlin-Brandenburg

reviews.name: Avi Offer
reviews.message: One of the most provocative, razor-sharp and wickedly funny satires since Triangle of Sadness and The Lobster.

reviews.name: Clint Worthington
reviews.message: We Might As Well Be Dead bubbles with the nihilism inherent to its title, and the pitch-black humor that mindset can engender.

reviews.name: Chase Hutchinson
reviews.message: We Might As Well Be Dead skewers our own potential for us all to fall prey to paranoia. All the more terrifying is that, as we see over and over again, we likely won’t heed its warning.

reviews.name: Adam Patterson
reviews.message: Chock full of social commentary, We Might As Well Be Dead is an impressive debut from director Sinelnikova.

reviews.name: Keri O'Shea
reviews.message: Through it all - this surprisingly subtle lesson about fractured social cohesion - there runs a thread of very dry, bitter humour. It feels completely appropriate, too, to quietly laugh at some of this weird, irrational, perceived vulnerability.

reviews.name: Paul Risker
reviews.message: Blessed with self-awareness, it’s an uncomfortable reflection on the human condition and how easily people are emboldened by a feeling of moral superiority and righteousness, how easily free will is seen to be a threat...

reviews.name: Nathaniel Muir
reviews.message: The film is able to sneak up on viewers with its dark humor while the social commentary hit hard. Almost light at times, the script deals with serious issues. It effortlessly weaves between genres while never losing sight of what it is trying to say.

reviews.name: Gary M. Kramer
reviews.message: A stinging social comedy. Director/cowriter Natalia Sinelnikova films everything with a sterile, detached eye—there are some terrifically framed compositions—that reveal the crucible of St. Phoebus as a hotbed for xenophobia.

reviews.name: Sharai Bohannon
reviews.message: It’s a fine film that provides a couple of laughs and plays on that mistrust of our neighbors that most of us have. It flirts with a few different genres before deciding to keep it light.

reviews.name: Douglas Davidson
reviews.message: A high wire act of tension in daylight, "We Might As Well Be Dead" is a scruples dark comedy that speaks a truth too few are ready to acknowledge and explore regarding ingrained imperialism and social bias.

reviews.name: Stephen Saito
reviews.message: Although the notion that the future is here in “We Might as Well Be Dead” is hardly hopeful, at least there’s a silver lining on the horizon when its first-time director can see it all so clearly.

reviews.name: Stephanie Archer
reviews.message: We Might As Well Be Dead presents itself initially as a whodunit, but devolves into a deep examination of the human psyche and the innate will to survive.

reviews.name: Daniel Gorman
reviews.message: We Might As Well Be Dead isn’t a slam dunk ...[but] the film thankfully never devolves into the kind of anarchic violence that characterizes many of these dystopian projects.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: Despite a strong central performance from Iacob, and some well-constructed setpieces and flourishes, We Might as Well Be Dead lacks a cutting edge, and, well, a sense of drama that left me feeling disconnected overall.

reviews.name: Lee Marshall
reviews.message: A strikingly original, elegantly shot and designed and admirably controlled dystopian satire about the world’s current retreat from rational discourse towards paranoia-fuelled tribalism.

title: NRI Wives: Grey Stories of Love Vs Desires

characteristics.Director:: Vibhu Kashyap, Ray Khan, Gunjan Kuthiala, Qaeed Kuwajerwala
characteristics.Producer:: Gunjan Kuthiala

title: The Attachment Diaries
description: Argentina, 1970s. A desperate young woman goes to a clinic to have a clandestine abortion. As her pregnancy is already through the fourth month, the doctor refuses. Instead, she proposes to sell the baby to one of her clients and offers to provide shelter in her house until the child is born. Their disturbed personalities will become intertwined in a strange and dangerous relationship.

characteristics.Producer:: Valentín Javier Diment, Vanesa Pagani

reviews.name: Avi Offer
reviews.message: A wildly entertaining, gripping, stylish and refreshingly unpredictable thriller.

reviews.name: Nathaniel Muir
reviews.message: The Attachment Diaries will keep audiences guessing with a story that covers a number of topical subjects. Despite switching genres with seemingly each changing scene, each moment becomes more suspenseful and meaningful. Amazing performances.

reviews.name: Dan Tabor
reviews.message: The Attachment Diaries is about as politically charged as any film can get in this day and age, and it does so with an amazing amount of style and pause.

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: Aesthetically impeccable and ideologically incisive. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Diego Batlle
reviews.message: At times ominous and disturbing. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Alexandra Heller-Nicholas
reviews.message: There's a fearlessness to The Attachment Diaries that sees it power ahead without letting us pause to take a breath, and its determination and originality explode on the screen in something altogether wild

reviews.name: Anton Bitel
reviews.message: Valentín Javier Diment's noirish psycho-erotic thriller takes a gynaecological view of a damaged relationship between doctor and patient

title: #MenToo
description: Men from different sections of society face discrimination from pseudo feminists. They believe men are victims too, and decide to fight back with "#MenToo" movement.

characteristics.Producer:: Mourya Siddavaram
characteristics.Writer:: Rakendu Mouli Vennelakanti, Rakendu Mouli Vennelakanti

title: Castigation
description: Family members try to outdo one another by each sharing their own stories about good versus evil. The tales become progressively sinister and have a supernatural tie that binds them all, evidenced by a final revelation. Who will win, good or evil? Who will get what they deserve? Who will receive their castigation?

characteristics.Producer:: Becky Hooter, Marty Benoit

title: Face Off 6: The Ticket of Destiny

characteristics.Producer:: V.K. Naresh

title: Skye Hoshi: Anime Girl
description: Anime character Skye Hoshi mysteriously becomes real and falls out of her poster, it's up to slacker comic store employee Atom to help her get back home before her anime is destroyed.

characteristics.Producer:: Kalani Hubbard, Stefanie Hubbard

title: Fast X
description: Over many missions and against impossible odds, Dom Toretto (Vin Diesel) and his family have outsmarted, out-nerved and outdriven every foe in their path. Now, they confront the most lethal opponent they've ever faced: A terrifying threat emerging from the shadows of the past who's fueled by blood revenge, and who is determined to shatter this family and destroy everything--and everyone--that Dom loves, forever.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Intense Sequences of Violence|Action|Language|Some Suggestive Material)
characteristics.Producer:: Neal H. Moritz, Vin Diesel, Justin Lin, Jeff Kirschenbaum, Samantha Vincent
characteristics.Production Co:: Original Film, Perfect Storm Entertainment, One Race Films

reviews.name: Wendy Lee Szany
reviews.message: Not as great as the previous Fast films but it still delivers high-octane action as one would expect (and look forward to) in a Fast film. The story gets a bit convoluted in the 3rd act, and with the party split, it was missing that family dynamic.

reviews.name: Steven Prokopy
reviews.message: As long as you keep your expectations low with Fast X, you won’t come out as disappointed as I was with this fairly crowded and standard-issue entry.

reviews.name: Dulcie Pearce
reviews.message: While Diesel still has the acting range of a flat battery — and no one ever wears a seatbelt yet they come out of collisions unscathed — it’s still one hell of a ride on the big screen.

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: If action/adventure fans are willing to throw logic out the window, they’ll like what they see.

reviews.name: Kate Rodger
reviews.message: There's nothing much left in the tank. Cars and humans are entirely indestructible, our heroes time and time again emerge from certain incineration without a scratch or blister -- the sheer ridiculousness matched only by my sheer boredom.

reviews.name: Tom Meek
reviews.message: The series that keeps on grinding away even though the creativity tank hit E a few chapters back.

reviews.name: Frantz Jerome
reviews.message: It’s amazing. It does everything it says it will do and there are no upper (or lower) limits to what this franchise will do to center family over everything.

reviews.name: Paul Salfen
reviews.message: Of course you know it's going to be fantastical, a little silly, and completely unrealistic, but this is the kind of big screen popcorn flick we like to go to the movies and see.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: A big, loud, dumb sequel that feels like it’s taking the franchise down a dead end from which it will never return, but ridiculous action scenes and an iconic performance from Jason Momoa save the day.

reviews.name: Mike Ryan
reviews.message: Honestly, I’d be surprised if it even ends there. We will probably get five more last Fast movies. Why even keep up the charade that these are ending? Let’s just all admit these will never end.

reviews.name: Nicholas Barber
reviews.message: Leterrier's achievement in assembling such a gargantuan, multi-stranded, globe-trotting, head-spinning blockbuster is impressive, but however many gruff sermons Dom makes about his family, it's impossible to care about any of it.

reviews.name: Robert Denerstein
reviews.message: Your job, should you choose to accept it. Sit through a movie that batters as much as at buoys and which has gotten so stuffed, it barely has room to accommodate the characters that once gave it a bit of humanity.

reviews.name: KT Mahe
reviews.message: Fast X keeps its hands on the wheel for another bombastic addition to the family! Rump shaking, fist pumping and explosive!

reviews.name: Oti
reviews.message: Successfully upholds the Fast & Furious franchise's legacy with expertly choreographed, high-octane action. An exhilarating cinematic experience; thoroughly engaging.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Like the Marvel franchise, this series has driven itself into a dead end, giving the audience what they want without anything new or surprising.

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: The action sequences, fight scenes, and redundant head-scratching returns of characters are overdone to the point of exhaustion. That includes Momoa’s much-heralded villainous turn.

reviews.name: Sebastian Zavala Kahn
reviews.message: It's a LOT of movie, favouring quantity over quality. More characters, more Hollywood stars, more fights, more explosions, more digital effects, more flashbacks, more actions that defy the laws of physics... more everything! Full review in Spanish.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: The plot is too bloated by an enlarged cast, all of whom demand moments to shine in the sun, and a desire to outdo the prior installment's over the top special effects.

reviews.name: Tom Shone
reviews.message: And the two action set pieces that bookend its story are too wonderfully over the top to be spoilt by Louis Leterrier’s pell-mell direction.

reviews.name: Nick Johnston
reviews.message: What Fast X embodies is the often-goofy amiability of the American blockbuster, and the innate charm that still gives it global appeal without the requisite amount of compromises that may assume it may need in our world-spanning modern cinema.

reviews.name: TK Burton
reviews.message: Fast X is unquestionably fun, even when it’s at its most unbelievable. With each passing sequence, you find yourself somewhere between rolling your eyes and grinning, knowing how preposterous it is and yet forgiving it anyway.

reviews.name: Abhishek Sharma
reviews.message: It’s not the characters but the situation they are thrown into that’s grand, and to experience it in a theatre is enjoyable.

reviews.name: Alci Rengifo
reviews.message: The end of the line is becoming much more glaring as the tank truly starts running out of gas.

reviews.name: Kristy Puchko
reviews.message: This is what summer movies should be! It's spectacular! It's thrilling! And it's the kind of movie you can't wait to yammer about to your friends. Truly, I walked out of Fast X with a big Momoa smile on my face, so wide it hurt.

reviews.name: James Marsh
reviews.message: It is business as usual, as this unwieldy beast of a movie jet-sets around the world, destroying everything in its path, while ensuring sufficient screen time for each member of its bloated, star-studded cast.

reviews.name: Allen Almachar
reviews.message: There is no sense of revelation, no sense of surprise or burst of creative energy. Instead of seeing something new and exciting, we’re served yesterday’s leftovers.

reviews.name: Patrick Hicks
reviews.message: Big, loud and very self aware, the latest FF entry is both fun & frustrating. No longer about good storytelling, stakes are low, stupidity is high, and burnout is starting to set in. It's time for the franchise to end.

reviews.name: Emily Wheeler
reviews.message: A garish celebration.

reviews.name: James Berardinelli
reviews.message: Despite boasting a healthy 141-minute running time, Fast X is not a complete movie.

reviews.name: Michael Ward
reviews.message: Written, it seems, from the mind of an 8-year-old...

reviews.name: Korey Coleman
reviews.message: These movies are all starting to repeat themselves. Watch this one for the spectacle and Jason Momoa, who is straight up a comic book supervillain.

reviews.name: Kat Hughes
reviews.message: Fast X hits all the expected (and now familiar) tropes and beats, but this being the first in a multi-movie story, it is ultimately a little underwhelming… but regardless, we will all return for the next chapter like the dutiful cult members we are.

reviews.name: Candice McMillan
reviews.message: [Jason Momoa] is the glorious future of the Fast franchise, and we are furious it took this long for his debut.

reviews.name: Miles Surrey
reviews.message: The increasingly predictable, self-referential nature of the storytelling makes every subsequent film feel like a parody of itself—the cinematic equivalent of drifting around in circles.

reviews.name: Vincent Mancini
reviews.message: Discount action movie slurry.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …the cheerful gang-show mentality still invests Fast and Furious franchise entries with an easy-going, undemanding guilty-pleasure charm, but it’s wearing a little thin by movie ten…

reviews.name: Harris Dang
reviews.message: Even with the lack of family togetherness, resolve and behind-the-scenes faults, Fast X delivers exactly what fans would expect in terms of action and absurdity while surprising us with an entertainingly over-the-top Jason Momoa performance.

reviews.name: Kip Mooney
reviews.message: Just when I thought this series was out of gas, Fast X hit the nitrous boost.

reviews.name: Abby Olcese
reviews.message: Much of Fast X is lots of fun, and the dynamics between the characters are as satisfying as ever

reviews.name: Micheal Compton
reviews.message: Is Fast X a good movie? Probably not. But is it a good time, that delivers exactly what the audience wants? Most definitely.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3
description: In Marvel Studios "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3" our beloved band of misfits are looking a bit different these days. Peter Quill, still reeling from the loss of Gamora, must rally his team around him to defend the universe along with protecting one of their own. A mission that, if not completed successfully, could quite possibly lead to the end of the Guardians as we know them.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Intense Sequences of Violence|Action|Strong Language|Suggestive/Drug References|Thematic Elements)
characteristics.Producer:: Kevin Feige

reviews.name: Suchin Mehrotra
reviews.message: An immensely satisfying send off to James Gunn's Guardians.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: The animals are cute, but the action is predictable and inconsequential as the Marvel Universe struggles to find a footing into the realm originality as it enters 30+ films.

reviews.name: James Mottram
reviews.message: It’s not perfect, but for big, dumb MCU fun the Guardians still deliver.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is going to have the same effect on today’s kids that Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom had on kids in the 80s, and I mean that as the highest compliment.

reviews.name: Kip Mooney
reviews.message: This third volume [is] a mixed bag.

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: The first strong effort from Marvel in a while, as the Rocket story drives the plot, and attaches real stakes in a way these film usually don’t.

reviews.name: Kent Garrison
reviews.message: Why am I crying about a raccoon?

reviews.name: Rachel Ho
reviews.message: Boy, does Gunn come out guns blazing.

reviews.name: Luis Bond
reviews.message: Gunn says goodbye to Marvel Studios in style, leaving his wake in the genre and giving us a valuable personal lesson that we must never forget: we all deserve a second chance [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Chris Sawin
reviews.message: Tearfully moving with bonkers humor, Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 gives the world’s most bad ass trash panda from space the most meaningful film in a trilogy overrun with super heroic and perfection obsessed a-holes.

reviews.name: Matt Donato
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a tailor-fitted exit for James Gunn from Marvel’s Cinematic Universe ... the Gunniest Guardians yet in the best way.

reviews.name: Marie Asner
reviews.message: The heart of the film, though, is Rocket.

reviews.name: Josh Flanders
reviews.message: While better than most recent Marvel or DC films, it definitely lacks the fun, buddy-film aspects and sincere relationships of the original in lieu of an exhausting mission-based story.

reviews.name: Sarah El-Mahmoud
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is another stylish, laugh-out-loud, offbeat and most of all, Awesome Mix of being something beautifully human and alien at the same time.

reviews.name: Matt Singer
reviews.message: Completes Rocket’ transformation from a footnote to one of Marvel’ greatest characters.

reviews.name: Ryan McQuade
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 was surprisingly emotional and has some nice finality for James Gunn.

reviews.name: Christy Lemire
reviews.message: Too often it feels like James Gunn made a playlist of songs he likes and then came up with scenes to go with them.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: If this is the last episode of the series (could that really be true?), it’s done with great care and concern. Director James Gunn knows how to fire up the faithful. Now, he just needs to point out who they are.

reviews.name: Kathia Woods
reviews.message: The heart and soul of Guardians has always been the camaraderie of the cast.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: What if the real raccoons are the friends we made along the way?

reviews.name: Rosa Parra
reviews.message: “Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3” is the perfect conclusion to this group of superheroes who “take ass and kick names.” A heartfelt farewell to the most grounded and memorable family in film

reviews.name: Lynn Venhaus
reviews.message: ,,,having this motley crew back together one more time has deepened their ties, softened their tough exteriors, and created playful exchanges that enhance what is a dense and convoluted story.

reviews.name: Ray Pride
reviews.message: A joyous sweetheart of a movie; even better is that it plays like a movie, not a Marvel product...  What’s it about? Raccoons and kindness. And gleefully bad gags. Gunn’s sheer competence soars alongside his customary monumental goofiness.

reviews.name: Wenlei Ma
reviews.message: Guardians 3 is a real warm and fuzzy movie that sometimes makes you forget that you’re a bit bored with the onslaught of superhero movies.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: A goofy and incohesive adventure tale of an intergalactic band of artificially created misfits.

reviews.name: Carla Renata
reviews.message: Chukwudi Iwuji as The High Evolutionary commands the screen and upstages everyone on it each and every time he appears with mad scientist vibes disguised as compassion making him more than compelling to watch. Oh yeaH!  That soundtrack is absolute fire!

reviews.name: Tony Baker
reviews.message: Rocket is already my favorite Guardian, so now to see how he became who he became --  it's heartbreaking.

reviews.name: Abby Olcese
reviews.message: If you’re looking for a way to conclude your relationship with Marvel’s most vibrant characters, this is it. Given signs of diminishing returns here, it’s also a good example of quitting while you’re ahead.

reviews.name: Robert Roten
reviews.message: There is plenty of humor, along with a bit of romance, some cliffhangers, some pathos and a lot of action in this fast-paced story. It is a good example of why Marvel movies are so popular.

reviews.name: Valerie Kalfrin
reviews.message: an eclectic and affectionate mixtape that’s funny, thrilling, shattering, and bittersweet.

reviews.name: Theolin Tembo
reviews.message: Ultimately, Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a thoroughly enjoyable film that, while it works best for those who have followed the franchise, it does also work as a film you can watch without context.

reviews.name: Omar Holmon
reviews.message: There was always something that was funny, witty, or heart wrenching that covered for any cliché that appeared.

reviews.name: Beth Accomando
reviews.message: I was surprised by how sad, emotional, and dark this third film was.

reviews.name: Kevin A. Ranson
reviews.message: Gunn is committed to viewers understanding the horrors of being unmade and remade, inflicting a level of emotion and empathy few Marvel movies have achieved and earning every bit of crass humor as necessary moments to catch your breath.

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Under the aegis of writer/director James Gunn, Rocket Raccoon's origin story turns out to be heavy-handed and bizarrely grotesque.

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: Be forewarned, it’s a slog for the first 90 minutes of its 2h 30m length. Then real energy kicks in.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: Despite the film’s bloated length and tendency to embrace nostalgia without an ounce of moderation, it’s a fitting and heartfelt sendoff for the beloved crew of misfit mercenaries.

reviews.name: Mark Jackson
reviews.message: Garish, with an over-prolonged animal version of Sid's creepy, mutant, cobbled-together, depressing toys from "Toy Story," it's got enough animal abuse for your kids to eventually need therapy sessions. Director Gunn's gone. Somebody bring back the fun.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: It isn’t top-tier Marvel but it’s damn solid with some great gags and action throughout. Compared to recent MCU releases, however, it’s a rousing success.

reviews.name: Sandie Angulo Chen
reviews.message: Writer-director James Gunn knows how to make this ragtag bunch work, but there's a layer of sadness that envelops the proceedings, despite the many laugh-out-loud moments.

title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie
description: With help from Princess Peach, Mario gets ready to square off against the all-powerful Bowser to stop his plans from conquering the world.

characteristics.Producer:: Christopher Meledandri, Shigeru Miyamoto

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: Sometimes I get the feeling that the adventure of Mario and Luigi never goes beyond the routine level. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Suchin Mehrotra
reviews.message: A harmless, generic blur of kid’s 'content'.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: Harmless; it amounts to a Burger King kid’s meal and night of Nintendo 64. I’m not sure Illumination will ever take one single risk, but I do think their cheery, color-splosion style for 7-year-olds works for a movie about Super Mario Bros.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It’s easy to be of two minds about the movie, because it’s lively, expertly animated, energetic, lightly amusing and modestly ambitious.

reviews.name: Justin Brown
reviews.message: I think it did a good job of appealing to both older and younger fans of the "Mario" video game franchise. It hit all of the points and gave you all the IP that a viewer could have wanted. That's why it's such a huge hit.

reviews.name: Brandon Collins
reviews.message: I didn't have high expectations but do feel like it could have gone a bit deeper beyond eye candy and easter eggs. However it is enjoyable as a kids movie meant to hit all expected Illumination tropes.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: Our heroes have to make alliances, gather an army, defeat the Boss. Powerups, jumping, running, battling Kongs, Penguins, Koopa Troopas, and Shy Guys. If it was an NPC (non-playable character), you’re probably going to see it. That’s it, that’s the movie.

reviews.name: Nestor Bentancor
reviews.message:
The movie accomplishes the main goal of being entertaining for the whole family. 
Not 'super,' but definetfly 'It's a go!' [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Sarah Knight Adamson
reviews.message: "The Super Mario Bros. Movie" unfortunately borrowed Guy Ritchie’s playbook from his disaster of a movie “Aladdin,” yep, there’s torture in ” Mario Bros,” just as in “Aladdin,”teaches kids to bully to get their way...nope, not on my watch.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Thankfully improving on the atrocious live action flick, the animated adventure film is a nice 90-minute diversion. The adults who once were kids and loved this game will get a kick out of this much-better game adaptation. Their kids will love it.

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Older fans might be disappointed in the surface-level storytelling, but it’s hard not to smile at the affection shown for the games’ legacy.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: Viewers expecting a Pixar-level film were asking too much of the folks who brought you such classics as "Banana" and "Minion in a thong." It's fun, visually impressive, and, most of all, harmless.

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: ... The quality of the offering is questionable from multiple angles.

reviews.name: Víctor López G.
reviews.message: A sort of dream come true for the fans of the mustached plumber, full of easter-eggs, details and devotion, but weighed down by a narrative foundation that's fragile enough to bury its commendable efforts to entertain.

reviews.name: Carla Renata
reviews.message: With its message to siblings everywhere of nothing can hurt us as long as we're together,  The Super Mario Brothers movie is endearing, great fun for families to ingest and enjoy as one.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: Mario delivers on looks and nostalgia, and whilst there is enough for adults and kids to enjoy here, a deeper story seems to have been kept in another castle.

reviews.name: Adam Olinger
reviews.message: I'm not sure what high-art some of these critics are looking for but The Super Mario Bros. movie works for both fans of the long-lasting game franchise and people who want an entertaining escape. This is the best video game movie yet!

reviews.name: Peter Travers
reviews.message: This lively computer-animated take on the video game just opened and it’s already the biggest box-office smash of 2023. Despite lapses into dull and disposable, it’s also a godsend for parents seeking family entertainment for the 5-year-old in all of us.

reviews.name: Collin Garbarino
reviews.message: Adults with fond memories of dodging turtle shells in the ’80s and ’90s won’t mind watching the movie with their children, many of whom have dodged turtle shells in updated versions of those classic games.

reviews.name: Rubén Rosario
reviews.message: Memo to directors Aaron Horvath and Michael Jelenic: seeing corporate symbols go through the motions of a half-baked story isn't much fun.

reviews.name: Jason Escamilla
reviews.message: Encapsulates charming classic video game characters within a fun, yet generic, plot that has a cult-classic worthy song stuffed in the middle and doesn’t overstay its welcome.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: It's very entertaining for children and Nintendo fans, but the story is as deep as a Super Mario puddle and the throwaway references too sparse to even matter.

reviews.name: Kent Garrison
reviews.message: Packed full of nostalgic Mario references for all ages, and it's just fun to see these colorful worlds on the big screen.

reviews.name: Joe Friar
reviews.message: Fun and entertaining.  The film will appeal most to fans of the video games and young kids. The animation is so true to the Nintendo franchise that you may feel lost without a controller,

reviews.name: Casey Chong
reviews.message: The Super Mario Bros. Movie has a few worthwhile moments but it wasn’t enough to overcome the sheer banality of its storyline

reviews.name: Sean Chandler
reviews.message: The script may be thin, but getting to spend 90 minutes in this world of Mario certainly put a smile on my face and made me feel like a kid again.

reviews.name: Candice McMillan
reviews.message: You don’t have to blow the dust out of this cartridge; Mario is ready to jump, high kick and spin back into action. Let’s-a-go!

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Scripted by Matthew Fogel and directed by Andrew Horvath & Michael Jelenic, this hectic, fun-filled origin story has redeemed the Nintendo franchise's reputation after its catastrophic 1993 live-action movie adaptation.

reviews.name: Grant Watson
reviews.message: If you’re a kid who spends half your time on a Nintendo Switch and the other half watching cartoons, there is plenty in Super Mario Bros to satisfy. If you’re the parent of such a kid, who are you to tell them what they should and shouldn’t be enjoying?

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
