reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It’s easy to be of two minds about the movie, because it’s lively, expertly animated, energetic, lightly amusing and modestly ambitious.

reviews.name: Justin Brown
reviews.message: I think it did a good job of appealing to both older and younger fans of the "Mario" video game franchise. It hit all of the points and gave you all the IP that a viewer could have wanted. That's why it's such a huge hit.

reviews.name: Brandon Collins
reviews.message: I didn't have high expectations but do feel like it could have gone a bit deeper beyond eye candy and easter eggs. However it is enjoyable as a kids movie meant to hit all expected Illumination tropes.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: Our heroes have to make alliances, gather an army, defeat the Boss. Powerups, jumping, running, battling Kongs, Penguins, Koopa Troopas, and Shy Guys. If it was an NPC (non-playable character), you’re probably going to see it. That’s it, that’s the movie.

reviews.name: Nestor Bentancor
reviews.message:
The movie accomplishes the main goal of being entertaining for the whole family. 
Not 'super,' but definetfly 'It's a go!' [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Sarah Knight Adamson
reviews.message: "The Super Mario Bros. Movie" unfortunately borrowed Guy Ritchie’s playbook from his disaster of a movie “Aladdin,” yep, there’s torture in ” Mario Bros,” just as in “Aladdin,”teaches kids to bully to get their way...nope, not on my watch.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Thankfully improving on the atrocious live action flick, the animated adventure film is a nice 90-minute diversion. The adults who once were kids and loved this game will get a kick out of this much-better game adaptation. Their kids will love it.

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Older fans might be disappointed in the surface-level storytelling, but it’s hard not to smile at the affection shown for the games’ legacy.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: Viewers expecting a Pixar-level film were asking too much of the folks who brought you such classics as "Banana" and "Minion in a thong." It's fun, visually impressive, and, most of all, harmless.

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: ... The quality of the offering is questionable from multiple angles.

reviews.name: Víctor López G.
reviews.message: A sort of dream come true for the fans of the mustached plumber, full of easter-eggs, details and devotion, but weighed down by a narrative foundation that's fragile enough to bury its commendable efforts to entertain.

reviews.name: Carla Renata
reviews.message: With its message to siblings everywhere of nothing can hurt us as long as we're together,  The Super Mario Brothers movie is endearing, great fun for families to ingest and enjoy as one.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: Mario delivers on looks and nostalgia, and whilst there is enough for adults and kids to enjoy here, a deeper story seems to have been kept in another castle.

reviews.name: Adam Olinger
reviews.message: I'm not sure what high-art some of these critics are looking for but The Super Mario Bros. movie works for both fans of the long-lasting game franchise and people who want an entertaining escape. This is the best video game movie yet!

reviews.name: Peter Travers
reviews.message: This lively computer-animated take on the video game just opened and it’s already the biggest box-office smash of 2023. Despite lapses into dull and disposable, it’s also a godsend for parents seeking family entertainment for the 5-year-old in all of us.

reviews.name: Collin Garbarino
reviews.message: Adults with fond memories of dodging turtle shells in the ’80s and ’90s won’t mind watching the movie with their children, many of whom have dodged turtle shells in updated versions of those classic games.

reviews.name: Rubén Rosario
reviews.message: Memo to directors Aaron Horvath and Michael Jelenic: seeing corporate symbols go through the motions of a half-baked story isn't much fun.

reviews.name: Jason Escamilla
reviews.message: Encapsulates charming classic video game characters within a fun, yet generic, plot that has a cult-classic worthy song stuffed in the middle and doesn’t overstay its welcome.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: It's very entertaining for children and Nintendo fans, but the story is as deep as a Super Mario puddle and the throwaway references too sparse to even matter.

reviews.name: Kent Garrison
reviews.message: Packed full of nostalgic Mario references for all ages, and it's just fun to see these colorful worlds on the big screen.

reviews.name: Joe Friar
reviews.message: Fun and entertaining.  The film will appeal most to fans of the video games and young kids. The animation is so true to the Nintendo franchise that you may feel lost without a controller,

reviews.name: Casey Chong
reviews.message: The Super Mario Bros. Movie has a few worthwhile moments but it wasn’t enough to overcome the sheer banality of its storyline

reviews.name: Sean Chandler
reviews.message: The script may be thin, but getting to spend 90 minutes in this world of Mario certainly put a smile on my face and made me feel like a kid again.

reviews.name: Candice McMillan
reviews.message: You don’t have to blow the dust out of this cartridge; Mario is ready to jump, high kick and spin back into action. Let’s-a-go!

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Scripted by Matthew Fogel and directed by Andrew Horvath & Michael Jelenic, this hectic, fun-filled origin story has redeemed the Nintendo franchise's reputation after its catastrophic 1993 live-action movie adaptation.

reviews.name: Grant Watson
reviews.message: If you’re a kid who spends half your time on a Nintendo Switch and the other half watching cartoons, there is plenty in Super Mario Bros to satisfy. If you’re the parent of such a kid, who are you to tell them what they should and shouldn’t be enjoying?

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: Okay for the adults and a pure delight for the kids.

reviews.name: John Wilmes
reviews.message: Among the many errors of The Super Mario Bros. Movie, screenwriter Matthew Fogel plops him and his brother Luigi into a milquetoast Brooklyn family that doubts them and disrespects their small-business dreams.

reviews.name: Andre Meadows
reviews.message: I've been wanting a Super Mario Brothers movie like this for a long time... I was smiling the entire time I was watching this movie.

reviews.name: Mat Brunet
reviews.message: Is this the greatest movie that is worth all those years of hype and anticipation? Honestly, no. Is it still a fun adventure to see the beloved games adapted to the big screen? Oh, absolutely!

reviews.name: Sheraz Farooqi
reviews.message: Crisp animation, mostly strong voice acting and fun for the entire family. No doubt Mario is a juggernaut franchise for Illumination and Universal. But overall, The Super Mario Bros. Movie is nothing groundbreaking and can be very generic thematically.

reviews.name: Megan Williams
reviews.message: The Super Mario Bros. Movie is a very enjoyable and fun film.

reviews.name: Omar Holmon
reviews.message: This is a movie for adults, children, teens, and anyone that ever rocked with them Mario Bros.

reviews.name: Morgan Shaunette
reviews.message: Older moviegoers will likely be turned off by the simplicity of it all, but for fans who are young or young at heart, it’s an entertaining trip down the warp pipe.

reviews.name: Carson Timar
reviews.message: The Super Mario Bros. Movie is the Illumination style done at its absolute worst.

reviews.name: Sara Clements
reviews.message: While Mario has never been about its story, that doesn’t translate well to film. It misses the opportunity to expand upon its lore and characters in new ways. If it doesn’t take a Super Mushroom for next time, this franchise won’t stay fun for long.

reviews.name: Michelle Kisner
reviews.message: Captures the fun and whimsy that Nintendo is known for.

title: White Men Can't Jump
description: From 20th Century Studios, the all-new comedy "White Men Can't Jump" is a modern remix of the iconic 1992 film that celebrates the streetball hustling culture of Los Angeles. Multi-platinum rap superstar Jack Harlow makes his movie debut as Jeremy, a former star of the game whose injuries stalled his career, and Sinqua Walls stars as Kamal, once a promising player who derailed his own future in the sport. Juggling tenuous relationships, financial pressures and serious internal struggles, the two ballers--opposites who are seemingly miles apart--find they might have more in common than they imagined possible.

characteristics.Producer:: Kenya Barris, Paul Hall
characteristics.Production Co:: Khalabo Ink Society, Mortal Media, 20th Century Studios

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: As is, this update jumps, but never high enough.

reviews.name: Brandon Zachary
reviews.message: White Men Can't Jump is a solid (if predictable) sports film that works as intended -- even if it doesn't reach the heights of the original.

reviews.name: Tom Meek
reviews.message: Not sure that a remake of the 1992 Ron Shelton sports curio starring Woody Harrelson and Wesley Snipes was necessary, but this updating is passable enough to make the bench.

reviews.name: Valerie Complex
reviews.message: These remakes have an abysmal track record. First House Party was a dud, and now this? When are these films going to get better?!

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: Doesn’t aspire to be anything but a serviceable portion of nineties nostalgia.

reviews.name: Seth Freilich
reviews.message: The new White Men Can’t Jump is not a terrible movie; it is a flat nothing. It’s not a good sports movie, nor is it a good comedy. It’s just an unfunny thing that viewers will likely forget about before they even get to the credits.

reviews.name: Joshua Rivera
reviews.message: White Men Can’t Jump focuses squarely on basketball and lets its characters recede into near-nothingness.

reviews.name: Robert Levin
reviews.message: Stick with the original.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: I'm still trying to figure out why they even bothered calling it "White Men Can't Jump" considering how little it has in common with the considerably better original.

reviews.name: Wendy Ide
reviews.message: It’s fine. But the abrasive edges of the original have been smoothed in favour of a safer, more generic template sport movie approach.

reviews.name: Steven Warner
reviews.message: Director Calmatic and writer Kenya Barris — he of Black-ish fame — have no interest in probing the state of basketball in the 21st century or the role that race plays both on and off the court.

reviews.name: Jonathan W. Hickman
reviews.message: Calmatic may call this version “a whole new twist, a whole remix,” but, instead, he’s retained the weakest parts of the source inspiration, and jacked up the title.

reviews.name: Frank Swietek
reviews.message: A sitcom quality script...turns what had been a smart, raucous comedy into a hoops soap opera with a few chuckles where a stream of laughs should be.

reviews.name: James Croot
reviews.message: Even the Air Bud franchise offered better basketball entertainment than this farrago.

reviews.name: Kevin Carr
reviews.message: Bland, spiritless and dull, this features characters that are irritating at best and unforgettable at worst.

reviews.name: Brian Lowry
reviews.message: At its best this White Men Can’t Jump conveys the fragility of hoop dreams, while tackling what former players do with their lives once the promise of signing bonuses and sponsorship deals appears to have fizzled.

reviews.name: Fico Cangiano
reviews.message: Not even the "basketball" in White Men Can't Jump can save this airball of a remake. Devoid of any of the charm, jokes or performances that made the original work. Pass. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Rachel Leishman
reviews.message: It’s easy to bring a friendship to life onscreen. The challenge is making your audience care about it, and White Men Can’t Jump manages to make Jeremy and Kamal’s friendship something worth watching.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: The film is by no means an inspired reinvention of the original, but it gives us two guys worth rooting for, and sometimes, that’s enough.

reviews.name: Ferdosa Abdi
reviews.message: White Men Can’t Jump is failed by the inadequacies of its creative team, as it's not funny enough to justify its existence nor poignant enough.

reviews.name: Luke Y. Thompson
reviews.message: Weak Remakes Don’t Soar

reviews.name: Edward Porter
reviews.message: The film-maker known simply as Calmatic has directed a genial but easily forgotten movie.

reviews.name: Robert Daniels
reviews.message: The film is as unimaginative as it is corny, as dull as it is cheap, and as unfulfilling as any cash grab for a well-known property could be.

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: While the gameplay is realistic, the format is less immersive with 5-on-5 basketball. The 2-on-2 tournament was better at showing the bond between the two heroes as Billy and Sidney couldn’t rely on three other teammates; they had to rely on each other.

reviews.name: Chris Vognar
reviews.message: The new movie feels about as genuine as a bad team claiming innocence as it tanks for lottery position.

reviews.name: Todd Jorgenson
reviews.message: Coasting on the authentic rapport of its two stars and some convincing hoops action, the film softens the edges of the original without taking the material in a meaningful new direction.

reviews.name: Nina Metz
reviews.message: Hoop dreams, indeed.

reviews.name: Nate Adams
reviews.message: An airless, Disneyfied remake meant to jumpstart rapper Jack Harlow’s acting career, the modern day spin of “White Men Can’t Jump” makes for a pretty lousy game of basketball.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Lyles
reviews.message: Very much has its own vibe that makes for an unexpectedly pleasant surprise and a huge win for remake fans.

reviews.name: Casey Chong
reviews.message: A decent but bloated remake of 1992 basketball-comedy classic.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: While this remake struggles to capture the electricity of the original, it succeeds through its empathetic depictions of its characters and their struggles.

reviews.name: Mark Dujsik
reviews.message: If there's a reason these filmmakers felt creatively driven to remake ... [the] 1992 film, the new version of White Men Can't Jump never reveals it.

reviews.name: John Nguyen
reviews.message: [2023's White Men Can't Jump] is just a very bland movie.

reviews.name: Gary M. Kramer
reviews.message: The main reasons this update throws a brick is because the miscast Harlow is hardly the charming rascal that Harrelson's character, Billy Hoyle, was.

reviews.name: Russ Simmons
reviews.message: It won’t make you forget the original, but the new version of “White Men Can’t Jump” is a cheerfully cheeky sports comedy.

reviews.name: William Bibbiani
reviews.message: A stripped down, conventional, mediocre version of a story that used to be anything but.

reviews.name: Nick Allen
reviews.message: Calmatic’s “White Men Can’t Jump” can feel as boxed-in as playing inside a gym.

reviews.name: Robert Kojder
reviews.message: Between this and January’s House Party remake, Calmatic can’t make good movies. White Men Can't Jump is so bafflingly bad that even the title doesn't make sense in this version

reviews.name: Adam Graham
reviews.message: Walls and Harlow go together like wallpaper and toothpaste, or like jalapenos and Twinkies. In short, they don't go together, which makes for a pretty sloppy game of pick-up basketball.

reviews.name: Mike McGranaghan
reviews.message: This isn’t just one of 2023’s worst pictures, it’s one of the worst remakes ever produced.

title: The Mother
description: A deadly female assassin comes out of hiding to protect the daughter that she gave up years before, while on the run from dangerous men.

characteristics.Producer:: Marc Evans, Elaine Goldsmith-Thomas, Misha Green, Roy Lee, Jennifer Lopez, Benny Medina, Miri Yoon
characteristics.Writer:: Andrea Berloff, Peter Craig, Misha Green

reviews.name: Whang Yee Ling
reviews.message: [This] over-familiar actioner is forgettable.

reviews.name: Robert W. Butler
reviews.message: What’s really depressing is the name behind the camera. “The Mother” was directed by Niki Caro, whose earliest efforts (Whale Rider, North Country) suggested a major talent in humanist cinema.

reviews.name: Tom Meek
reviews.message: The no-nonsense Lopez holds the standard issue together and the action, as directed by Niki Caro, clicks by with the rapid-fire confidence of Lopez’s mom on the trigger.

reviews.name: Walter Chaw
reviews.message: The best modern iterations of this kind of movie are The Long Kiss Goodnight and Aliens. I wonder if my overall fatigue with the genre isn't a product of my searching for those highs again in the intervening, largely disappointing decades.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...a decidedly erratic piece of work that fares best in its exciting, action-packed opening stretch...

reviews.name: Jennifer Green
reviews.message: But even her fierce prowess -- and unfailing good looks while fighting, chasing, and slaughtering -- can't quite save The Mother from feeling like an amalgam of existing action films.

reviews.name: Sherin Nicole
reviews.message: The Mother nearly works but there are gaps in the story, as though long sequences are missing, making for a movie that is as emotionally distant as its lead.

reviews.name: Rex Reed
reviews.message: This forgettable action thriller is thoroughly derivative.

reviews.name: James Marsh
reviews.message: A textbook example of a star vehicle, The Mother is competently executed and intermittently engaging, but is elevated only by Lopez’s presence.

reviews.name: Cristina Escobar
reviews.message: Lopez has more than earned the right to be the star, to put great men in supporting roles, and tell a story that unapologetically centers her.

reviews.name: Stephanie Archer
reviews.message: Despite well-choreographed action and a gritty performance from Jennifer Lopez, The Mother is not the Mother’s Day vehicle Netflix had hoped it would be.

reviews.name: Mark Jackson
reviews.message: Lopez easily has the goods to do a late career segue into action hero mode, but would appear to need a new agent and/or manager to help arrest  the piling-up of bad movie vehicles that waste her prodigious talent.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Lopez does her best to deadlift the most bland of action thriller material, but it's all too familiar in the end. Save this for a late night snooze button, unless you are a J. Lo addict.

reviews.name: Austin Burke
reviews.message: Jennifer Lopez carries a fairly lackluster action-thriller, even though the emotional core is interesting. Beyond the main relationship, there isn’t much that will resonate with viewers.

reviews.name: Charles Koplinski
reviews.message: Not only does she give a one-note performance, but it’s off-key as well.

reviews.name: Aaron Neuwirth
reviews.message: Director Niki Caro is not the name I would have expected to be associated with this, but here we are with a movie that is not beyond her capabilities but comes up lacking when considering the script.

reviews.name: Wade Major
reviews.message: Niki Caro is such a better director than this, and that's what's so disappointing.

reviews.name: Andy Klein
reviews.message: It's awful... It had chase sequences with some of the worst action cutting I've ever seen.

reviews.name: Graeme Tuckett
reviews.message: This is a solid and enjoyable enough movie. If Caro and Lopez do get to launch a series, or an Equalizer-style trilogy, I'll be here for it.

reviews.name: Gregory Wakeman
reviews.message: When The Mother does eventually settle down, and we get some genuine moments of characterisation and emotion that make those involved feel like real people, the film immediately starts to become much more effective.

reviews.name: Leigh Paatsch
reviews.message: Take Jennifer Lopez out of this stilted and inconsistent action pic and it would bore the pants off anyone unlucky enough to clap eyes on it.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Maternal instincts add some engaging complications to this lively gender-flipped variation on Taken.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: The Mother, for the most part, is a complete misfire. It’s forgettable, clumsy and dull. Its worst quality is the complete lack of potential; its script consists purely of cliches, and it’s hard to see anyone make this into a decent feature film.

reviews.name: Mel Valentin
reviews.message: ... while a derivative script ... goes where too many action-thrillers have gone before, Caro’s efficient, economic direction helps to overcome The Mother’s periodic speed bumps, logic lapses, and momentum hits.

reviews.name: Petr Navovy
reviews.message: It wasn’t long before things took a slow and unfortunate tumble off a steep cliff, however, and after the first ten minutes or so The Mother turns into a drag.

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: Though the film doesn't offer anything new to the genre, it finds in Jennifer López a relentless warrior akin to her male peers of yesteryear. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jesse Hassenger
reviews.message: The Mother doesn’t survive a mid-movie shift; in true Netflix fashion, it feels like an algorithm recalibrates it to enhance its emotional impact.

reviews.name: Todd McCarthy
reviews.message: Lopez and Caro seem very much in sync as they relate the sprawling tale in a disciplined manner that maintains interest and curiosity, if not high levels of downright excitement.

reviews.name: Pete Volk
reviews.message: A missed opportunity to redefine a generational star as a bona fide action hero.

reviews.name: Diego Peralta
reviews.message: While [Niki Caro's] experience with action seems to come to life during glimpses of brilliance in The Mother, it’s not enough to save the movie from a disappointing monotony.

reviews.name: Noel Murray
reviews.message: From scene to scene, Lopez and Caro do fill these broad outlines with real feeling, bringing a personal touch to old pulp archetypes.

reviews.name: Pablo O. Scholz
reviews.message: Jennifer didn't deserve a film like this. One where she usually looks very serious, very pretty, very motherly, and is very underused. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Natasha Alvar
reviews.message: Jennifer Lopez proves that she can handle any genre: from rom-coms to action movies, she can do it all. The Mother becomes highly watchable because of her efforts.

reviews.name: Leo Brady
reviews.message: It’s not interesting enough for us to care, it’s not exciting enough for anything memorable, and it is all forgotten soon after it ends. This is unfortunately one bad mother.

reviews.name: Lyra Hale
reviews.message: [The Mother] positions Jennifer Lopez as the hero who is jaded, fiercely loyal, and who is trying her best, even when it’s awkwardly handing her kid a snow globe in a deserted gas station because she wants to show she cares in her own unique way.

reviews.name: Amon Warmann
reviews.message: This is a come-for-Lopez, stay-for-Lopez endeavour, and she’s on fine, movie star form in this serviceable, if forgettable action thriller.

reviews.name: Allen Almachar
reviews.message: Jennifer Lopez has immense talent – she is one of the few celebrities that can garner an audience with her name alone. With her skillset, delving into action should be an easy homerun, but she deserves material that’s as good as she is.

reviews.name: Steven Prokopy
reviews.message: As the film moves forward, we’re left with more and more questions, as we care less and less about the outcome—a deadly combination.

reviews.name: Tony Stamp
reviews.message: It’s as good a setup as any for the type of adequate, inoffensive mid-level action thriller Netflix has gotten quite proficient at in recent years.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …With triggering sub-plots involving human and child trafficking, The Mother is, like the central character, strong-minded, physically adept and tuned into today’s issues…

title: Air
description: From award-winning director Ben Affleck, AIR reveals the unbelievable game-changing partnership between a then-rookie Michael Jordan and Nike's fledgling basketball division which revolutionized the world of sports and contemporary culture with the Air Jordan brand. This moving story follows the career-defining gamble of an unconventional team with everything on the line, the uncompromising vision of a mother who knows the worth of her son’s immense talent, and the basketball phenom who would become the greatest of all time.

characteristics.Producer:: Ben Affleck, Matt Damon, David Ellison, Jesse Sisgold, Jon Weinbach, Madison Ainley, Jeff Robinov, Peter Guber, Jason Michael Berman

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Scrappy, sneaker-driven underdog story about how the sports-apparel industry was revolutionized by Michael Jordan's shrewdly savvy mother.

reviews.name: Tatat Bunnag
reviews.message: Air is an entertaining film with a great insight into the history of sports and pop culture that anyone can enjoy, even if you aren't a sports fan.

reviews.name: Robert W. Butler
reviews.message: The whole enterprise has been so cannily timed and bracingly acted that even those of us who care little about sports and even less about sports capitalism will find ourselves caught up in Sonny (and Nike’s) impossible dream.

reviews.name: Jared Mobarak
reviews.message: I would have liked a bit more MAD MEN-esque inside baseball, but this isn't a long-form drama. It's a breezy adventure of blue collar gumption that does well to forget it literally exists inside a white collar package.

reviews.name: Walter Chaw
reviews.message: Ben Affleck's Air is the flabby, out-of-shape version of Moneyball, aspiring only to appease the narcissists it essays and the billion-dollar corporations with which they have developed disturbing symbiotic relationships.

reviews.name: Abhishek Srivastava
reviews.message: Air remains a fantastic sports drama that tells a well-crafted story with impressive direction and a memorable soundtrack that adds to its nostalgic feel.

reviews.name: Saibal Chatterjee
reviews.message: It is fun. It is to the point. It is even electrifying especially when Matt Damon, playing Nikes middle-aged, paunchy basketball talent scout, is at the top of his game.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …a fast-moving and entertaining feature to promote Nike, but also a fairly vapid piece of brand shilling…

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: It's a slam dunk to rival other sports-business gems from Tom Cruise in “Jerry Maguire” (1996) to Brad Pitt in “Moneyball” (2011).

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: With its brisk pace, brilliant performances, and outright fun screenplay, Air instantly shoots to the top of the most rewatchable films of the year.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: What’s more engrossing than watching a guy stick his neck waaayyyy out there, even though we know his head stays attached? I don’t have a good answer for that, but I think it’s mostly because the film is spirited, energetic and effortlessly funny.

reviews.name: Sonny Bunch
reviews.message: As in the Ridley Scott-helmed The Last Duel, Affleck is perfectly cast as a variety of lordly, out-of-touch aristocrat who is vaguely annoyed with an impetuous underling played by Matt Damon.

reviews.name: Rohan Naahar
reviews.message: Arguably the most blatant act of surrogate marketing in recent memory, and easily one of the most convincing displays of product placement ever in an American film, Ben Affleck’s Air is also one of the most enjoyable movies of the year so far.

reviews.name: Diane Carson
reviews.message: Air presents a thrilling, behind-the-scenes drama of this gripping, equitable and profitable business deal.

reviews.name: Kshitij Rawat
reviews.message: While Air is an undeniable celebration of Nike and Air Jordans and many might see it as a feature-length advertisement, it is a superbly-made film featuring exceptional performances.

reviews.name: Loren King
reviews.message: As he proved with his Oscar winning Argo, among other films he’s directed, Affleck is excellent with actors, and here he gets terrific performances top to bottom, starting with his longtime friend and Good Will Hunting partner Damon.

reviews.name: Sarah Knight Adamson
reviews.message: Ben Affleck’s “Air” is a complete delight from start to dramatic history-making finish—in fact, it’s the best movie I’ve seen yet in 2023!

reviews.name: Michael Calleri
reviews.message: Sonny Vaccaro visits Deloris and James Jordan — Michael’s parents — offering a deal for the ages. Or at least a deal for Nike’s ages. Deloris, wonderfully acted by Viola Davis, is the key to getting a deal done.

reviews.name: Filipe Freitas
reviews.message: The film’s main strength is precisely that it's a great story... it succeeds at bringing an usually forgotten part of sports history into the minds of today's audiences.

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: There’s lots to commend the film, but Davis takes it to another level.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Affleck always assembles a great cast. Damon reminds you why he is a talented actor and genuine movie star with his rugged portrayal of Vaccaro, someone who left multiple imprints on the game.

reviews.name: Matt Neal
reviews.message: If there are two things that the '80s were really all about, it was having a good time and making a truckloads of money. In that sense, Air is the perfect '80s movie.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: There were a lot of smart decisions involved in this one but the smartest of all was keeping Michael Jordan off-screen, focusing instead on the shoe and the business of sports.

reviews.name: Sean P. Means
reviews.message: “Air” winds up being as much of an inspirational sports drama as anything where a ragtag team has to score in the closing seconds. Even in the corporate world, the movie tells us, it’s important to be like Mike and take that shot.

reviews.name: Chris Klimek
reviews.message: No movie about corporate branding should be this much fun.

reviews.name: Carrie Wittmer
reviews.message: In Ben Affleck’s masterful, scenery-chewing contribution to sports cinema, Air, Chris Messina reinvents the concept of scenery chewing.

reviews.name: Mark Jackson
reviews.message: "Air" is a Ben Affleck-Matt Damon-Michael Jordan tomahawk dunk that'll remind you why basketball was so exciting when Air Jordan ruled the game.

reviews.name: Jason Escamilla
reviews.message: Informative / entertaining screenplay and talented charming cast.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: It's a very compelling story, but Affleck's focus is always on the least interesting characters -- presumably the ones he identifies with the most?

reviews.name: Luis Martínez
reviews.message: Ben Affleck thus decides to inaugurate a new genre of melodrama, jumping between thriller, podiatry, and Foucauldian archaeology. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Kent Garrison
reviews.message: It's people in board rooms talking for two hours, and this film still hums with an infectious energy.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: “Air,” in fact, is the first great movie of 2023. Even if the rest of the year is a bust, we’ve got this – an account that makes you want to get your

reviews.name: Dominic Griffin
reviews.message: ...once the tone and time settle, the story’s comedic charm gives way to a more nuanced exploration of the nature of myth and its unenviable position at the intersection of commerce and legacy.

reviews.name: Nicholas Bell
reviews.message: Convery’s script strikes a likable balance between comedic camaraderie and the auspicious unity of idolatry, but it’s Davis who elevates this beyond a modified version of how talent is capitalized.

reviews.name: Charlotte O'Sullivan
reviews.message: Once you’ve made peace with those really narrow parameters, what you see on screen – ie virtually nothing of Jordan himself – kind of works.

reviews.name: Patrick Hicks
reviews.message: An entertaining drama that celebrates ego and capitalism while managing to make a shoe deal feel as important as the 2008 financial crisis.

reviews.name: Paul Risker
reviews.message: Air is a highly entertaining and engaging story of how Nike willed themselves to relevancy in the basketball shoe market.

reviews.name: Eileen Jones
reviews.message: Air’s origin story about the Michael Jordan–endorsed sneaker is far too high on its own supply.

reviews.name: Linda Cook
reviews.message: It's a slam dunk.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...a relatively brisk endeavor that does grow more and more compelling as it unfolds...

title: Ant-Man and The Wasp: Quantumania
description: Super-Hero partners Scott Lang (Paul Rudd) and Hope van Dyne (Evangeline Lilly) return to continue their adventures as Ant-Man and the Wasp. Together, with Hope's parents Janet van Dyne (Michelle Pfeiffer) and Hank Pym (Michael Douglas), and Scott's daughter Cassie Lang (Kathryn Newton), the family finds themselves exploring the Quantum Realm, interacting with strange new creatures and embarking on an adventure that will push them beyond the limits of what they thought possible.

characteristics.Producer:: Kevin Feige, Stephen Broussard
characteristics.Production Co:: Walt Disney Pictures, Marvel Studios, The South Australian Film Corporation, Québec Production Services Tax Credit

reviews.name: David Hogan
reviews.message: While it had some pleasing visuals and some strong performances from Paul Rudd and others Quantumania still managed to fall flat. It’s not a bad film, it’s not a good film, it’s firmly in the extremely mundane middle…

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …this film’s action sorely lacks the ingenious charm offered by the super-scale skirmishes seen in the first two Ant-Man films, and the result is incomprehensible gibberish…

reviews.name: Kip Mooney
reviews.message: All you’ll find is another building block of content that will come out quarterly but leave no lasting impression.

reviews.name: Jared Mobarak
reviews.message: It's a two-hour-long computer-generated video game that stays afloat because of two things: Rudd's comic timing and Majors' acting clinic.

reviews.name: Allison Rose
reviews.message: Visually, Ant-Man and The Wasp: Quantumania is incredible, with precise details and colors exploding everywhere on screen.

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Be thankful you didn't squander your money at the box-office! This atrocious escapade is one of the most worthless entries in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

reviews.name: Sean P. Means
reviews.message: Appropriately for the Marvel Cinematic Universe’s tiniest heroes, the charms of “Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania” are small, but still satisfying,

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: The general color-drenched too-muchness of it all might be tolerable if the plot wasn’t such a by-the-numbers slog, alternating hyperkinetic action sequences with draggy recitations of exposition.

reviews.name: Michael Ward
reviews.message: ...this trip into Quantumania is a missed opportunity.

reviews.name: Nathaniel Rogers
reviews.message: Most unfortunate of all, the usually reliable Paul Rudd coasts through this one, wearing his charisma like an old shirt that he forgot to wash and iron before putting on, assuming we'd just love seeing it (and him) again.

reviews.name: Eric Webb
reviews.message: Quantumania has the goods. It lets Majors take new big bad Kang out for a joyride without feeling like he’s just slumming it in an Ant-Man picture.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: The MCU spent Phase 4 showing a sprawling universe at some point, they’re all going to have to come together to beat the crap out of each other. We’ve got a whole multiverse to sit down to, so let Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania be that appetizer.

reviews.name: Stacey Yvonne
reviews.message: I love Marvel and understand the implications the film is supposed to have as it ushers in Phase 5. What I’m at a loss to understand is just why this task was laid at the feet of Ant-Man.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: Because audiences warm to Paul Rudd’s humor, his third stand-alone Ant-Man outing should have gone for the laughs, not some convoluted mythology that explains nothing.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: Far from the best the MCU has to offer but fun, energetic, and quirky enough to overlook its flaws. Also: Jonathan Majors.

reviews.name: Dan Tabor
reviews.message: While Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania’s overwhelming onslaught of half baked CGI and hamfisted performances may be the bulk of the film’s over two hour runtime, one performer who isn’t sleepwalking to his payday is Jonathan Majors.

reviews.name: Victoria Alexander
reviews.message: A disastrous mess with the Ant population expanding. Even the family gardener has a suit which means Scott Lang’s role is reduced to carrying everybody’s luggage.

reviews.name: Kristen Maldonado
reviews.message: You have a great cast that gets lost in an overstuffed story. There's no emotional connections, so many of the characters just didn't get enough screen time, and the goals of what they're setting up with Kang feel too abstract.

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: I cannot imagine ranking it anywhere other than dead last out of the 31 features presently constituting the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

reviews.name: Ineye Komonibo
reviews.message: Clumsy storytelling and underdeveloped characters unfortunately prevented it from being the spectacular strong start that Phase 5 needed it to be.

reviews.name: Piers Marchant
reviews.message: Quantumania is a lifeless, mirthless CGI saturnalia that dispenses almost entirely with the emotional core of its characters. In its place, Peyton Reed and his production team have resorted to the worst sort of empty spectacle filmmaking.

reviews.name: Sameen Amer
reviews.message: The whole thing seems to be built almost entirely on cliches and tropes, with no gravity, no sense of impact or consequence.

reviews.name: Frantz Jerome
reviews.message: As a standalone movie, it falls squarely right in the center of worth it and not worth it to see in theaters.

reviews.name: Edward Porter
reviews.message: Despite a smattering of jokes, Peyton Reed’s film just isn’t as much fun as the others.

reviews.name: Jay Horton
reviews.message: With very small powers come no real responsibilities.

reviews.name: Joel Harley
reviews.message: Not even Rudd’s effortless charisma can save the characters from feeling lost against a background of grey-brown sludge and unremarkable landscaping.

reviews.name: tt stern-enzi
reviews.message: I liked this film a lot, the fun and the humor are still there, but the stakes are definitively raised.

reviews.name: Cris Kennedy
reviews.message: ... While the film has a bunch of things to pick apart, it's aesthetic and visual enjoyability isn't one of them.

reviews.name: Vera Wylde
reviews.message: I thought this was fun, entertaining, visually interesting, the characters worked well, and the villain is spot on. Is it amazing? Is it top tier? No, I don't think it was ever going to be. But I don't regret my time with it.

reviews.name: Lael Loewenstein
reviews.message: [Jonathan Majors] elevated the material and was in a realm altogether... [But the movie] was too drunk on its own mythology.

reviews.name: Tim Cogshell
reviews.message: Jonathan Majors is just outstanding. He's in a different movie, giving a Shakespearean performance in what is otherwise... well, it's Ant-Man.

reviews.name: Susan Kamyab
reviews.message:
"Ant-Man & The Wasp: Quantumania" is going to be lower on the MCU movie list. But, with its thrilling action sequences and funny one liners, this sequel makes for an enjoyable 
blockbuster that's worth catching on the big screen.

reviews.name: Sheraz Farooqi
reviews.message:
ANT-MAN & THE WASP: Quantumania feels more like a Disney+ special than a film.

It’s messy, overindulgent on weak CGI, and humor falls flat. Jonathan Majors is great as Kang but Marvel seemed more focused on creating a 2-hour trailer for something better.

reviews.name: Matt Neal
reviews.message: Quantumania swings big, but forgets the small stuff, to its own detriment.

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: A movie about Ant-Man & Wasp would do well to focus on Ant-Man & Wasp.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: In a universe with 20+ films, one of them has to be the worst, and Quantamania is a strong contender for that inauspicious title, lacking any emotional mooring or reason to care whatsoever

reviews.name: Sarah Marrs
reviews.message: Ant-Man is for wacky capers and comic relief in Avengers movies, not exposition-heavy narrative centerpieces responsible for setting up the next three years of cinematic storytelling.

reviews.name: Joe Friar
reviews.message: 31 films deep in the MCU means there are bound to be a few duds. The barrage of overblown effects and a story devoid of emotion makes this entry a bottom dweller. The good news, Phase 5 can only get better.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: Anyone who fears that too many blockbusters are becoming too similar won't feel fortunate while watching... The MCU is going massive on Kang, patently; if only it'd kept the Ant-Man pictures small.

reviews.name: Paul Salfen
reviews.message: More sci-fi than superhero flick this time, taking cues from Star Wars and gets really fantastical. While it may not be the best in the series, it's a totally fun installment and one that's worth seeing on the big screen.

title: Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves
description: A charming thief and a band of unlikely adventurers undertake an epic heist to retrieve a lost relic, but things go dangerously awry when they run afoul of the wrong people. Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves brings the rich world and playful spirit of the legendary roleplaying game to the big screen in a hilarious and action-packed adventure.

characteristics.Director:: Jonathan M. Goldstein, John Francis Daley
characteristics.Producer:: Jeremy Latcham, Brian Goldner, Nick Meyer
characteristics.Writer:: Jonathan M. Goldstein, John Francis Daley, Michael Gilio, Chris McKay

reviews.name: Suchin Mehrotra
reviews.message: A great time at the movies.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: Lavishly produced.

reviews.name: Kevin Fox Jr.
reviews.message: In a film world full of geek culture adaptations, Daley and Goldstein’s 2023 adaptation is the functional and rewarding film that Dungeons & Dragons fans have long awaited.

reviews.name: Josh Larsen
reviews.message: ...takes its fantasy world seriously, but not itself.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It’s popcorn japery in fine form: Swords against sorcery, sorcery against monsters, monsters against swords, and around and around, while the charismatic cast slam-bangs the consistently amusing setup/one-liner dialogue...

reviews.name: Kenneth Broome
reviews.message: Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is a great representation of how players imagine the games in their private spaces playing out.

reviews.name: Mey Rude
reviews.message: Just like the game, the movie leaves you wanting more adventures, whether it's from this same cast or others in this world. It’s about time we got to see the magic of D&D on the big screen!

reviews.name: Sean P. Means
reviews.message: Goldstein and Daley keep the jokes and the action running in tandem, and add just enough emotional weight — like Edgin’s concern for his daughter — to make it all not seem too frivolous.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: If you didn’t know how to play Dungeons and Dragons before seeing the movie (subtitled “Honor Among Thieves”), you won’t after seeing it, either. But you can say you were entertained.

reviews.name: Michael Ward
reviews.message: Ultimately, a big-hearted crowd-pleaser.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves builds towards a typically exhausting climax that ensures it finishes on just about as underwhelming and interminable a note as one could possibly envision...

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: The story of a motley crew who dares to defeat a dangerous big bad is entertaining and likable, and worth watching not only for RPG fans. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: James Hanton
reviews.message: In Honour Among Thieves, odd moments of sincerity largely crumble in the face of amusement and outlandishness [...] It is by tapping into the very soul of Dungeons and Dragons that this film manages to stand proud as a worthy namesake.

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: Brings the game to life with a scent of "Guardians of the Galaxy."

reviews.name: Paul Whitington
reviews.message: It’s all good fun, never makes the mistake of taking itself too seriously, and Hugh Grant does a fine line in oily baddies.

reviews.name: Theolin Tembo
reviews.message: If you are looking for a fun movie to go watch this weekend that has great action, but isn’t too violent, and contains a lot of fun, then Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is definitely a must-see.

reviews.name: DarkSkyLady
reviews.message: It’s as though Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves made a smoothie with Spaceballs and The Avengers to a side-splitting effect.

reviews.name: Mike Scott
reviews.message: A big-budget crowd-pleaser, it is well-cast, well-crafted and just plain fun, an old-school spectacle that makes a compelling case for sitting in the dark with a hundred or more strangers and just enjoying the show.

reviews.name: Josie Melendez
reviews.message: It'll leave you wanting more. We deserve more!

reviews.name: John Rocha
reviews.message: Dungeons And Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is a crowd pleasing, infinitely enjoyable and super FUN movie that never feels distant, heavy or inaccessible. Chris Pine provides a much needed wink and charm while Michelle Rodriguez kicks much ass in this one.

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Silly, swaggering, swashbuckling screen adaptation of the popular, improvisational, role-playing, fantasy game. If you've never played D&D, learn a bit about it before you go.

reviews.name: Korey Coleman
reviews.message: Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves uses CGI in many creative and funny ways. The effects lend themselves to the comedy.

reviews.name: Shawn Edwards
reviews.message: "Dungeons and Dragons: Honor Among Thieves" is a lot of fun. A lot of fun. It's energetic, campy and full of action. Has Chris Pine ever been this enjoyable to watch? He's great. And no, you don't need to know a thing about D&D to enjoy this movie.

reviews.name: Wade Major
reviews.message: A third-tier Lord of the Rings knockoff... [The material] just doesn't lend itself to a movie.

reviews.name: Rosa Parra
reviews.message: “Dungeon & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves” is a fine film that delivers what the trailers promised. This fantasy action comedy is entertaining and left me content.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: Pine is a gem, the surrounding cast are all strong, and the world is well-built. But the number one thing this writer-director team gets right is the understanding that both the game and popcorn movies are supposed to be FUN. There's a lot of fun here.

reviews.name: Matt Neal
reviews.message: If you're a roleplayer who knows their Waterdeep from their Baldur's Gate, add another star to the rating. Everyone else, this is solid three-star fun and a welcome big-budget addition to the genre of cinematic fantasy.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves proves itself to be a cut above most knuckle-headed, thud-and blunder sword and sorcery romps…

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: Mostly, Dungeons & Dragons: Honour Among Thieves is enough of a romp — a romp with clear franchise-starting ambitions, even though there's already been three D&D movies dating back to 2000, but a romp nonetheless.

reviews.name: Bob Grimm
reviews.message: It's fun enough. And it does, in fact, have some dragons in it. And now that I think about it, I think I saw some dungeons as well. But don't quote me, which is a stupid thing to say within an actual quote on RT. Hey...it's late. I have to go to bed.

reviews.name: Brendan Cassidy
reviews.message: The source material is something that was built on imagination and creativity, which I didn’t sense much of in Honor Among Thieves, and I found the experience a bit mundane because of that.

reviews.name: Edwin Arnaudin
reviews.message: Entertaining for longtime tabletop players and those who've never rolled a D20.

reviews.name: Laura Hiros
reviews.message: An action adventure, with a solid script, stunning scenes, a championship cast and endearing performances; But above all with a powerful moral that gives the best level of entertainment for the whole family. Don't miss it. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Lauren Coates
reviews.message: Though it may struggle with pacing and an arbitrary villain, a trio of endlessly charming and deliciously ridiculous performances from Grant, Pine, and Page make Honor Among Thieves a worthy holder of the Dungeons & Dragons name.

reviews.name: Robert Roten
reviews.message: The main reason this story is compelling is that the characters are complex and captivating. Edgin and Simon, in particular, are flawed, and are not naturally heroic. They just stubbornly keep trying to succeed and to be better.

reviews.name: Frank Swietek
reviews.message: Even more of a theme park movie than “Jungle Ride,” which was actually based on one...the cinematic equivalent of a mile-high roller-coaster ride with no other objective but to provide multiple jolts before screeching to an explosive halt.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: The only question is why it took so long to create a low-stakes but also highly amusing version of this long-running fan favorite.  Chris Pine was perfectly cast.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: Dungeons and Dragons: Honour Among Thieves is a lot more fun than anticipated, and while the jokes often make the film soar, the comedown comes hard and fast with a narrative that holds no surprises.

reviews.name: Brian Lloyd
reviews.message: Good old-fashioned, high fantasy fun.

reviews.name: Nestor Bentancor
reviews.message: A cinematic campaign that accomplishes its mission thanks to the masterful use of its weapons: Sharp script, solid performances, and magical spectacle. Although it didn’t completely steal my heart, D&D is Deliciously Delightful. [Full Review in Spanish]

title: Guy Ritchie's The Covenant
description: Guy Ritchie's The Covenant follows US Army Sergeant John Kinley (Jake Gyllenhaal) and Afghan interpreter Ahmed (Dar Salim). After an ambush, Ahmed goes to Herculean lengths to save Kinley’s life. When Kinley learns that Ahmed and his family were not given safe passage to America as promised, he must repay his debt by returning to the war zone to retrieve them before the Taliban hunts them down first.

characteristics.Genre:: War, Drama, Action, Crime, Mystery & thriller
characteristics.Producer:: Guy Ritchie, Ivan Atkinson, John Friedberg, Josh Berger
characteristics.Writer:: Guy Ritchie, Ivan Atkinson, Marn Davies

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Guy Ritchie's strategically shameful action thriller points an accusatory finger at broken covenants (promises) made to loyal Afghan interpreters/translators by the U.S. Government, leaving them stranded as prime targets for Taliban reprisals.

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: These set pieces are extraordinarily well done, brutal, and eye-opening to everyday dangers. Still, the final act would have worked better if it dealt with Ahmed's struggle to survive rather than Kinley's guilt and depression.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: The serious melodrama falters when it becomes little more than an action movie devoid of the melodrama.

reviews.name: Filipe Freitas
reviews.message: A searing war drama with considerable edge-of-your-seat moments.

reviews.name: Christy Lemire
reviews.message: This feels like a breath of fresh air [for Guy Ritchie]. He is really reinvigorated by paring it down.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: Like two films in one, this “Covenant” doesn’t seem like other examples, even though Ritchie embraces plenty of clichés. It works because the actors commit to the missions.

reviews.name: Sarah Knight Adamson
reviews.message: The reunion brought tears to my eyes--Guy Ritchie’s seasoned filmmaking career has created an excellent film of friendship, devotion, and the realistic horrors of war.

reviews.name: Lynn Venhaus
reviews.message: Director Guy Ritchie dispenses with his usual fancy flourishes and keeps the action straight-forward...He ratchets up the tension as the urgency mounts in a cut-to-the-chase scenario that gives a sense of real-time heroics.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: The Covenant is a rock-solid modern-war thriller that keeps us locked in for two hours.

reviews.name: Mike Scott
reviews.message: A capably made but simple-minded rescue film, one with a big heart — even if it could have used more brain.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: Ritchie surprises with a much more conventional action movie. Dar Salim is excellent in this stripped-back soldier story that is more poignant than the trailers suggested.

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: In theory it is all there - the acting, the story, the direction - but it never seems to completely come together.

reviews.name: Mark Meszoros
reviews.message: Like just about every Guy Ritchie work, Guy Ritchie’s The Covenant isn’t all it could have been. It deserves to be seen, though, and, at least for a while, remembered.

reviews.name: tt stern-enzi
reviews.message: The perfect two person story.

reviews.name: Edwin Arnaudin
reviews.message: The intensity of the men's predicament might have been better served by Peter Berg or Paul Greengrass, both of whose frenetic styles more aptly fit the material.

reviews.name: Robert Roten
reviews.message: The action scenes are well-staged, and there is plenty of suspense in the rescue scenes, too. Gyllenhaal, one of the best actors of his generation, shines in this role. He plays a man more haunted than idealistic.

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: This gripping look at war gets under your skin.

reviews.name: Jared Mobarak
reviews.message: That Salim and Gyllenhaal are so good almost seems like an afterthought because Ritchie has us too involved in their characters' plight to get distracted by the artifice.

reviews.name: Sonny Bunch
reviews.message: A deadly serious—and almost deadly earnest, in its portrait of duty, honor, and sacrifice—look at America’s failure to live up to its word to the interpreters on the ground in Afghanistan.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: It’s Gyllenhaal and Salim that make the movie leave a dent in the viewer long after the credits conclude. As men cut from a more similar cloth than either would like to admit-they’re both family men serving in a war-they make the quieter moments count.

reviews.name: William Schwartz
reviews.message: It is as always important to reassure Americans that we at least mean well with our pointless destructive wars, not like “bad” countries... A person predisposed to believe that might find The Covenant enjoyable. I did not.

reviews.name: John Lui
reviews.message: This is Ritchie at his most sedate and naturalistic, which makes sense in the context of this story.

reviews.name: James Berardinelli
reviews.message: The Covenant doesn’t arouse the stirrings of fervor that many war movies tap into but neither is it a nihilistic descent into the inhumanity of battle.

reviews.name: Neal Pollack
reviews.message: "A taut military thriller with two fantastic performances, Guy Ritchie's The Covenant brings to mind the Afghans we left behind."

reviews.name: Katie Walsh
reviews.message: Swinging back to a more serious register, Ritchie presents his first film grounded in harsh real-world politics, and it’s the best film he’s made in years.

reviews.name: Jeanne Kaplan
reviews.message: Through the Herculean efforts of Jake Gyllenhaal and Dar Salim, Guy Ritchie’s THE COVENANT is a gripping film exposing the horrors of the Afghanistan War.

reviews.name: David Kaplan
reviews.message: Guy Ritchie’s THE COVENANT is two hours of pure adrenaline as we wait for this remarkable story to unfold. It's a highly emotional journey that is impossible to dismiss.

reviews.name: Josh Bell
reviews.message: A dour lecture punctuated by some rousing action sequences.

reviews.name: Steven Prokopy
reviews.message: The Covenant is a solid story of survival, respect, and honor, while still acknowledging the brutality and senselessness of war. It’s easy to get caught up in this journey, and one of Ritchie’s better recent efforts.

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: The director, coming off a run of successful action comedies, shifts into a moving but flawed tale of friendship in the war in Afghanistan.

reviews.name: Alci Rengifo
reviews.message: The Covenant is nowhere near the ultimate cinematic statement on what happened in Afghanistan, but it is a riveting story worth telling from that battlefield.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: What we get is not only his most restrained and most focused movie in years. I think it’s Ritchie’s best movie in years period.

reviews.name: Sean P. Means
reviews.message: What gives “Guy Ritchie’s The Covenant” its solid footing is the twinned performances by Gyllanhaal and Salim.

reviews.name: Carla Hay
reviews.message: Guy Ritchie's The Covenant offers an overly simplistic portrayal of an American rescue mission in Afghanistan. However, this action flick has solid performances and capably shows the importance of interpreters during war.

reviews.name: Jeffrey M. Anderson
reviews.message: An uncharacteristically serious movie by director Guy Ritchie, this war-themed tale is simplistic but sturdy and effective thanks to crisp, energetic filmmaking and a touching emotional core.

reviews.name: Nick Rogers
reviews.message: The least Guy Ritchie film Guy Ritchie has yet made boasts a title bearing his name. Even as Ritchie quiets his quirks, there's still considerable style and scope here. Melancholy, mournful and meaty dramatic filmmaking that's less rah-rah, more requiem.

reviews.name: John Urbancich
reviews.message: Harmful stuff comes with such nasty work, but so does the loyalty, friendship, and mutual respect that filmmaker Ritchie dramatizes just about perfectly after collecting these incidents for the big screen.

reviews.name: Richard Roeper
reviews.message: Jake Gyllenhaal stars in skillfully made and gripping film...

reviews.name: John Rocha
reviews.message: The Covenant is a well crafted, action packed and intense drama expertly directed by Guy Ritchie featuring career best acting work from Jake Gyllenhaal and Dar Salim. A film about the bonds of brotherhood that'll move you, enlighten you and uplift you!

reviews.name: Allison Rose
reviews.message: If you think Guy Ritchie's The Covenant is simply just another movie about war, you are in for a large and pleasant surprise.

title: Evil Dead Rise
description: In the fifth Evil Dead film, a road-weary Beth pays an overdue visit to her older sister Ellie, who is raising three kids on her own in a cramped L.A apartment. The sisters' reunion is cut short by the discovery of a mysterious book deep in the bowels of Ellie's building, giving rise to flesh-possessing demons, and thrusting Beth into a primal battle for survival as she is faced with the most nightmarish version of motherhood imaginable.

characteristics.Producer:: Rob Tapert
characteristics.Production Co:: Warner Bros., Department of Post, Pacific Renaissance, New Line Cinema, Wild Atlantic Pictures, Ghost House Pictures

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: It absolutely has the goods as a violent horror movie.

reviews.name: Connor Petrey
reviews.message: Evil Dead Rise is blood-soaked nightmare fuel that’ll truly [mess] up some and deservingly be celebrated by the horror community. A seamless entry into the Evil Dead universe, that continues the franchise’s hot streak that’s lasted more than 40 years.

reviews.name: Cheryl Eddy
reviews.message: Lee Cronin does Sam Raimi and Bruce Campbell proud with his dark but not grim tale of Deadites in Los Angeles.

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: Evil Dead Rise meets the parameters set by producers and executives that right now prevent the birth of new classics... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Matt Oakes
reviews.message: Much like a vinyl record that keeps spinning, this franchise seemingly has an endless groove of gory goodness.

reviews.name: Rob Gonsalves
reviews.message: You can no longer be guaranteed a rowdy good time with this franchise. It has become rancid, humorless, toxic.

reviews.name: EJ Moreno
reviews.message: While it misses the brutality of the 2013 offering, this new Evil Dead film still hits all the notes you'd want from this ghoulishly fun franchise.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It’s not Raimi, but Evil Dead Rise delivers the red stuff and the laughs with gusto.

reviews.name: Leonardo Garcia Tsao
reviews.message: Cronin takes his actions to the height of excess. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Mel Valentin
reviews.message: As Beth, Sullivan matches Sutherland practically beat-for-beat. She meets the latter’s intensity as needed, but also grounds Beth and imbues the character with emotional depth. She helps Evil Dead rise above its basic, bare-bones screenplay.

reviews.name: Mike McGranaghan
reviews.message: Creepy, shocking, mess-you-up fun.

reviews.name: Mike Ryan
reviews.message: It’s like someone was given all the ingredients to the recipe to make an Evil Dead movie, but didn’t know what temperature to cook it at.

reviews.name: Matt Conway
reviews.message: Evil Dead Rises comes to life as a nonstop horror locomotive.

reviews.name: Chris Sawin
reviews.message: Ultimately, Evil Dead Rise’s biggest flaw is that it simply isn’t as good as its ten-year-old predecessor. Nevertheless, the film is fun, blood splattering carnage that will hopefully take the Evil Dead franchise in a bold and exhilarating direction.

reviews.name: Nestor Bentancor
reviews.message: A lean and mean exercise in gory, fantastical horror that conjures up enough, well-executed sequences to please fans of the franchise. An animated, but ultimately soulless cinematic creature. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Nicolás Delgadillo
reviews.message: I wouldn’t say I enjoyed this film but I was definitely affected by it.

reviews.name: Trace Thurman
reviews.message: While it's nowhere near as grueling as the 2013 remake and doesn't take full advantage of the new setting, Evil Dead Rise boasts one of the best lead deadites to ever grace the franchise in Alyssa Sutherland's Ellie.

reviews.name: Joe Lipsett
reviews.message: Alyssa Sutherland's superb performance and Lee Cronin's playful direction make this new Evil Dead worth celebrating, though the apartment building setting could have been used more. Compared to 2013's entry, it feels like punches were pulled here

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: An entertaining but pale and annoyingly calculated composition that adapts iconic images, and invokes a glamour that they never quite reach themselves.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Keri O'Shea
reviews.message: Absent the few minor issues, this is a brilliantly mean-spirited modern horror which walks a solid line between new ground and old.

reviews.name: Hanna Flint
reviews.message: It's not for the faint-hearted but for long-time fans and horror nuts, just sit back and let the blood wash over you.

reviews.name: Edwin Arnaudin
reviews.message: We’re talking buckets and buckets and buckets of blood, poured out in increasingly shocking ways as Cronin shows zero interest in following any blueprint of who should survive.

reviews.name: Crockett Houghton
reviews.message: Evil Dead Rises is a fun and inventive, blood-filled, horror gorefest that is sure to satisfy fans of the franchise.

reviews.name: Bob Grimm
reviews.message: Now that I am thinking about it a while after seeing the film, it's a little weird that the book of the dead incantations the kid plays on his stereo are on vinyl. Like, flawless vinyl. You know what, I'm just not buying anything in this film!

reviews.name: Tony Baker
reviews.message: The Evil Dead franchise is undefeated... I feel like they're 5-0.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: Everything from the gnarly practical effects to the incredible makeup to the gallons upon gallons upon gallons of blood helps to create this a visually amazing buffet of grotesquerie that long-time fans are hungry for.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: Evil Dead Rise eventually does adopt an agreeable visceral feel that proves effective at compensating for the movie’s various deficiencies...

reviews.name: Tom Meek
reviews.message: The series’ staple chainsaw and shotgun come out and Beth transforms into the Ripley version of Ash’s demon exterminator, so Rise checks most of the Evil Dead boxes; not quite there is the sardonic wit Raimi wove into his Dead trilogy.

reviews.name: Joey Shapiro
reviews.message: The first sequel in a full decade, this should feel like getting an Evil Dead reunion, but instead it’s more akin to a so-so tribute band.

reviews.name: Sean Burns
reviews.message: Playing this silly material straight one of the most baffling creative decisions in franchise-era filmmaking. It’s like remaking 'Airplane!' as 'Zero Hour.'

reviews.name: Cris Kennedy
reviews.message: Lee Cronin most unfortunately doesn't emulate Raimi's humour or tongue-in-cheek ethos - this is pure horror, not particularly new or inventive, but respectful to the expectations fans will have for gore.

reviews.name: Joey Keogh
reviews.message: The pacing is leaden, the violence is punishingly facile and the tone is utterly odious, giving the impression that the only reason to make an “Evil Dead” movie nowadays is to see how much you can make the audience gag.

reviews.name: Juanma Fernández París
reviews.message: Lee Cronin delivers a brutal and visceral offering that channels the creative energy, a good dose of sadism, and the black humor that distinguished Raimi in the original films... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Diego Batlle
reviews.message: Yes, everything is served for a festival of the most explicit and impactful sampling of the horror genre. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: Evil Dead Rise doesn't pay respect to the tone of its founding saga: it subverts it into cinematic carnage. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Amyana Bartley
reviews.message: Skip it. You’ve already seen all of this in other, better films.

reviews.name: Paul Salfen
reviews.message: An absolute bloodbath that involves chainsaws, limbs flying, needles in eyes, and yes, even a cheese grater. If it sounds like too much for you, it probably is but if you're  already a fan of the series or a horror fan, you'll probably love it.

reviews.name: Steph Cozza
reviews.message: This is Evil Dead to its core.

reviews.name: Víctor López G.
reviews.message: A wild and highly amusing midnight movie that is undoubtedly pure 'Evil Dead'; although this latter fact proves to be a double-edged sword that obliges us to traverse many well-known tropes that are already familiar to fans.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Genre fans will enjoy the yuckiness, but the connection to the other movies is tenuous, and there's not much else to it.

title: Land of Gold
description: Kiran Singh, a 1st generation Punjabi-American, has just accepted a last-minute trucking job to Boston which causes a blow-up argument with Preeti, his 37-week pregnant wife, who admits to feeling abandoned. En route to complete this "one final job," Kiran discovers Elena,  a 10-year-old Mexican-American stowed away in his trailer. After debating the merits of turning her to the police, Kiran deduces she might be undocumented, and instead resolves to shepherd Elena to her uncle in Maine despite putting his own livelihood in jeopardy. As the pair ride across the changing American landscape, Kiran faces what it means to be a father and Elena learns how to trust again. They connect through family, dreams of the future, and a healthy debate over God’s existence, all while the ghosts of the past, racially charged encounters, and the threat of I.C.E. linger over their journey.

characteristics.Producer:: Keertana Sastry, Pallavi Sastry, Simon Taufique, Nardeep Khurmi
characteristics.Production Co:: Black Poppy Productions, Team Access Productions, Legacy Pictures (II)

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: Didn't move me as much as it should have.

reviews.name: Radhika Menon
reviews.message: Land of Gold is an emotional tale of generational trauma, immigrant dreams, and new beginnings.

reviews.name: Julian Roman
reviews.message: Land of Gold is a touching film that haunts in the wake of a melancholic finale. The winner of the Tribeca Film Festival's 2021 Untold Stories grand prize takes an unvarnished view of the immigrant experience in America.

reviews.name: Todd Jorgenson
reviews.message: Richly textured characters and a fresh perspective make this modest road-trip melodrama worth the journey.

reviews.name: David Ehrlich
reviews.message: Few debut features brim with such feeling, and even fewer reflect such an urgent need to solve a lifetime of inherited trauma in the span of a single film, as if their director may never get a second chance.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Cloying though (it) may be...when it errs it errs on the side of “sweet.”

reviews.name: Jonita Davis
reviews.message: "Land of Gold" is a heartwarming experience that sits at the intersection of fatherhood and social justice.

title: A Man Called Otto
description: Based on the comical and moving New York Times bestseller, A Man Called Otto tells the story of Otto Anderson (Tom Hanks), a grumpy widower whose only joy comes from criticizing and judging his exasperated neighbors. When a lively young family moves in next door, he meets his match in quick-witted and very pregnant Marisol, leading to an unexpected friendship that will turn his world upside-down.

characteristics.Producer:: Fredrik Wikström, Rita Wilson, Tom Hanks, Gary Goetzman
characteristics.Production Co:: Playtone, Columbia Pictures, SF Productions, Stage 6 Films, Sony Pictures

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: Despite having a somewhat interesting start with the presence of Hanks as the unfriendly neighbor, it is a remake that loses the desired dramatic effect by sometimes going down the route of calculated poignancy. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Quinton Roberts
reviews.message: Tom Hanks was an absolute blast to watch on screen, and his interaction with his co-stars were some of my favorite scenes in the movie. He commanded the screen with his betrayal of Otto.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: It proves again, the everyman of the movies, can play any mood or soul. The movie is patient, and a special shoutout to Mariana Trevino for taking a slightly underwritten role and giving it depth.

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Subtle, sincerely redemptive comedic drama...Tom Hanks delivers a carefully modulated, understated performance, as does his 'real-life' son Truman, but the script tends to be overly melodramatic.

reviews.name: Whang Yee Ling
reviews.message: The director is Marc Forster of Monster's Ball. For sure, his saccharine movie is not hard to like, if only because he is a pro at manipulating heartstrings and Hanks cannot help but be affable, however ill-suited for his role here.

reviews.name: Al Alexander
reviews.message: Tom Hanks gets in touch with his inner Larry David as the curmudgeonly sexegenarian at the heart of Marc Forster’s lukewarm English-language remake of Hannes Holm’s Oscar-nominated “A Man Called Ova.”

reviews.name: Edward Porter
reviews.message: With Hanks as its star, Marc Forster’s safe Hollywood remake is all the more predictable.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: A Man Called Otto is mechanically engineered for maximum lachrymosal extraction.

reviews.name: Amber Wilkinson
reviews.message: Tom Hanks is trying to channel his inner Clint Eastwood for this US adaptation of Fredrik Bachman’s Swedish best-seller - the problem is, he simply isn’t grouchy enough

reviews.name: Erik Childress
reviews.message: A film that gets by thanks to Hanks' unwavering watchability though there's not a beat or a revelation we haven't seen before and  taking its biggest emotional cue directly from She's Having a Baby is an annoyingly misguided choice.

reviews.name: Ed Potton
reviews.message: This slice of superior schmaltz has Tom Hanks as a fastidious late-middle-aged grump who hates everyone, from overcharging shop assistants to neighbours who put their recycling in the wrong bin.

reviews.name: Nandini Ramnath
reviews.message: Tom Hanks does his best to look mean, but his inherent affability never fails to shine through. Otto discovers to his disgust that there is no avoiding mushiness.

reviews.name: Lynn Venhaus
reviews.message: With a terrific supporting cast – Mariana Trevino is the MVP of this journey, and she’s a force of nature as the kind neighbor Marisol. Without her as a counterpart, this would be a difficult, one-note story.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: It’s the kind of schmaltzy, big performance studio drama that used to get a billion Oscar nominations, and darn it, I kind of miss those being in vogue.

reviews.name: Julia Swift
reviews.message: A sweet story of the power of community to bring someone back from the brink of suicide. A film like this depends on the performances - and here there are some weak links and some standout performances.

reviews.name: Matt Neal
reviews.message: A predictable tear-jerker made no less enjoyable or heartfelt by its predictability.

reviews.name: Robin Holabird
reviews.message: Hanks plays the feel-good card, mixed with comic moments, sentimentality, and a cute cat. Cat or not, [it] emphasizes that living improves by interacting warmly with others.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: When a feature needs a good-natured supporting character to make its audience care about its hostile protagonist, that isn't a great sign.

reviews.name: Mark Meszoros
reviews.message: Despite its slow start, Otto mostly hits its emotional mark

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Mawkish and tonally messy, A Man Called Otto squanders a pertinent story about loneliness in favour of old geezer antics. Not even the universally beloved Hanks can save a film that mishandles its sentiment so badly.

reviews.name: Hanna Flint
reviews.message: Marc Forster and screenwriter David Magee previously worked together on Finding Neverland, so they know just how to frame tragic circumstances with a lighter touch, while not skimping on the emotional gut punch

reviews.name: Michael Calleri
reviews.message: “A Man Called Otto” lays down a familiar pattern for its storytelling and action. The movie clicks because Tom Hanks delivers a performance that is always in the moment. You sense there’s a more pleasant past Otto could recapture, if he’s willing.

reviews.name: MaryAnn Johanson
reviews.message: With cowardly mildness, this white-bread mush misuses its star’s likability. Tom Hanks trying to be grumpy yet endearing has the opposite impact. He’s somehow less endearing than he’s been before.

reviews.name: Bill Newcott
reviews.message: Touches on the same weighty themes as 'Ove' — isolation, suicide, and mortality among them — but from the start, director Marc Forster...pulls back the drapes to brighten what in the original version was a decidedly murky room.

reviews.name: Christian Toto
reviews.message: A surprisingly cranky Tom Hanks can't elevate this cringe-worthy drama.

reviews.name: Alison Gillmor
reviews.message: Tom Hanks is reliably, dependably Tom Hanksy in this feelgood comedy-drama, the newest addition to the “grumpy old guy in need of redemption” genre. Unfortunately, his steady work is almost undone by clunky direction and shoddy, shortcut scripting.

reviews.name: Rex Reed
reviews.message: A follow-the-dots flick with a few moments of charm that aims to be a feel-good crowd pleaser, but lacks enough freshness and insight to make it anything special.

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: Despite the film’s flaws, what audiences will take away is a humanizing experience by a group of misfits who are learning that getting along can also be lifesaving.

reviews.name: Tim Cogshell
reviews.message: If you were to start [this remake and the original] at the exact same moment, I promise it wouldn't make any difference which one you looked at. But you know why? Because all the scenes were working in the first movie, too.

reviews.name: Andy Klein
reviews.message: Hanks is perfect for this. He's playing the grumpiest of grumpy old men, and because it's Tom Hanks, it has extra power.

reviews.name: tt stern-enzi
reviews.message: I'm just not sure we needed it... [but] I did like it a whole lot more than I thought I was going to.

reviews.name: Andrea Thompson
reviews.message: Just because the movie isn’t as bad as it could be doesn’t make it good, but it also won’t make it any less appealing at the numerous family viewings that A man Called Otto will no doubt become a staple of.

reviews.name: Chad Byrnes
reviews.message: Even the most skeptical of moviegoers will be moved by A Man Called Otto’s undeniable warmth and timely message about looking past one’s surface to see the person inside. You just might reach for the Kleenex, then get angry at yourself for doing so.

reviews.name: Matthew Jackson
reviews.message: It’s a perfectly fine film, made better by a great cast and Hanks’ presence as a natural movie leader, and sometimes that’s enough.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: You know exactly where it’s going and the journey there isn’t spectacularly original, but at least the payoff is sweet and tender.

reviews.name: Neal Pollack
reviews.message: It contains enough truth to make the movie a hit among grownups looking back on their own lives with a mixture of happy nostalgia and wistful regret.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...a deliberately-paced yet progressively compelling drama...

reviews.name: Linda Cook
reviews.message: It's pleasant enough.

reviews.name: Fico Cangiano
reviews.message: Wonderful performances by Tom Hanks and Mariana Treviño keep the film from succumbing into saccharine territory. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: It ends on a heartwarming note, one that the film for the most part earns, even though Hanks isn't right for this part.

title: Polite Society
