reviews.message: At once tragedy and farce, it breathes new life into a story as old as civilization.

title: Sex and the City
description: Four years after the earlier adventures of Carrie Bradshaw (Sarah Jessica Parker) and her best gal pals, she and her intermittent lover, Big (Chris Noth), are in a committed relationship. Samantha (Kim Cattrall), having survived cancer, has a monogamous relationship with Smith Jerrod. Charlotte (Kristin Davis) and her husband live on Park Avenue, and Miranda (Cynthia Nixon), now in Brooklyn, feels the pressure of family life.

characteristics.Producer:: Michael Patrick King, Sarah Jessica Parker, John P. Melfi, Darren Star

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: Like watching 3 episodes of the show. It's fine

reviews.name: David Walsh
reviews.message: Sex and the City is both titillating and conformist. For three of the characters at least, conventional love and marriage apparently bring life's challenges to an end.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: Quite possibly the longest film ever made - or at least it feels that way.

reviews.name: Richard Propes
reviews.message: One of the most richly felt, intelligently written and delightfully human films to get a wide release in years.

reviews.name: Micheal Compton
reviews.message: This is a film with a lot of fuss, but ultimately not enough bite.

reviews.name: Mattie Lucas
reviews.message: A capable and hugely likable romantic comedy of good friends, cosmopolitans and fabulous Manolo Blahniks sure to please both the uninitiated and the hard-core fans.

reviews.name: Marcianne Miller
reviews.message: Sex and the City isn't a movie per se. It's a cultural phenomenon. As a movie, it's only so-so. As an event-it's terrific.

reviews.name: Deborah Ross
reviews.message: No, it doesn't break new ground, but it does know its own ground perfectly.

reviews.name: Candice Frederick
reviews.message: ... the movie was truly gratifying and fed our SATC appetite, at least until the sequel coming up (can't wait!).

reviews.name: David Keyes
reviews.message: The ladies settle into the doldrums of marriage and their antics are reduced to a detached series of scenes that involve sulking, yearning or just plain indulging.

reviews.name: Pablo Villaça
reviews.message: As amigas de Sex and the City estão entre as criaturas da ficção mais repulsivas que já conheci: fúteis, estúpidas, egoístas e entediantes. Além disso, isto não é um filme, é um catálogo.

reviews.name: Dragan Antulov
reviews.message: Ono sto je u tridesetominutnoj epizodi moglo proći kao vrckavi drustveni komentar u dva i pol sata se pretvorilo u praznu ljusturu.

reviews.name: Mark Bourne
reviews.message: ...'Yes,' she said. 'It's Star Trek for women.'...

reviews.name: Tony Macklin
reviews.message: The movie Sex and the City is a heady female fantasy -- I think. I tried to snuggle up to Sex and the City, but the attempt to snuggle for two hours and 20 minutes is in itself a fantasy. Like many typical men, I'm afraid I fell asleep.

reviews.name: Jeffrey M. Anderson
reviews.message: The behemoth 145-minute running time for this lightweight romantic comedy is unforgivable, and that's only the first of this movie's problems.

reviews.name: Jules Brenner
reviews.message: Reliving the fantasy lush life.

reviews.name: Heather Huntington
reviews.message: I went in rooting for SATC with everything I had, and it left me a bit disappointed.

reviews.name: Bruce Bennett
reviews.message: Wouldn't it be redundant to describe the self-indulgent big-screen adaptation as similarly vapid, pointless, and poorly acted as the popular HBO show upon which it is based?

reviews.name: Karina Montgomery
reviews.message: Cinerina invites her first guest reviewer, Melanie Treco. See full review for details.

reviews.name: Michael Drakulich
reviews.message: What does that say when a self-admitted narcissist receives such a following? In playing the victim card so often, Sarah Jessica Parker's character is one of the most unlikable characters I've seen in a long time.

reviews.name: Sean P. Means
reviews.message: Was this bonbon to the show's fans, four years after the "happily ever after" series finale, really necessary?

reviews.name: Dustin Putman
reviews.message: Plays like nothing more than a marathon viewing of an entire seventh season that should have never been made.

reviews.name: Kyle Smith
reviews.message: To its credit, though, the movie turns Carrie's value system, which equates "the two Ls--Labels and Love," to its advantage, and in the second half the movie achieves a nice balance between comedy and drama.

reviews.name: Frank Ochieng
reviews.message: It's too bad that the false sense of high heel empowerment never registers as soundly as our resident money-styling maidens look to achieve in this beleaguered City.

reviews.name: Todd Gilchrist
reviews.message: Sex and the City is not a painful experience for men (or even guys), just a predictable one...

reviews.name: Beverly Berning
reviews.message: Somewhere along the line, the movie version of Sex and the City got too much Botox injected into the script, and all the life was ironed out of it.

reviews.name: Paul Byrnes
reviews.message: It's nice to see these women again, because they are all rich and complex characters, but it's basically a sentimental exercise, designed for maximum cash flow before the idea is retired.

reviews.name: Beth Accomando
reviews.message: I spent most of the film's 148 minutes just wanting to slap these women because I grew weary of their whining.

reviews.name: Peta Hellard
reviews.message: The film is raw, sentimental and outrageously materialistic - just as a true fan would hope and expect it would be.

reviews.name: Des Partridge
reviews.message: While he's let the movie run to excessive length, the well-practiced Parker King (throwing in more brand names than you will find in a Myers catalogue) knows what his target audience wanted from this reunion.

reviews.name: Jake Wilson
reviews.message: I had to wonder what happened to the qualities that made the show famous: the outrageous dialogue, the sense of female camaraderie, the embrace of casual sex as a guiltless pleasure.

reviews.name: Leigh Paatsch
reviews.message: The pacing barely ever breaks out of a light plod. And the writing is very, very average.

reviews.name: Margaret Pomeranz
reviews.message: This movie has generated record excitement in just about every woman of my acquaintance.

reviews.name: Erin Free
reviews.message: When it neglects the fizz in favour of the grit (or at least the kind of grit acceptable for Sex And The City), this femme phenomenon hits the spot.

reviews.name: Evan Williams
reviews.message: Here is an unashamed celebration of materialist values, an orgy of labels, brands and product placements as sinful, by implication, as the behaviour of the characters.

reviews.name: Bob Grimm
reviews.message: I love Sarah Jessica Parker...Carrie and Mr. Big are definitely the best things about this film. But, at 2.5 hours long, there's just not enough good stuff to put this one over the top. I hate the sound of Kim Cattrall speaking, so that didn't help.

reviews.name: Philip Martin
reviews.message: ... a gay camp parody of the way fabulous heterosexual women court affection

reviews.name: Lori Hoffman
reviews.message: Sarah Jessica Parker's complex dance with love, marriage and Mr. Big provides the biggest notes in a symphony of wailing womanhood.

reviews.name: Thomas Peyser
reviews.message: As the movie drifts into its third hour, you start to feel that it's not joy that's keeping you in the theater. It's duty.

title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
description: Directed by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, collectively known as Daniels, the film is a hilarious and big-hearted sci-fi action adventure about an exhausted Chinese American woman (Michelle Yeoh) who can't seem to finish her taxes.

characteristics.Producer:: Joe Russo, Anthony Russo, Mike Larocca, Dan Kwan, Daniel Scheinert, Jonathan Wang
characteristics.Production Co:: Ley Line Entertainment, IAC Films, AGBO

reviews.name: Cole Smithey
reviews.message: "Everything Everywhere All At Once" is a steaming example of visual, sonic, and thematic noise. Chinese propaganda for propaganda's sake. Vomiting all of the time now. Hollywood pawns.

reviews.name: Greg Carlson
reviews.message: At a few minutes short of two and a half hours, Everything Everywhere All at Once nearly wears out its welcome, but as far as hot dog-fingered audacity goes, the Daniels will make plenty of new eyeballs go googly.

reviews.name: Juan José Beteta
reviews.message: ... Touches upon important themes such as control through technology, media, food, and body while resorting to an anarchic and hilarious sense of humor. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Eve Tushnet
reviews.message: The filmmakers try to load the entire weight of life, the universe, and everything onto their movie. This is too many things on a bagel.

reviews.name: Carla Renata
reviews.message: Michelle Yeoh proves that being a middle aged immigrant has no boundaries and she is backed up with the amazingly gifted talents of Ke Huy Quan, Jaime Lee Curtis and Stephanie Hsu !  The Daniels provide a supreme sci-fi smorgasbord for the ages.

reviews.name: Milana Vujkov
reviews.message: It holds within it a great idea, when one disentangles it from the hairball that is the EEAAO narrative. But [...] in all its originality, it telegraphs its message, instead of allowing this intricately constructed ingenious world to be the message.

reviews.name: Robin Holabird
reviews.message: Outrageous, confusing or confounding, Everything Everywhere All At Once stands out as one of the most original movies to come along in years.

reviews.name: A.S. Hamrah
reviews.message: The humor, though, is silly and second-rate. The googly eyes, the talking raccoon, the pet rocks at sunset, the parody of 2001: A Space Odyssey—all those work against the cast instead of with it.

reviews.name: Eric Webb
reviews.message: Much like a hallucinogen might cause you to cycle through every human emotion and see your life laid out end to end — theoretically — this film has an ability to dazzle built into every kinetic, colorful, madcap frame.

reviews.name: Carlos Boyero
reviews.message: ... This victorious though regrettable film, or whatever it is, is an incomprehensible mess, foolishly imaginative and cumbersome to watch and listen to. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Diana Cheng
reviews.message: ... their Best Original Screenplay fuses science fiction, action, comedy, and family drama all at once. Genre jumping might be a better term to describe the Daniels’ creative mode of filmmaking.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert not only think outside the box but outside the multiverse as well.

reviews.name: Bill Newcott
reviews.message: EEAAO is that insufferable child whose parents trot her out in tap shoes, then watch to make sure you register adequate amazement at her Buffalo turns and Bombershays. You appreciate the kid’s skill and preparation — but gawd, how you wish it were over.

reviews.name: Tony Macklin
reviews.message: It's a challenging, provocative, manic, self-indulgent movie.

reviews.name: Peter Howell
reviews.message: Raising an ecstatic hot dog middle finger to the negativity of modern times, “EEAAO” urges us to free our minds and accept that it’s OK to be strange.

reviews.name: Laura Hiros
reviews.message: The fight between good and evil, right and wrong, social boundaries, mental perceptions and a long list of etc.; will take place among washing machines and calculators (...) everything, everywhere, all at once. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Hugo Hernández Valdivia
reviews.message: The Daniels turn in a joyous film, a party so demanding as it is exhilarating.    [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: James Wegg
reviews.message: Laundry, taxes and life

reviews.name: John McDonald
reviews.message: Some seem to believe this movie is a philosophical masterpiece because characters reach conclusions such as: “nothing matters”.

reviews.name: Wesley Lovell
reviews.message: ...is certainly unique. Exploring the idea of family, existential crises, and other obvious philosophical concepts, the film uses its quasi-futuristic narrative to delve into these topics in ways not often seen in film.

reviews.name: Carolyn Hinds
reviews.message: Family is complicated, messy, difficult to understand, and what matters most in this fantastic multiverse psychedelic drama that at this point needs little introduction...

reviews.name: Akhil Arora
reviews.message: [Gives] us dildo fights, raccoon chefs, hot-dog hands, and muscular pinky fingers. In one of the film's best action scenes, [we have] a fanny pack. [Elsewhere,] two rocks with googly eyes share their deepest fears and comfort each other.

reviews.name: Mike Scott
reviews.message: A wonderfully weird, exhilaratingly all-over-the-place absurdist comedy, led by great performances and a screenplay that is as funny as it is moving.

reviews.name: Stacey Yvonne
reviews.message: Everything Everywhere All at Once is a film with just as many lives as we see Yeoh’s Evelyn Quan Wang wade through.

reviews.name: Alison Gillmor
reviews.message: A fun, frantic but unexpectedly emotional watch.

reviews.name: Benjamin Wiebe
reviews.message: Everything Everywhere All At Once is a marvelous achievement in filmmaking. The Daniels have created one of the best films of the year, and it is sure to inspire the next generation of filmmakers.

reviews.name: Santanu Das
reviews.message: Michelle delivered the performance of the year in Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's Everything Everywhere All At Once...

reviews.name: Matt Pais
reviews.message: Visually restless, thematically redundant and the rare movie to be both overwhelming and underwhelming. After only a little while, you’ll desperately long to be simply whelmed.

reviews.name: Patrick Hicks
reviews.message: Everything Everywhere All at Once takes the poignant themes of parental disappointment and life regrets and is able to successfully wrap them up in an absurd and entertaining 2+ hours of craziness.

reviews.name: Luke Y. Thompson
reviews.message: Lots of movies and shows entered the multiverse this year, but there was nothing remotely like this one

reviews.name: Grant Watson
reviews.message: Rarely has a film’s title reflected its contents so well. While may not include everything all at once, it does boasts a range of genre approaches stacked on top of one another and blended into a variety of combinations.

reviews.name: Kristen Maldonado
reviews.message: A true genre-bending wonder with phenomenal performances from the entire cast, stunning visuals, and powerful themes, the hype behind Everything Everywhere All At Once is real!

reviews.name: Steph Cozza
reviews.message: I hope this movie exists in every alternate universe.

reviews.name: Dann Gire
reviews.message: An exhausting, confusing, hilariously funny, pleasing assault on the ears and eyes from directors Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert.

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: Never has a film lived up to its title more than this, the most bonkers movie you’ll ever see, equal parts exhilarating and exhausting. I remain leary of the multiverse trend of chaotic storytelling. It shouldn't be repeated. Let “EEAAO” exist on its own.

reviews.name: Sarah Boslaugh
reviews.message: ...mixes science fiction, martial arts, comedy, fantasy, parody, animation, social realism, and probably a few more styles I’ve left out.

reviews.name: Samuel Leggett Jr.
reviews.message: Everything Everywhere All at Once is one of the best films this year. From the editing, set design, world building, pacing/transitions, amazing student choreography and some of the best performances this year from Yeoh, Quan, & Hsu. A NEAR PERFECT FILM!

reviews.name: Jeffrey Lyles
reviews.message: Undoubtedly the most creatively chaotic experience I’ve ever seen or likely will ever see.

reviews.name: Scott Phillips
reviews.message: It's the most original film of the year

reviews.name: Dolores Quintana
reviews.message: EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE is one of the best films of the year. It’s a brave cinematic mirror of all the banal but critical things that make us and our lives important in an indifferent universe.

title: Malum
description: MALUM is a bold and expanded reimagining of the 2014 horror cult classic, LAST SHIFT. On a search to uncover the mysterious circumstances surrounding her father's death, a newly appointed police officer, Jessica Loren (Jessica Sula) is assigned to the last shift in a decommissioned police station where a notoriously vicious cult saw their demise years prior. The lone officer at the station, she soon finds herself barraged by terrifying paranormal events, and in the process, is taken on a journey during which she learns the shocking truth behind her family's entanglement with a demented cult leader. MALUM takes the premise of the 2014 festival hit and flips it on its head, thrusting viewers into an unrelenting, adrenaline-fueled, bloody cult nightmare.

characteristics.Producer:: Scott Poiley, Dan Clifton

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: I'm afraid the new version, despite a bigger budget and added scares, is not better than the old version-just more glossy.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: While Malum still offers plenty of frights, it struggles to get out of the shadow of Last Shift. Yet it undeniably features impeccable craft from beginning to end.

reviews.name: Carla Hay
reviews.message: Malum is not very original, it can get repetitive, and some of the acting is amateurish from the supporting cast members. However, the movie excels at some terrific horror visuals, and the lead performances carry the movie during its weaker moments.

reviews.name: Alex Maidy
reviews.message: From solid physical effects to some more unique creature designs in recent memory, Malum is awash in creeps and horrors. It may not be the most original or unique horror movie of the year, but it is a step above most of what is out there.

reviews.name: Tyler Doupe
reviews.message: ‘Malum’ is chilling, surreal, and serves up gruesome gore effects.

reviews.name: Matt Zoller Seitz
reviews.message: "Malum" is [most] impressive when it turns its talented ensemble cast loose on material that was obviously a lot of fun to play with.

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: Definitely midnight movie fare...

reviews.name: Jon Mendelsohn
reviews.message: Malum is a modern horror film that knows how to be genuinely scary, creating some of the most frightening sequences of the year.

reviews.name: Abbie Bernstein
reviews.message: Malum is a horror film that delivers the goods in terms of both blood and lore.

reviews.name: Joey Keogh
reviews.message: It may be more blunt force more so than scalpel sharp, but Malum is one hell of a journey (pun very much intended), with more in common with Baskin than Assault on Precinct 13–and that’s certainly a reason to give praise to the dark lord.

reviews.name: Joe Friar
reviews.message: Apart from Jessica Sula’s immersive performance, the practical effects by RussellFX recall the work of Bob Keen from Clive Barker’s Hellraiser. The finale takes the viewer on a rapid descent to hell that signifies horror is alive and well.

reviews.name: Matt Donato
reviews.message: DiBlasi delivers what Last Shift fans will once again enjoy. That’s what’s slightly disappointing: Malum differentiates, but does it differentiate enough?

reviews.name: Richard Whittaker
reviews.message: Malum has enough budget to be too glossy to be gutter fun, and adds little visually much beyond some very mediocre practical effects, often feeling that – yet again – its ambitions outstripped its grasp.

reviews.name: Molly Henery
reviews.message: Malum is a frightening reimagining of Last Shift that manages to deliver more plot and excess gore.

reviews.name: Stephanie Malone
reviews.message: The "Last Shift" reimagining "Malum" is a thrilling, terrifyingly sadistic spectacle that proves sometimes you can fix what isn't broken. It’s leaner, meaner, grislier, more investing, more unsettling, and perfectly paced.

reviews.name: Joel Harley
reviews.message: DiBlasi’s remake keeps the bones of his previous effort but ups the ante in every conceivable way.

reviews.name: Aaron Neuwirth
reviews.message: What matters is how this film delivers on horror, and Malum certainly offers plenty of chills.

reviews.name: Mark Dujsik
reviews.message: In a perfect world, there's probably a middle ground between the 2015 movie and this remake...

reviews.name: Avi Offer
reviews.message: A lean, gritty and intense horror thriller, but low on surprises and intrigue. It doesn't quite reach the heights of "elevated" horror.

reviews.name: Robert Kojder
reviews.message: Once the nightmare gets going, it’s a well-crafted horror show relentless in trippy gory chaos

reviews.name: Jordy Sirkin
reviews.message: MALUM follows a similar storyline as LAST SHIFT but expands the mythology behind the terrors and breathes new life into an underrated film.

reviews.name: Christopher Lloyd
reviews.message: Horror meets "Assault on Precinct 13" in this lively if somewhat derivative scare flick about a rookie cop encountering demon-fueled chaos on her first night on the job.

reviews.name: Hope Madden
reviews.message: Equal parts Assault on Precinct 13 and The Shining by way of Charles Manson, Anthony DiBlasi’s Malum is a quick, mean, mad look into the abyss.

reviews.name: Norman Gidney
reviews.message: Few films this year will offer you the glorious sense of dread that [B]MALUM[B] does.

reviews.name: Anton Bitel
reviews.message: With this psychological tragedy, DiBlasi updates the haunted police station of his own Last Shift to the #BlackLivesMatter era

title: Guardians of the Galaxy
description: Brash space adventurer Peter Quill (Chris Pratt) finds himself the quarry of relentless bounty hunters after he steals an orb coveted by Ronan, a powerful villain. To evade Ronan, Quill is forced into an uneasy truce with four disparate misfits: gun-toting Rocket Raccoon, treelike-humanoid Groot, enigmatic Gamora, and vengeance-driven Drax the Destroyer. But when he discovers the orb's true power and the cosmic threat it poses, Quill must rally his ragtag group to save the universe.

characteristics.Producer:: Kevin Feige
characteristics.Production Co:: Marvel Studios, Moving Picture Company, Marvel Enterprises

reviews.name: Sean Axmaker
reviews.message: [James] Gunn does make the journey a lot of fun, with an oddball cast of renegades who, tossed together in a deep space prison, team up to escape and wind up staying together because it suits their purposes, but really because it sucks to be alone.

reviews.name: Edward Porter
reviews.message: A cheerful blockbuster in which Star Wars meets Ziggy Stardust...

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: It’s not that the ending of “Guardians” doesn’t work. It just felt a bit generic and almost what I’m starting to expect out of every Marvel movie.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: Marvel and Gunn should be proud of what an unusual yet accessible a film they've made.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy just might be Marvel's greatest risk-reward situation yet.

reviews.name: Therese Lacson
reviews.message: Absolutely stunning to look at, hilarious to watch, and never takes itself too seriously or gets dragged down in melodrama.

reviews.name: Kip Mooney
reviews.message: The blockbuster I've been waiting all summer for.

reviews.name: Nicolás Delgadillo
reviews.message: It's an absolute riot from start to finish.

reviews.name: Lisa Wright
reviews.message: The big screen version of this lesser-known Marvel comic is a hilarious curveball.

reviews.name: David Hogan
reviews.message: It's so rare to see a film so perfectly crafted and cast. Forget "MCU films" or "Comic book films", Guardians of the Galaxy is just a great film, period.

reviews.name: Richard Crouse
reviews.message: It's filled with one-liners, sight gags and funny moments that play off the more standard blockbuster-style action and battle scenes.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: Contains all the excitement and adventure one would expect from a Marvel superhero movie, but the glue that holds this ragtag band of outlaws together is the humor.

reviews.name: Richard Propes
reviews.message: May not necessarily be the movie event of the Summer but it's very likely one of the best Marvel-based cinematic adventures yet.

reviews.name: Allen Almachar
reviews.message: Gunn knows not to take the material too seriously, that a fun space adventure such as this should be exactly that: fun and adventurous.

reviews.name: Kelechi Ehenulo
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy is great reminder that not all superhero comic book films have to be dark and moody.

reviews.name: Brent McKnight
reviews.message: Combining huge, spectacle-scale special effects, giant practical sets, and a massive scale, Guardians also works on a narrative level, and as the story of strange, unique, very human-even when they're not-characters.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: Science fiction collides with comics to create something colorful that makes everyone come out of the cinema saying: 'I am Groot'. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Andrew Galdi
reviews.message: It was a blast!

reviews.name: Josh Wilding
reviews.message: James Gunn has taken a group of characters that the majority didn't care about two years ago and made them guaranteed fan favourites in a movie that's not only one of the most awesome Marvel movies yet, but also 2014's best.

reviews.name: Christie Cronan
reviews.message: Very entertaining from the great actor selection, to the special effects, to the plot scheme.

reviews.name: Siddhant Adlakha
reviews.message: The film marked Marvel Studios going full-on Marvel Comics, bringing with it the requisite band of multi-coloured misfits, whose intersecting character arcs - while occasionally incomplete - formed an alluring tapestry.

reviews.name: Debbie Lynn Elias
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy goes galactic with a new kind of fun, freshness, and family, ready to rock the Marvel universe and yours.

reviews.name: Kirsten Acuna
reviews.message: "Guardians" is brash, it's bold, and it's not afraid to stray from what you typically expect from Marvel in terms of superheroes.

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy has laughs, space battles and a mouthy racoon. You don't need anything else in a summer blockbuster.

reviews.name: Ryan Syrek
reviews.message: If Boyhood is a reminder of film's potential to be groundbreaking art, Guardians of the Galaxy is a testament to its capacity for inducing pure joy.

reviews.name: Leslie Combemale
reviews.message: Guardians also has both humor and genuine poignancy.

reviews.name: Mattie Lucas
reviews.message: Pure fun from start to finish, a joyous, outrageously entertaining summer blockbuster that delivers everything anyone could really want out of a comic book movie.

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: One my favorite Marvel movies for sure.

reviews.name: Danielle Solzman
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy is one of the funniest movies that has ever been based on a Marvel comic book series.

reviews.name: Bernard Boo
reviews.message: Gunn does a great job of preserving his wacky indie sensibilities and incorporating them seamlessly into a giant, crowd-pleasing blockbuster film, a feat that takes more finesse than his Troma-boy resume may lead you to believe he's capable of.

reviews.name: Paula Fleri-Soler
reviews.message: Given the type of tight storytelling we are used to from Marvel, Guardians feels like it could have used a little tweaking, both narratively and character-wise.

reviews.name: Allen Adams
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy was an outside-the-box choice by Marvel; a huge gamble that paid off handsomely. It is epic space opera and well-constructed comedy, a visually stunning experience driven by exceptional performances.

reviews.name: Don Shanahan
reviews.message: Kinetic pace, clever humor, retro soundtrack, and dazzling effects add up to a wholly entertaining experience.

reviews.name: Micheal Compton
reviews.message: The dialogue has sizzle, and the film is peppered with lots of humor, getting the most out of this talented cast.

reviews.name: Amanda Greever
reviews.message: I'll go ahead and give it my highest rating. And, I hope everybody runs - not walks - to get in line for this one.

reviews.name: Abbie Bernstein
reviews.message: Guardians of the Galaxy has spectacle and sentiment, surprises, high stakes and great lines, a reliable example of Marvel magic at work.

reviews.name: Colby Bryant
reviews.message: I love this film, despite its few problems. I can't quite pinpoint why, but through its usage of sight and sound, it just speaks to me in ways that other films don't.

reviews.name: Zaki Hasan
reviews.message: ...the most confident bit of sci-fi world-building I've seen since the original Star Wars>.

reviews.name: Jennifer Heaton
reviews.message: Even removed from the rest of Marvel's film catalogue, it would still stand as one of the most fun and entertaining blockbusters not just this year but of the past several years.

reviews.name: Pat Padua
reviews.message: 70s pop music can be a too-easy signifier of coolness or camp, but ... these songs are an irreverent hero's inner monologue of loneliness, love and loss, and escape.

title: The Fate of the Furious
description: With Dom and Letty married, Brian and Mia retired and the rest of the crew exonerated, the globe-trotting team has found some semblance of a normal life. They soon face an unexpected challenge when a mysterious woman named Cipher forces Dom to betray them all. Now, they must unite to bring home the man who made them a family and stop Cipher from unleashing chaos.

characteristics.Producer:: Neal H. Moritz, Vin Diesel, Michael Fottrell, Chris Morgan

reviews.name: Brett Doze
reviews.message: This entry absolutely suffers from the absence of Brian and Mia O’Connor, but the issues go far beyond that.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: Like most of its predecessors “The Fate of the Furious” is true to its ambitions. Fans of the series are sure to be pleased; detractors will be able to use their same arguments.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: A bloated mess of a blockbuster.

reviews.name: Drew Dietsch
reviews.message: The Fate of the Furious hits all the notes a fan would want but it lacks that ability to branch out like Fast Five did.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: The Fate of the Furious wallows in inanities with about the same frequency as it delivers excitement, and, like the other two films that followed the series-best Fast Five, it largely succeeds as a breezy and engaging lark.

reviews.name: Olly Richards
reviews.message: It's dumb - but a lot of fun.

reviews.name: Cate Young
reviews.message: There is nothing in this film that is not perfectly calibrated for an audience that has been primed for high drama over the course of two full decades.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: There's no setup, no details, and no plan - just the getaway, where things explode and collide with one another like objects in a cartoon.

reviews.name: Paul McGuire Grimes
reviews.message: Who would have thought that a street racing movie from 2001 starring Vin Diesel and Paul Walker would still be going strong...

reviews.name: Kelechi Ehenulo
reviews.message: Fast 8 does what you expect it to do. It's clever on the humour and the action whilst keeping within the film's emotional core. At the end of the day, it's about family.

reviews.name: Nabila Hatimy
reviews.message: The film doesn't disappoint in its over-dramatized races, unimaginable stunts and adrenaline filled scenes. But as the stunts get bigger the plot gets smaller.

reviews.name: Ricardo Gallegos
reviews.message: Moments that should've been emotional, are quickly forgotten thanks to Vin Diesel's robotic acting. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Brent McKnight
reviews.message: Vapid fun, which is fine, but something of a disappointment now that we've seen how much more these movies can be.

reviews.name: Steven Prokopy
reviews.message: So for all its talk of family and redemption, there's surprising little emotional weight to this chapter.

reviews.name: Sarah Knight Adamson
reviews.message: The quality of these films has enhanced over the years; you know what you're in for when you buy a ticket, which is typically an enjoyable ride.

reviews.name: Phumlani S Langa
reviews.message: This new joint is dark, no-nonsense and butt-kicking - thanks mainly to Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, Vin Diesel and Jason Statham.

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: There are raining cars, high-speed chases and spectacular stunts throughout, which both border on the ridiculously crazy to the incredibly entertaining, delivering the stuff the fans want and enjoy immensely.

reviews.name: Leslie Combemale
reviews.message: F8 benefits from the considerable muscle of the top actors in the action field.

reviews.name: Vincenzo Bilof
reviews.message: Despite how over-the-top all the action scenes are, Roman earned nothing but eye-rolls from me, and while we can argue that each character deserves their moment to shine, I am of a mind that these characters are expendable.

reviews.name: Nicholas Bell
reviews.message: Somebody is going to have to write something better for these folks who go driving in their fast cars and obsess about the priceless nature of family.

reviews.name: Linda and Al Lerner
reviews.message: This film has enough action shot hand held to keep you ducking in your seat, and enough cars being destroyed and fire to keep the sizzle going.

reviews.name: Jorge Loser
reviews.message: The way in which all its vanishing points converge and fit, give relevance and weight to the fantastic climax. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Juan Luis Caviaro
reviews.message: There are various decisions that harmed and ruined what should be great entertainment. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Udita Jhunjhunwala
reviews.message: Designed to appeal to their enormous fan base, the makers clearly have every intention of going out at full throttle.

reviews.name: Allison Rose
reviews.message: With movies nine and ten already announced, it looks like we will be seeing a lot more of Dom and company in the future.

reviews.name: Ryan Syrek
reviews.message: The Fate of the Furious feels like a Fast and Furious installment made by someone who had a friend tell him about the franchise without ever actually seeing any of the movies.

reviews.name: Dan Murrell
reviews.message: To get into this movie, you had to disregard physics, math, how fire works, how magnets work...Even grading on a curve, that is too stupid.

reviews.name: Preston Barta
reviews.message: If you can ignore the mad case of eye-rolls it gives you, The Fate of the Furious is an adrenaline-fueled popcorn movie that doesn't disappoint.

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: This film was a significant step down from the previous 3 films.

reviews.name: Cate Young
reviews.message: [T]his movie ha(s) been pitched to the exact frequency of my own personal happiness.

reviews.name: Amie Simon
reviews.message: Let's talk about that action though: car chases galore, explosions for days, "making it rain," and trying to outrun a freaking nuclear submarine across frozen water.

reviews.name: Allen Adams
reviews.message: The Fate of the Furious may not quite reach the heights of its immediate predecessors in the franchise, but it offers more than enough of what you want.

reviews.name: Amanda Greever
reviews.message: The films are ridiculous in the most wonderful way.

reviews.name: Sarah Cartland
reviews.message: So cheesy they should sell the DVD at your local deli, the plot is advertised a mile off, and the dialogue is exposition-heavy. But it's hilarious - most of the time intentionally so - with some seriously impressive and entertaining action sequences.

reviews.name: Marisa Carpico
reviews.message: Now, the first Walker-less installment, The Fate of the Furious, proves that the series can survive, but that it has to make some big changes to do it.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: The films in the franchise are thrilling, but they're also all about family. You can't help but smile, buckle in, and hang on for the next ride.

reviews.name: Bob Chipman
reviews.message: At this point, the Fast & Furious franchise represents something like the longest ironic joke ever told to global movie audiences.

reviews.name: Christopher James
reviews.message: How many franchises in their eighth entry up the ante not just in explosions and cars, but also in how it defines its core thesis and the makeup of the audience it services?

reviews.name: Micheal Compton
reviews.message: The action comes in almost mind-numbing waves, not really giving audiences a chance to appreciate some of the film's finer moments.

reviews.name: Zaki Hasan
reviews.message: It does keep the engine idling on the brand for another few years, but things are starting to get a little tired, like maybe we've gone a bridge too furious.

title: Ghosted
description: Salt-of-the-earth Cole (Chris Evans) falls head over heels for enigmatic Sadie (Ana de Armas)--but then makes the shocking discovery that she's a secret agent. Before they can decide on a second date, Cole and Sadie are swept away on an international adventure to save the world.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Brief Strong Language|Some Sexual Content|Seq. of Strong violence/Action)
characteristics.Producer:: Jules Daly, David Ellison, Chris Evans, Dana Goldberg, Don Granger, Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick
characteristics.Writer:: Chris McKenna, Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick
characteristics.Production Co:: Apple Original Films, Studio Concierge, Skydance Media

reviews.name: Walter Chaw
reviews.message: Part of me feels like I should celebrate non-IP attempts at mature actioners--but the rest of me feels like I'd rather be watching something that doesn't suck. It's the eternal struggle.

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: Evans and de Armas are very appealing performers, and the action isn't bad, but this is a mostly witless action romcom.

reviews.name: Christy Lemire
reviews.message: Big-budget, glossy, empty and soulless.

reviews.name: Lael Loewenstein
reviews.message: A madcap adventure that sucked.

reviews.name: Lindsay Press
reviews.message: Ghosted never tries to be too serious and instead leans into the jokes, which allows the movie to have an equal balance of action and comedy.

reviews.name: Lynn Venhaus
reviews.message: Written by a team of four men with action-adventure credits, thwarting evil dudes becomes more of a sprawling and chaotic contrived spectacle. However, high-concept rom-coms are all about the chemistry and less about intrigue.

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: On screen chemistry is a funny thing. It is either there or it isn't. De Armas and Evans don't have it.

reviews.name: Mark Meszoros
reviews.message: It just isn’t as fun, as consistently entertaining, as it should be given all it has going for it.

reviews.name: Whang Yee Ling
reviews.message: Cole is aggrieved that Sadie lied about her profession. “Unbelievable,” he eye-rolls. Sadie is annoyed at having to repeatedly rescue Cole. “Unbelievable,” she fumes. Such is how the movie wastes the smoking-hot pair. Unbelievable.

reviews.name: Nestor Bentancor
reviews.message: The potential for a fun and funny action rom-com, giving its high-caliber talent, never materializes. Not even the best spy could walk away unscathed from this trainwreck. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Steve Murray
reviews.message: Ghosted is pretty much like every other copycat riff that’s been spun since that 1994 film...

reviews.name: Chris Mello
reviews.message: Fletcher’s film... isn’t really a throwback to the summer movies of the 2000s so much as Apple TV+’s foray into an emergent genre best described as “Netflix drivel.”

reviews.name: Kevin Carr
reviews.message: Not brilliant, but it honestly is still fun with a somewhat refreshing swap of typical action gender roles.

reviews.name: Terence Johnson
reviews.message: There’s absolutely nothing about this film that feels new and fresh, which in itself is not egregious, but when you aren’t doing anything new, you should at least do something well.

reviews.name: Todd Jorgenson
reviews.message: Despite some stylish visuals in exotic locales, as the film becomes progressively more far-fetched, you begin to wish it had ghosted you instead.

reviews.name: Aaron Neuwirth
reviews.message: Ghosted really does feel like a product being put on display. It has popular stars pushed together by a terrible premise and every effort to do something fun is thwarted by half-hearted direction, poor writing, and a lack of spark between the famous faces

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: This hokey headscratcher tries to ride on the star wattage of its handsome two leads and host of fun supporting players. It turns out they aren’t enough to keep this maddeningly bland misfire from succumbing to its own lack of originality or imagination.

reviews.name: James Croot
reviews.message: Director Dexter Fletcher never quite feels in control of this film’s crazier elements and doesn’t quite manage to make the most of his two stars’ combined potential.

reviews.name: Dylan Roth
reviews.message: Sadly, Ghosted fares no better as an action-adventure film than it does as a romantic comedy.

reviews.name: Natasha Alvar
reviews.message: Ghosted is supposed to be light, breezy fun, but settles for being leadenly dull.

reviews.name: Jennifer Green
reviews.message: If only the (four) writers had saved more time for talk and less for the Bond-èsque villains (Brody with a French accent) and protracted fight-and-chase sequences.

reviews.name: Petr Navovy
reviews.message: Aside from the gaping chasm where the chemistry between the leads should be, Ghosted fails in just about every other metric of filmmaking too.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: While the mix of outrageous action mayhem and sweet romance isn't always convincing, this is a thoroughly entertaining bit of nonsense.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: There are lessons to be learned here; don’t cast a guy best known for playing a literal superhero as a hapless Average Joe and perhaps screen test your stars to ensure they can sell a romance on screen.

reviews.name: Austin Burke
reviews.message: Ghosted relies on these two talented performers to deliver, even when the dialogue and action sequences are mediocre at best. The chemistry never fully feels believable, and the plot is generic.

reviews.name: Paul Mount
reviews.message: It’s a film that encourages you to sit back and enjoy the familiarity of its set-up and revel in the unpretentiousness of a film that only exists to entertain for a couple of hours.

reviews.name: Steven Prokopy
reviews.message: If that’s the case, maybe one of those four writers should have worked harder on character development. Since that clearly didn’t happen, this is what we’re left with. Enjoy the cameos!

reviews.name: Matt Donato
reviews.message: Ghosted isn’t a tragic action rom-com misfire, but being “fine at best” outside of cameos from Chris Evans’ and Ana de Armas’ friends is the most excitement it’s usually able to muster.

reviews.name: Pablo O. Scholz
reviews.message: Ghosted is like a hurricane of car and truck chases, shootouts, explosions, and hand-to-hand combat. If, at times, it's unbelievable, it is always entertaining. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Clarisse Loughrey
reviews.message: After a point, it starts to feel like Ghosted is trying to brainwash its audience. There is no chemistry, sexual or otherwise.

reviews.name: Maureen Lee Lenker
reviews.message: Despite a lot of great ingredients in the cocktail shaker, there's no amount of booze that can save Ghosted.

reviews.name: Fico Cangiano
reviews.message: One big clunker of a film. Generic, bland and at times cringe, not even some cool action and funny cameos can help it. Oh, and the chemistry between the leads is nonexistent. Really disappointing. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Julian Roman
reviews.message: Ghosted can't figure out how to make its individually likable leads work as a couple. Opposites attract and love blooms while bullets fly. Sounds good on paper, but there needs to be a tangible connection tying the mismatched pair together.

reviews.name: Tasha Robinson
reviews.message: It’s an easy evening’s entertainment, a casual brain-relaxer that doesn’t require anything out of the audience except complete intellectual remove and a thorough willingness to set reality aside for a couple of hours.

reviews.name: Wenlei Ma
reviews.message: This was the leftover scraps cobbled together from better scripts. It’s the movie equivalent of bubble-and-squeak, and in their heart of hearts, no one ever wants bubble-and-squeak.

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: Ghosted is a bad movie that’s a listless and sterile experience. The chemistry between the leads takes a back seat to unreasonably excessive villains and stale comedy styling.

reviews.name: Mae Abdulbaki
reviews.message: When even its leads have little chemistry to speak of & the romantic comedy aspect is barely explored, the film isn’t worth your time.

reviews.name: Frank Swietek
reviews.message: The leads are attractive but the script is contrived, the banter forced, and the action rote in Dexter Fletcher’s mash-up of rom-com and spy caper.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: Ghosted burns through its talent and never rises above mediocrity.

reviews.name: Casey Chong
reviews.message: Ghosted is reminiscent of a generic product straight out of the assembly line.

title: White Men Can't Jump
description: Billy Hoyle (Woody Harrelson) is a white basketball hustler who banks on black players underestimating his skills on the court. When he pulls one over on Sidney Deane (Wesley Snipes), his victim sees a lucrative opportunity, and they become partners in the con game, plying their trade across the courts of Los Angeles. Meanwhile, Billy has to keep one step ahead of mobsters, to whom he owes money, while staying on the good side of his "Jeopardy!"-obsessed, motormouth wife (Rosie Perez).

characteristics.Producer:: Don Miller, David V. Lester

reviews.name: Wayne Broadway
reviews.message: Where 'White Men Cant Jump' fails to make any enlightening point concerning race, it does an amazing job highlighting male hypocrisy.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...a mostly entertaining comedy that receives plenty of mileage out of the stellar work of its stars...

reviews.name: Leigh Paatsch
reviews.message: Slam-dunkingly satisfying sports comedy about two basketball hustlers (Woody Harrelson and Wesley Snipes) teaming up for an alley-oop of a payday, despite crying foul about each other's off-court lifestyle.

reviews.name: Malcolm Johnson
reviews.message: Shelton is clever, and he obviously loves sports and beautiful women and even Los Angeles. Yet when it comes to telling a story, he can't seem to hit this time around.

reviews.name: Duane Byrge
reviews.message: As rough and shiny as chain nets on a sweltering summer day, White Men Can't Jump is a poetic, rag-tag triumph.

reviews.name: David Ansen
reviews.message: Shelton's strength is character, streetwise wit and funky, lived-in sexuality. Snipes, one of our most versatile young actors, gets to demonstrate his wonderful comic chops, and Harrelson, whose goofiness is part of his scam, partners him beautifully.

reviews.name: Gene Siskel
reviews.message: A fresh and exuberant romantic comedy that is as smart about playground basketball as Bull Durham was about minor league baseball.

reviews.name: Kenneth Turan
reviews.message: They're black and white instead of fat and thin, but Wesley Snipes and Woody Harrelson have the makings of a classic comedy team, the Laurel and Hardy of the half-court game.

reviews.name: Terrence Rafferty
reviews.message: Harrelson's performance is rich, subtle, and delicately funny. And Snipes is just amazing: everything he does seems to leap off the screen.

reviews.name: Jay Boyar
reviews.message: White Man Can't Jump is most effective at the beginning -- when it's bouncing along with the exuberance that Shelton brought to such other sports-minded movies as Bull Durham and The Best of Times.

reviews.name: Carrie Rickey
reviews.message: Despite charismatic performances by Woody Harrelson and Wesley Snipes as nothing-but- net shooters who might be called the Schmo and the Bro, White Men Can't Jump throws up mostly bricks.

reviews.name: Dave Kehr
reviews.message: It's a funny, frequently rousing film, with a warmly appealing acting partnership at its center-between basketball hustlers Wesley Snipes and Woody Harrelson.

reviews.name: Bill Kelley
reviews.message: [Shelton] contributes a uniquely eccentric point of view that is simultaneously obsessed with and ambivalent about sports, athletes and competition.

reviews.name: David Sterritt
reviews.message: Wesley Snipes and Woody Harrelson give lively performances as the heroes, who relate better to basketballs than to women or the business world. The movie doesn't add up to very much, though.

reviews.name: Matt Chapman
reviews.message: Ron Shelton's film about two basketball hustlers hasn't aged well.

reviews.name: Stephen Hunter
reviews.message: [White Men Can't Jump is] like a game of pick-up basketball: it's intense, raggedy and explosive, now and then yielding moments of sheer gravity-defying grace, yet just as capable of producing air balls and pratfalls.

reviews.name: John Ferguson
reviews.message: Writer/director Ron Shelton is that rare beast: someone who can make movies with wit, warmth and perception about American sports.

reviews.name: Gary Thompson
reviews.message: The verbal interplay between the characters appears to be intentionally improvised, but the scenes come off as cumbersome and off-kilter.

reviews.name: Owen Gleiberman
reviews.message: White Men features some amusingly daft racial banter.

reviews.name: Heather Boerner
reviews.message: Hustlin' hoops tale with too much skin for kids.

reviews.name: Keith H. Brown
reviews.message: Snipes and Harrelson make a winning team, even if their partnership doesn't quite stand up to comparison with Eastwood and Wallach in The Good, The Bad and The Ugly, or Redford and Newman in The Sting.

reviews.name: Jonathan Rosenbaum
reviews.message: This picture is packed with fun, but it doesn't really go anywhere.

reviews.name: Stephen Garrett
reviews.message: A double-whammy slam-dunker of a movie.

reviews.name: Luke Y. Thompson
reviews.message: Amusing and fun.

reviews.name: Dan Lybarger
reviews.message: Episodic by enjoyable. Rosie Perez steals this one.

reviews.name: Rob Thomas
reviews.message: A pretty terrific and very different kind of sports comedy.

reviews.name: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat
reviews.message: Rosie Perez steals the movie from the two male leads

reviews.name: Janet Maslin
reviews.message: This film unfolds in an uncommonly sweet, harmonious climate, one in which rude remarks are the sine qua non of friendship. And that benign atmosphere becomes a large part of its charm.

reviews.name: Robert Roten
reviews.message: Basketball really isn't the central theme. It is really about relationships, loyalty and honesty, qualities in short supply among hustlers.

reviews.name: Brian Mckay
reviews.message: A hilarious white-black buddy comedy that manages to not feel completely contrived. Snipes is excellent.

title: Huesera: The Bone Woman
description: Valeria's joy at becoming a first-time mother is quickly taken away when she's cursed by a sinister entity. As danger closes in, she's forced deeper into a chilling world of dark magic that threatens to consume her.

characteristics.Producer:: Paulina Villavicencio, Edher Campos

reviews.name: Sarah Boslaugh
reviews.message: ...you’ll often not be sure whether something you see on screen is actually happening in the world of the characters, whether it’s a product of Valeria’s mind, or whether it’s a cinematic metaphor for what she’s feeling and experiencing.

reviews.name: Peter Keough
reviews.message: Though murky and ambiguous, Cervera’s film affirms a woman’s right to choose.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: A horror film that doubles as a parable of post-partum depression, something with the creeping anxiety of Polanski’s Repulsion or Rosemary’s Baby.

reviews.name: Nora Lee Mandel
reviews.message: Redolent with the supernatural, the disturbing images of bent demonic bodies are matched by the cracking sound design of breaking bones. This visually enthralling film is centered on Natalia Solián’s striking first film performance.

reviews.name: C.H. Newell
reviews.message: Huesera stages an existential battle between the weight of expectations that come along with heteronormativity versus the reality of queer people who are forced to conform to hetero norms and what happens when they break free of the spell later in life.

reviews.name: Whang Yee Ling
reviews.message: A debut feature director with a distinctive voice fluent in local lore, making a forthright statement on maternal ambivalence.

reviews.name: Carla Hay
reviews.message: Huesera: The Bone Woman delivers plenty of creepy images and convincing acting performances. Just don't expect a clear and complete explanation for all of the disturbing incidents in this effective horror movie.

reviews.name: Molly Henery
reviews.message: Huesera: The Bone Woman takes a spine-tingling crack at showcasing the dangers of not being true to who you are.

reviews.name: Randy Myers
reviews.message: Announces the welcome arrival of a new horror filmmaker [Michelle Garza Cervera] who knows how to tell a damn good, multi-layered story that has a purpose and a vision.

reviews.name: Aaron Neuwirth
reviews.message: Thanks to a combination of effects and performance artists contorting themselves in ways designed to shock, enough imagery is present (along with effective sound design) to make for a solid horror entry from director Michaelle Garza Cervera.

reviews.name: Joey Keogh
reviews.message: The most troubling thing about "Huesera: The Bone Woman" may just be how much of it will ring true to any woman watching.

reviews.name: Leonardo Garcia Tsao
reviews.message: Michelle Garza Cervera exercises the genre from an unmistakable feminine perspective. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Heidy Morales
reviews.message: Although the film is very Mexican... the story is still very universal. 'Huesera: The Bone Woman' is now part of the list of films crafting an insightful character study from a female perspective, in the guise of a psychological, body horror.

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: Led by an excellent principal actress, the psychological thrills, corporeal terror, and popular tales intertwine within an unsettling parable for abnegation.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Trace Thurman
reviews.message: Natalia Solián's exceptional lead performance and some outstanding sound design elevate this deliberately-paced pregnancy tale.

reviews.name: Rene Sanchez
reviews.message: An unsettling Mexican drama with horror elements about motherhood and the weight of the expectations imposed by society. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Amie Simon
reviews.message: While HUESERA falls under the category of body horror, it’s not exactly the kind you’re expecting. There’s plenty of cracking bones & skittering spirits, but underneath all that is the kind of dread a woman feels from giving up parts of herself ...

reviews.name: Gavia Baker-Whitelaw
reviews.message: Building on the genre defined by Rosemary’s Baby in the 1960s, director Michelle Garza Cervera blends feminist commentary with folkloric horror.

reviews.name: Joe Lipsett
reviews.message: Featuring a stunning lead performance by newcomer Natalia Solián, Huesera has great foley work, some good jump scares, and lots to say about queerness and motherhood.

reviews.name: Joshua Rivera
reviews.message: Huesera devotes its time to something a little more complicated than a shopworn story about a woman changed by impending motherhood.

reviews.name: Michael Talbot-Haynes
reviews.message: Huesera: The Bone Woman will take your conception of the limits of the horror genre and break every bone in its body.

reviews.name: Jenn Adams
reviews.message: Cervera’s film is not only an effective ghost story with a unique creature at its heart, but a brutally honest exploration of conflicted motherhood and the pressures women often feel to be perfect.

reviews.name: Hope Madden
reviews.message: Her maternal nightmare is bright and decisive, pulling in common genre tropes only long enough to grant entrance to the territory of a central metaphor.

reviews.name: Rudie Obias
reviews.message: Huesera: The Bone Woman is a fantastic first film that shows a lot of potential from the director.

reviews.name: Andrew Wyatt
reviews.message: Part of the captivating intelligence of Cervera’s film lies in how the initial depiction of Valeria slowly unravels, revealing the existential terror just beneath her tissue-thin façade of joyful anticipation.

reviews.name: Sara Michelle Fetters
reviews.message: Huesera: The Bone Woman is not for the faint of heart.

reviews.name: Dennis Harvey
reviews.message: Huesera plays it both ways, to somewhat confused ultimate impact. Nonetheless, it’s visually and sonically interesting, with Cervera making a confident feature directorial bow.

reviews.name: Abbie Bernstein
reviews.message: Huesera is an unconventional look at its subject matter...  What we do expect, and what we satisfyingly receive, is a genuine sense of dread, in a thoughtful context.

reviews.name: Christian Valentin
reviews.message: Huesera: The Bone Woman marries social and supernatural dread in subtly engrossing fashion, although broken-bone traumatophobes will probably want to give this one a very wide berth.

reviews.name: Andiee Paviour
reviews.message: Pregnancy is a nightmarish enemy for a woman tormented by doubt.

reviews.name: Laura Hiros
reviews.message: The excellent performances and the impeccable script of Abia Castillo and Garza Cervera herself speaks of classism, appearances and above all that synergy between good and evil, of those things that exist but are not talked about. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jon Mendelsohn
reviews.message: Huesera: The Bone Woman offers a unique take on a Mexican urban legend, but would have benefitted from a tighter narrative.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: Cervera's triumphant debut offering really gets under the skin. The pace and overall lack of ‘scares’ may not be to everyone's tastes, but Huesera delivers a powerful, engaging, and sometimes bruising experience.

reviews.name: Jennie Kermode
reviews.message: Wonderfully uncomfortable.

reviews.name: Jonathan DeHaan
reviews.message: Huesera is light on Horror but it’s a darker and more frank storty about pregnancy than we’re usually given.

reviews.name: Daniel Gorman
reviews.message: It’s mostly impressive stuff, but the abrupt, opaque ending is truly astounding, sure to be interpreted as happy or depressing depending on the individual.

reviews.name: Katie Rife
reviews.message: [Huesera] accomplishes a lofty goal for genre cinema: Taking a familiar formula and turning it into a personal statement.

reviews.name: Pete Vonder Haar
reviews.message: As assured as the direction is and as effective as the scares are, it's hard to believe this is Cervara's first film. She's a director we're going to be watching for a very long time, maybe as long as I fear Huesera is going to stick with me.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: With brilliant cinematography and an excellent performance to anchor it, Huesera: The Bone Woman is a must-see.

reviews.name: Natalia Winkelman
reviews.message: “Huesera” is the type of staggering supernatural nightmare that is as transfixing as it is terrifying.

title: Cleopatra
description: "Cleopatra" is a lengthy, sprawling, spectacular love story, helmed by Joseph L. Mankiewicz, depicting Cleopatra's manipulation of Julius Caesar and Marc Antony in her ill-fated attempt to save the Egyptian empire. This threesome in one of the most famous and gloriously powerful love triangles ever to be captured on film.

characteristics.Producer:: Walter Wanger
characteristics.Writer:: Sidney Buchman, Carlo Mario Franzero, Ranald MacDougall, Joseph L. Mankiewicz

reviews.name: Dilys Powell
reviews.message: The difficulty for the performer of getting out from under the scenery, the sets, the costumes and the colour and making an impression not as a member of the cast but as an actor (or actress) is severe.

reviews.name: Judith Crist
reviews.message: I must report that this film is at best a major disappointment, at worst an extravagant exercise in tedium.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: Far from the sumptuous sets that reproduce antiquity with a certain authenticity, 'Cleopatra' is an epic spectacle to which I find nothing but an erratic and artificious result in its four hours and eleven minutes of length. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Penelope Houston
reviews.message: As the sets seem to grow bigger and bigger, so progressively the players dwindle.

reviews.name: Merl Edelman
reviews.message: Worth a look.... for a single performance: Rex Harrison as Caesar.

reviews.name: Clyde Gilmour
reviews.message: Rex Harrison is the undisputed hit of the show as a subtle and sardonic Julius Caesar...

reviews.name: Dwight MacDonald
reviews.message: The spectacular scenes were confused and oddly minuscule... Still and all, there was Elizabeth Taylor. At first I was disappointed, a large statement considering my expectations. Then I realized what she was up to and didn't regret my $1.25.

reviews.name: Brooke Corso
reviews.message: To watch this film is to see the Hollywood story itself.

reviews.name: James Plath
reviews.message: It may not be as compelling and tightly edited as Ben-Hur, but Cleopatra is still a Hollywood epic that tells a grand story in a grand way. Save it for a night when the family feels like a four-hour spectacle.

reviews.name: Josh Larsen
reviews.message: ...a tale of two men being manipulated, and possibly loved, by a powerful and conflicted woman.

reviews.name: Andrea Beach
reviews.message: Four-hour visual stunner requires patience, maturity.

reviews.name: Richard Brody
reviews.message: Taylor inhabits the role with a focussed but uninhibited imperiousness, as when she turns Cleopatra's entrance into Rome, aboard a giant rolling sphinx, into the ultimate red-carpet photo op.

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: The film has a spectacular variety of liabilities (and, to be fair, strengths as well), but the most visible and crushing is that's an utter dud as a star vehicle.

reviews.name: Ken Hanke
reviews.message: A lumbering monstrosity of a movie with all manner of preposterous hairstyles and improbable fashions. Worth seeing -- once anyway -- at least as wayward legend.

reviews.name: Jennie Kermode
reviews.message: Though it owes as much to Shakespeare's interpretation and to Roman propaganda as to the historical record, this interpretation of the great queen's life succeeds in conveying something of the intelligence and force of personality her opponents feared.

reviews.name: Adrian Turner
reviews.message: The film at least manages to make some sense of an extraordinary moment in history, as Rome expanded from republic to empire.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: A stately but sometimes mindboggling spectacle.

reviews.name: Matthew Thrift
reviews.message: Melodramatic, and camp as Christmas, but nothing like the disaster its reputation suggests.

reviews.name: Trevor Johnston
reviews.message: It's a once-in-a-lifetime experience, for good and ill.

reviews.name: Emanuel Levy
reviews.message: Much maligned, this Cleopatra might be the most expensive movie made, but not the worst, just an overly verbose affair, effective as star vehicle for Elizabeth Taylor, who commands regally, and Burton, who delivers his lines with authority and pathos.

reviews.name: Ian Nathan
reviews.message: For four hours this moody, glossy pantomime leadenly plods on, saying much more about the hubris and excess of old-time Hollywood thinking than the burnished glories of an ancient world.

reviews.name: Billy Mowbray
reviews.message: A giant of a movie that is sometimes lumbering, but ever watchable thanks to its uninhibited ambition, size and glamour.

reviews.name: Dave Kehr
reviews.message: [A] general muddle.

reviews.name: Variety Staff
reviews.message: Cleopatra is not only a supercolossal eye-filler (the unprecedented budget shows in the physical opulence throughout), but it is also a remarkably literate cinematic recreation of an historic epoch.

reviews.name: Geoff Andrew
reviews.message: Harrison, doing his waspish don act as Caesar, alone rises above mediocrity.

reviews.name: Bosley Crowther
reviews.message: It is a surpassing entertainment, one of the great epic films of our day.

reviews.name: James Powers
reviews.message: Power and passion are the twin and intertwined themes of Cleopatra, and they have never burned with greater intensity or amid such opulence as they do in this extraordinary film.

reviews.name: Marjorie Baumgarten
reviews.message: Taylor, Burton, and Harrison are sublime in this sweeping epic of love and nations.

reviews.name: Mike DeWolfe
reviews.message: The movie is also dotted with some battle sequences of nearly epic proportions, but they can't make up for Cleopatra's shortcomings in plot and acting.

reviews.name: James Sanford
reviews.message: opulent and empty, it dares you not to take a nap

reviews.name: Frank Leyendecker
reviews.message: Cleopatra will go down in film history as the most opulent, pictorially magnificent and eye-filling screen spectacle ever made -- as well as the longest.

reviews.name: Dragan Antulov
reviews.message: A stunning achievement compared to its present day counterparts.

reviews.name: Dan Jardine
reviews.message: A giant white elephant of a movie, a bloated monument to hubris and excess.

reviews.name: John A. Nesbit
reviews.message: amazing that 20th Century Fox survived this train wreck long enough to produce Star Wars some 14 years later

reviews.name: Christopher Null
reviews.message: It's asp-tastic.

reviews.name: James Kendrick
reviews.message: A moderately successful, generally entertaining, but overly ambitious movie.

reviews.name: John J. Puccio
reviews.message: ...not required viewing by any means, nor is it the bomb it is sometimes made out to be...

title: The Stranger
description: A friendship forms between two strangers. For Henry Teague (Sean Harris), worn down by a lifetime of physical labor, this is a dream come true. His new friend Mark (Joel Edgerton) becomes his savior and ally. However, neither is who they appear to be, each carry secrets that threaten to ruin them -- and in the background, one of the nation's largest police operations is closing in.

characteristics.Producer:: Rachel Gardner, Iain Canning, Emile Sherman, Kerry Kohansky-Roberts, Kim Hodgert, Joel Edgerton

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: To call it an impressive and offbeat crime drama is putting it very lightly.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: A movie whose every dark or overcast shot, every quiet conversion and every revelation contributes to the rising tension and the inescapable gloom tinged with grief that follows this "Stranger” — up close, and from a distance — from beginning to end.

reviews.name: Fionnuala Halligan
reviews.message: Wright crafts a hyper-elaborate set-up and delicate drip-feed of information which make spoilers an equal crime, but The Stranger is more of a felt experience than a traditional policier.

reviews.name: Jack King
reviews.message: An annoying chore. A stronger second half comes some way in making the ordeal worth it if you haven’t already dropped off for a tactical mid-fest snooze.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: The Stranger offers strong, subtle performances from its leads, and a freshly vital approach to familiar material.

reviews.name: Jordan Ruimy
reviews.message: Wright artfully directs his film with the kind of precision that’ll keep you hanging on to every shot.

reviews.name: Andrew Murray
reviews.message: There is a good film in The Stranger somewhere. But viewers will have to wade through a lot of clunky chronology to find it.

reviews.name: Jeffrey M. Anderson
reviews.message: This quiet, sly crime movie is yet another gem from Australia's Blue-Tongue collective.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: Finely tuned unconventional crime drama about a brooding psychopath protagonist.

reviews.name: Jim Schembri
reviews.message: Generating an increasingly tense, immersive atmosphere, [director Thomas M] Wright gets some intense performances from his leads in a skilfully minimalist film

reviews.name: Dennis Harvey
reviews.message: ...dramatic fiction with thematic overlaps to Al-Khatib’s documentary...

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: It does move to its own unique gritty rhythm. But once you get in step with it, it’s hard to turn away.

reviews.name: Robin Clifford
reviews.message: The mystery is always kept to your attention and the police procedural that results is fascinating.

reviews.name: Laura Clifford
reviews.message: Writer/director Thomas M. Wright’s true crime suspense thriller is a collection of shattered fragments, from its crosscutting among various story and timelines to the shattered psyches of its protagonists...

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: The film builds up as the story moves forward and revitalizes the undercover cop genre to focus on the perturbed psyche of the policeman in question. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Brian Costello
reviews.message: One of the best things to be said about this is that it's difficult to get too much into why The Stranger works without spoiling the story.

reviews.name: Brian Tallerico
reviews.message: Taut and effective.

reviews.name: Petr Navovy
reviews.message: Sean Harris further cements his reputation as one of the most magnetic screen actors today; sporting a colossal beard and shoulder-length hair, his character here is an endlessly watchable presence and enigma.

reviews.name: Jorge Loser
reviews.message: Toes the dangerous line of befriending the enemy and transcends the final results of an investigation. It's cryptic, hard, sober, and at times too disperse... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Wenlei Ma
reviews.message: The Stranger is spare, disciplined storytelling with stark visuals and a strained tone.

reviews.name: Ferdosa Abdi
reviews.message: The Stranger proves that Wright is a capable director and writer who can create a compelling piece of art that unsettles audiences.

reviews.name: Rohan Naahar
reviews.message: The title hardly represents the kind of slow-burn death stare into the heart of the abyss that this film is.

reviews.name: Molly Adams
reviews.message: With such unswerving focus on a single atmosphere, the film can drift into repetitiveness, and even Edgerton and Harris’ captivating performances can’t entirely carry the film through its sagging middle.

reviews.name: Andiee Paviour
reviews.message: The lonely toll of undercover police work is intensified to maximum grimness by its life-and-death stakes.

reviews.name: Diego Batlle
reviews.message: ... A fascinating and perturbing psychological thriller. In spite of such a generic title, this film avoids genre conventions and tropes. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: Wright remarkably shows you how instead of iron fists as tools, we see Edgerton’s Mark uses something entirely different — empathy.

reviews.name: Chris Joyce
reviews.message: The pace is patient and even slow at times, made more noticeable by repeated vague imagery, but on the whole, this drama provides a thrilling watch in a subdued presentation.

reviews.name: Travis Johnson
reviews.message: A film of nigh-unparalleled tension.

reviews.name: Chase Hutchinson
reviews.message: What makes The Stranger work is how this all creates an experience that feels as though the two men have become almost doomed to a life where they will aimlessly wander in what feels like an Australian purgatory.

reviews.name: Ema Sasic
reviews.message: "The Stranger" reminds us that sometimes the most horrifying stories are the ones found in reality, not on the big screen or in the pages of a book.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: This was always going to be an inherently discomforting and distressing movie, but it's also an unwaveringly intelligent and impressive examination of trauma.

reviews.name: Keva York
reviews.message: Wright is undoubtedly working in the same grim idiom that has occupied Kurzel since his grizzly 2011 feature debut, Snowtown: the latent violence of the Australian landscape, as channelled by damaged men living on the fringes.

reviews.name: Thomas Caldwell
reviews.message: A highly sophisticated film about fractured identities and the way the trauma of a violent crime continues to resonate beyond the original incident.

reviews.name: Ben Rolph
reviews.message: It’s truly well-made on all fronts, with some solid, tension-filled sound work alongside brooding cinematography and a set of delicate performances led by a great director.

reviews.name: Simon Miraudo
reviews.message: Deft, delicate and empathetic, yet ultimately piercing and unforgiving. A phenomenal work.

reviews.name: Stephen A. Russell
reviews.message: Wright at least has something more to say with The Stranger. Of double lives and lines crossed, of what it takes to catch a monster and keep that darkness from your door.

reviews.name: Paul Byrnes
reviews.message: In tone, the film is brilliantly hidden. It takes a long while to work out what’s happening. The atmosphere is gloomy, distrustful, brutal in language, with a jangly soundscape and music.

reviews.name: Anthony Frajman
reviews.message: … a standout, a high-octane look into the pursuit of a criminal – a compelling and measured film that delivers …

reviews.name: Luke Buckmaster
reviews.message: To call it an unconventionally impressive crime drama is to put it very lightly.

reviews.name: Ryan Leston
reviews.message: It’s the kind of thriller that only comes along every once in a while -- truly unsettling and with enough twists and turns to not only keep you interested but on your toes.

title: Fast Five
description: Ever since ex-cop Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) and Mia Torretto (Jordana Brewster) broke her brother Dom (Vin Diesel) out of custody, they've traveled border to border to evade authorities. In Rio de Janeiro, they must do one final job before they can gain their freedom for good. Assembling their elite team of car racers, Brian and Dom know they must confront the corrupt businessman who wants them dead, before the federal agent (Dwayne Johnson) on their trail finds them.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Intense Sequences of Violence|Intense Sequences of Action|Language|Sexual Content)
characteristics.Producer:: Neal H. Moritz, Vin Diesel, Michael Fottrell

reviews.name: Brett Doze
reviews.message: This may largely be the consensus pick for best of the series, but there’s certainly a reason for that.

reviews.name: Rene Jordan
reviews.message: Affords itself the luxury of passing two and a half hours within being boring. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: It’s Johnson who seems to be having the most fun with his performance. Whether he’s hamming it up with the stereotypical tough guy oneliners or throwing haymakers, Johnson is a great fit.

reviews.name: Shaun Munro
reviews.message: Fast Five crystallised the series' dominant formula with its appealing ensemble cast and spectacular action - particularly that unforgettable vault haul across Rio.

reviews.name: Miles Surrey
reviews.message: The choice to unite every major character and give them seemingly superhuman strength not only resulted in one of the best action blockbusters of the 2010s-it saved the Fast & Furious franchise...

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: In typical sequel form, an attempt to outdo the predecessor takes priority.

reviews.name: Richard Propes
reviews.message: By the way, whose idea was it to team Vin Diesel and Dwayne Johnson? Unfreakingbelievably inspired.

reviews.name: Brent McKnight
reviews.message: This is the kind of movie where they throw two grenades, because one grenade is never enough. And that's a good thing.

reviews.name: Evan Dossey
reviews.message: Diesel's ode to fatherhood is an action-fest that holds against everything that has come since.

reviews.name: Micheal Compton
reviews.message: When it comes to ridiculously silly, fast-paced action movies, I guess you could do worse than "Fast Five." You could also do a lot better.

reviews.name: Abbie Bernstein
reviews.message: It's quick, it has an actual enjoyable heist storyline and it's good fun.

reviews.name: Kelly Jane Torrance
reviews.message: Do we really need a fifth movie filled with car races, car chases and car crashes? Of course not. But then, we also don't need the Mercedes-Benz SLR McLaren or the Autobahn. But they add an awfully lot of fun to our short, brutal lives.

reviews.name: Candice Frederick
reviews.message: Check your brain at the door.

reviews.name: Dwight Brown
reviews.message: From the opening, adrenalin-pumping prison bus escape to a heart-pounding car theft aboard a fast-moving train, Fast Five throws it down from the jump.

reviews.name: Jason Bailey
reviews.message: Each movie has two very good action scenes, usually at either end, but then about an hour and a half of the most asinine tough-guy nonsense between them.

reviews.name: Josh Larsen
reviews.message: ...achieves the sort of zen chaos that defines the Die Hard films

reviews.name: John Hanlon
reviews.message: Hard-core fans of the series with enjoy it but others should steer away from this over-the-top action flick.

reviews.name: Will Leitch
reviews.message: Forty minutes of this movie are big dumb fun. The other 85 forget the fun part.

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: Has really transformed this series from camp action cinema to exciting heist cinema.

reviews.name: Austin Kennedy
reviews.message: The last 2 entries were stupid too, but at least this one was well directed and features some of the most impressive stunt work I've seen in years.

reviews.name: Benjo Colautti
reviews.message: Fast Five boasts incredible action scenes that are all varied and equally exciting. The film is full of clean, well choreographed shots that are easy to watch and the cast works great as a whole unit, making the film's running time breeze by.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Lyles
