reviews.message: Like a shot of nitro to the franchise and shows there's plenty left in the tank.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Manages to be more fun than any movie with its outrageous carbon footprint has any right to be.

reviews.name: Ben Kendrick
reviews.message: The series has found new traction in the heist format -- resulting in a fun and immensely entertaining ride.

reviews.name: Jeff Beck
reviews.message: One film was enough, two was plenty, but five is just absurd. Undoubtedly, there will be several people who will flock to this film just because it has cars zooming back and forth, so at least some people will be pleased with it.

reviews.name: Michael Dequina
reviews.message: The jauntier vibe makes for easier viewing between the big high-speed car set pieces, which are every bit as big, loud, and crazily over-the-top preposterous as one would expect and hope.

reviews.name: Laurence Boyce
reviews.message: It's about cars, girls and fighting and doesn't pretend to be anything else. For sheer gall alone, "Fast Five" provides much entertainment. Just not much intellect.

reviews.name: Leah Rozen
reviews.message: Fast Five is grindingly mechanical -- and not just because of all the emphasis on car repairs and retooling.

reviews.name: Sean Axmaker
reviews.message: Forget physics, it's just a fun blast of action movie ingenuity, as is the film as a whole.

reviews.name: Rob Humanick
reviews.message: It's not like I'm asking for The Road Warrior... just some basic coverage and a less-than-total reliance on camera movement to generate excitement.

reviews.name: Brandon Fibbs
reviews.message: Director Justin Lin has a spooky, second sense for staging bombastic action sequences, even if he breaks every law in physics to make them work.

reviews.name: Brian Gibson
reviews.message: Spins its wheels. Shifts between gravel-voiced speeches (about true family) and bicep-offs. Throttling dialogue, long hard looks, and heist clichs skid on for blocks.

reviews.name: Jim Schembri
reviews.message: There's arguably even more gun and car play than in F&F4, with the prolonged car chase finale easily chiming in as the best, most imaginative one in the franchise so far.

reviews.name: David Poland
reviews.message: It's trying so hard to pleasepleasepleasepleaseplease. But that's also why it's entertaining

reviews.name: Bruce Bennett
reviews.message: For those needing preposterous stunts, laugh-out-loud bad dialogue, testosterone-fueled posturing and an "Ocean's 11"-like plot apparently written by and for 13-year-old boys.

reviews.name: D.K. Holm
reviews.message: nostalgic for older team films, and a world in which people interacted face to face

reviews.name: Jim Judy
reviews.message: 'Fast Five delivers what a dumb, popcorn flick is supposed to and easily passes my standard 'guy-movie' litmus test -- it makes one want to drive fast after seeing it, high gas prices or not. (Parental Content Review also available)

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...a frustratingly protracted piece of work that should have been so much better...

reviews.name: Steve Newall
reviews.message: Street racing is dialed down in favour of Ocean's Eleven-style heist plotting and favela gunplay straight out of Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare 2.

title: The Fast and the Furious
description: Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel) enjoys the adrenaline of street car racing and his fans treat him like a rock star. After a blazing encounter with the ruthless Johnny Tran, Dom decides to take Brian (Paul Walker), a newcomer to street racing, under his wing. Dom's sister Mia sees something she likes in Brian, too. Trouble is, neither of them realize he's an undercover cop, and Dominic and his rival Johnny Tran are both the prime suspects in a case involving dirty money and big-rig hijacking.

characteristics.Producer:: Neal H. Moritz
characteristics.Writer:: Gary Scott Thompson, Erik Bergquist, David Ayer, Gary Scott Thompson
characteristics.Production Co:: Universal Pictures, Neal H. Moritz Productions, Original Film
characteristics.Sound Mix:: Dolby A, Dolby Stereo, DTS, SDDS, Surround, Dolby SR, Dolby Digital

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: While other storytellers embraced high-concept action spectacle, producer Neal H. Moritz made a bet on old-school grounded action. While it took a decade for audiences to buy into the vision, the plan culminated in one of the definitive franchises.

reviews.name: Brett Doze
reviews.message: In actuality, it’s where the seeds were planted for the characters that continue to stick around. Give the film credit for actually being fairly character-driven, despite the action-heavy scenes...

reviews.name: Shaun Munro
reviews.message: Between its charming, impossibly attractive cast, stunning practical stunts, and unapologetic commitment to melodramatic cop-show froth, The Fast and the Furious holds up better than you might expect.

reviews.name: Joe Leydon
reviews.message: A film that should serve to define "guilty pleasure" for at least the rest of the summer.

reviews.name: Shea Serrano
reviews.message: It's about the small things that made the franchise's first and smallest movie so enjoyable, and so mesmerizing...

reviews.name: Peter Canavese
reviews.message: This 4K HD 25th Anniversary blu-ray steel box re-issue is more about the packaging than anything of an overblown, not-very-interesting movie.

reviews.name: Leigh Paatsch
reviews.message: Anything resembling dialogue or storytelling is actually just a mini-trampoline that allows TFAF to jump to higher levels of stupendous stuntery as the minutes and scenery flash by.

reviews.name: Roxane Gay
reviews.message: Exudes testosterone, American brawn... amazing car chases and races; it's a gear head's wet dream.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Lyles
reviews.message: A spectacular start to one of Hollywood's most surprising and popular franchises ever.

reviews.name: Nell Minow
reviews.message: This is a bad, bad movie. Skip it.

reviews.name: Cole Smithey
reviews.message: Sure it's a guilty pleasure watching stunt drivers put flashy state-of-the-art streetcars through impossibly daring maneuvers, but it's a happy indulgence nonetheless.

reviews.name: Felix Gonzalez Jr.
reviews.message: ... when characters are not racing at breakneck speed, the movie as a whole ceases to move.

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: May be a cheesy movie, but it's a fun cheesy movie.

reviews.name: Jeffrey M. Anderson
reviews.message: It's all testosterone and swagger, and tries so hard to be cool that it's just the opposite.

reviews.name: Andrew Anthony
reviews.message: Not Point Break so much as Point Less.

reviews.name: Richard Luck
reviews.message: An exciting second-tier action flick.

reviews.name: Todd McCarthy
reviews.message: A gritty and gratifying cheap thrill, Rob Cohen's high-octane hot-car meller is a true rarity these days, a really good exploitationer, the sort of thing that would rule at drive-ins if they still existed.

reviews.name: Reece Pendleton
reviews.message: While few of the paper-thin characters register long enough to make much of an impression, Diesel carries the movie with his unsettling mix of Zen-like tranquillity and barely controlled rage.

reviews.name: Joe Lozito
reviews.message: It runs out of gas.

reviews.name: Adam Smith
reviews.message: This is probably the most fun to be had at the multiplex so far this year.

reviews.name: Emanuel Levy
reviews.message: From first frame to last, this is an unabashedly B-Picture, elevated by A-level stunts but dragged down to C-level characterizations.

reviews.name: Keith Phipps
reviews.message: Flaws and all, The Fast And The Furious benefits from the feel of grit on rubber.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...ultimately entertaining enough to warrant a mild recommendation...

reviews.name: Heather Wadowski
reviews.message: At first it's an exhilarating ride with original action scenes that quickly become routine when they are thrown at the audience over and over.

reviews.name: Steven Snyder
reviews.message: A film that stays true to what it tries to be.

reviews.name: Michael E. Grost
reviews.message: Visually striking thriller.

reviews.name: Michael Szymanski
reviews.message: The plot gets ridiculous as it's slowly revealed that one of them isn't what they seem to be at first, and continues to get more preposterous, but with better car crashes!

reviews.name: Michael W. Phillips, Jr.
reviews.message: What is unforgivable is that many of the racing scenes were boring too.

reviews.name: MaryAnn Johanson
reviews.message: It's dumb as a post, sure, but man, does it get your heart pounding and the adrenaline racing through your bloodstream.

reviews.name: Jim Shelby
reviews.message: Though it might as well be called The Dopey and the Deafening, this is the kind of overblown junk food that summer flicks are all about.

reviews.name: Harry Guerin
reviews.message: A plot that could be written on the back of a pine tree car freshener.

reviews.name: Brian Mckay
reviews.message: Pretty cars, Pretty people, Pretty lame, and Pretty long . . . It isn't all that furious, and it certainly doesn't go by fast enough

reviews.name: John R. McEwen
reviews.message: Walker's characterization is like a brick wall at the end of the quarter mile, bringing credibility to a dead and deadly stop every time he opens his mouth.

reviews.name: David Poland
reviews.message: I can't hate The Fast and the Furious. It's not a hateable movie.

reviews.name: Matthew Turner
reviews.message: High-octane action thriller that does exactly what it says on the tin: fast cars, great stunts, cool characters and a halfway-decent plot, it's B-movie heaven.

reviews.name: Stephen Himes
reviews.message: Trash like The Fast and the Furious really boils my blood.

reviews.name: Margaret A. McGurk
reviews.message: Melodramatic, preposterous, excessive -- this movie is all that. Yet it is also magnetically appealing.

reviews.name: Jon Niccum
reviews.message: Cohen uses speed the way most filmmakers use lighting or color.

title: Avatar: The Way of Water
description: Set more than a decade after the events of the first film, "Avatar: The Way of Water" begins to tell the story of the Sully family (Jake, Neytiri, and their kids), the trouble that follows them, the lengths they go to keep each other safe, the battles they fight to stay alive, and the tragedies they endure.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Partial Nudity|Intense Action|Sequences of Strong Violence|Some Strong Language)
characteristics.Producer:: James Cameron, Jon Landau
characteristics.Writer:: James Cameron, Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver

reviews.name: Jared Mobarak
reviews.message: We can accept a barebones revenger because it lets us reacquaint ourselves with Pandora. Cameron is easing us back in with a conflict we don't need to expend too much energy on so we can absorb everything else in the background.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: I’ll say this for James Cameron: At this point, he can slap his name on an old print of Plan 9 From Outer Space, re-release it as Avatar 3: The Way of Outer Space, and incessantly hype it until it crosses the billion-dollar mark and racks up the awards.

reviews.name: Filipe Freitas
reviews.message: This is a blatant example where the visual spectacle (it can dazzle but also fatigue) swallows up an unexceptional story.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: ... It might be tiresome in a world less lovingly, painstakingly rendered than Pandora, which has no shortage of eye-boggling backdrops to distract us from the humdrum interpersonal conflicts and the cheeseball dialogue, a Cameron staple.

reviews.name: A.S. Hamrah
reviews.message: By the time Cameron finishes these things he’ll be a form of consciousness uploaded to the Cloud, married to a hologram of Mia Goth.

reviews.name: Hugo Hernández Valdivia
reviews.message: A lot of audiovisual marvels offer a sensible mark upon a film that does not reach greater depths.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Ross Anthony
reviews.message: Why not strip it down to the sincere basics? Get the family out of the forest faster, and for a more respectable reason. In fact, the subplot of the forest family living among the water people is way better than the main plot. Gorgeous though.

reviews.name: Carolyn Hinds
reviews.message: It’s a shame that female characters have devolved since the first film, which came out over a decade ago.

reviews.name: Travis Johnson
reviews.message: But the film, for all its scale and excess, for all its lovingly detailed environments, feels bloated and less than the sum of its parts.

reviews.name: Marriska Fernandes
reviews.message: Avatar: The Way of Water is nothing short of a cinematic marvel, outweighing its predecessor on many fronts.

reviews.name: Annie Banks
reviews.message: Avatar: The Way of Water is more of an attraction than the movie itself - magnificent technology is swapped for dialogue deprived of meaning.

reviews.name: Bob Chipman
reviews.message: You can't deny: Experience matters.

reviews.name: Alison Gillmor
reviews.message: The visual experience is impressive and immersive, but it's no longer novel, which makes the hokeyness of the story — about the battle between the Indigenous inhabitants of the planet Pandora and would-be Earth colonizers — more noticeable.

reviews.name: Erin Schwartz
reviews.message: Avatar is like some rare mineral, produced by one man's ill-conceived aesthetic taste placed under the immense heat and pressure of the blockbuster industry. The product is scintillating, beautiful, and feels fairly useless.

reviews.name: David Walsh
reviews.message: Cameron ... has been fortunate to have emerged—and could only have emerged—in a culture that demanded so little: efficiency, productivity, special effects innovation, sustained bursts of mechanical spectacle, a minimum level of dramatic believability.

reviews.name: Corey Chichizola
reviews.message: [M]oviegoers have waited 12 years for Cameron’s sequel to finally arrive. Luckily its time has come, and Avatar: The Way of Water does not disappoint.

reviews.name: Marie Asner
reviews.message: James Cameron has done it again.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...a thoroughly needless followup that easily stands as Cameron’s least effective endeavor to date.

reviews.name: Andrew Kendall
reviews.message: In The Way of Water Cameron seems to be joyously beckoning for us to step into his mind and into a new world, so that even in the elegiac tone of the ending there is level of sweet kindness that feels new even for him.

reviews.name: Brett McCracken
reviews.message: The Way of Water is surprisingly conservative in its celebration of family and especially fatherhood.

reviews.name: Chris McCoy
reviews.message: In the midst of all the techno-wizardry, using mo-cap to empower Sigourney Weaver to play her own teenage daughter turns out to be Cameron’s greatest stroke of genius.

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: James Cameron once again crafts a beautiful visual world, but the script sags with repetitive story beats and an endless final battle. I'm thrilled the Oscars are nominating blockbusters again, but this is the weakest of the 10 Best Picture nominees.

reviews.name: Cameron Meier
reviews.message: It’s about what you would expect from writer-director James Cameron, a.k.a. Cecil B. DeMotionCapture. Like DeMille’s later films (not his early, edgier fare) and the original "Avatar," the sequel is big, spectacular and dumb.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: Sans water, that annoying motion-smoothing soap-opera look bubbles up, gimmickry sets in, and Pandora and the Na'vi appear far, far less visually spectacular.

reviews.name: Matthew Pejkovic
reviews.message: Pretty to look at but shallow deep.

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: A cinematic feast that shows the future of filmmaking is here.

reviews.name: Pete Vonder Haar
reviews.message: Luckily for Cameron, it's hard to check your watch while wearing 3D glasses.

reviews.name: Wesley Lovell
reviews.message: If you’re already a fan of the first Avatar, you will welcome a return to the realm of Pandora. Those who were lukewarm or hostile to the original won’t find anything new enough to merit consideration.

reviews.name: Eileen Jones
reviews.message: For three whole hours, Avatar: The Way of Water evokes Important Issues — imperialism, colonialism, racism, sexism, ransacking the environment for commodifiable resources — in the silliest, shallowest way possible.

reviews.name: Mattie Lucas
reviews.message: Cameron remains nearly unparalleled when it comes to crafting an action sequences, but it's the moments of sheer beauty in The Way of Water that really linger

reviews.name: Frantz Jerome
reviews.message: Appropriation and privilege run rampant throughout the development of this entire franchise.

reviews.name: Scott Campbell
reviews.message: Second time around, it feels as though Cameron was way too happy to simply rehash a number of story points ripped straight from the first Avatar, with minor cosmetic changes slapping on a fresh coat of paint that quickly turns stagnant

reviews.name: Víctor López G.
reviews.message: A magnificent audiovisual cathedral in which technology, creativity and hart row in the same direction, justifying by itself the existence of the big screen.

reviews.name: Matthew Jackson
reviews.message: ...one of cinema’s great blockbuster artists is back, and he’s delivered a film so packed with spectacle that even the original “Avatar” pales in comparison.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: I'm not sure anyone cares about Jake Sully and his family as much as James Cameron thinks they do.

reviews.name: Soham Gadre
reviews.message: Cameron did what he did in 2009 and he did it better. He once again is redefining what cinema’s future can be in the digital and technological age.

reviews.name: Devesh Sharma
reviews.message: Watch the film for its wonderfully crafted images that make you feel like you’re actually on an alien planet. The film’s message of loving your family and facing upheavals together as one will resonate with the Indian audience for sure.

reviews.name: Aaron White
reviews.message: Everything feels authentic, yet it’s also technically marvelous. There’s something masterful about what Cameron can do and it's refreshing to have this story take place outside of a long-lived IP where every plotline is on its third or fourth recycling.

reviews.name: Armond White
reviews.message: The Way of Water is predicated on an escapist mindset that prevents moviegoers from thinking (or expressing dissatisfaction). When a film like this is sold for its 3D, 48-frames-per-second High Dynamic Range teachnology, protect your credit card.

reviews.name: Poulomi Das
reviews.message: What you make of Avatar: The Way of Water depends largely on whether you’re inclined to give Cameron the benefit of doubt. In that, the film proves that there are some things that Cameron gets right, he does so with faultless precision.

title: Cocaine Bear
description: Inspired by the 1985 true story of a drug runner's plane crash, missing cocaine, and the black bear that ate it, this wild thriller finds an oddball group of cops, criminals, tourists and teens converging in a Georgia forest where a 500-pound apex predator has ingested a staggering amount of cocaine and gone on a coke-fueled rampage for more blow... and blood.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Drug Content|Bloody Violence and Gore|Language Throughout)
characteristics.Producer:: Phil Lord, Chris Miller, Elizabeth Banks, Max Handelman, Brian Duffield, Aditya Sood, Matt Reilly, Christine Sun
characteristics.Production Co:: Universal Studios, Lord Miller, Universal 1440 Entertainment, Brownstone Productions

reviews.name: Erik Childress
reviews.message: A film that believes it is taking us right up to the edge in bad taste comedy and violence. The problem is once it believes it has gotten to that edge, it just stares off into the distance along with us wondering where the laughs and terror will arrive.

reviews.name: Kip Mooney
reviews.message: Knows exactly what it is without striving for more or wearing out its welcome.

reviews.name: Noah Berlatsky
reviews.message: Elizabeth Banks tosses in all the gratuitous severed legs and dripping blood you could ask for in a horror movie, but it’s not really a horror movie. It's the kind of deftly timed physical comedy you don’t see that much on the big screen any more.

reviews.name: Alejandro Turdo
reviews.message: Wouldn't expect anything less from a far fetched based on true events movie about a bear going on a full cocaine rampage in the 80s. The ambulance chasing scene is Oscar clip material.

reviews.name: Sebastian Zavala Kahn
reviews.message: A cocktail that mixes blood with guts, black humour, lots of swear words (several of them uttered by the children) and a drugged bear, to develop an experience that will make you laugh and cringe (sometimes at the same time). Full review in Spanish.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: A movie called Cocaine Bear should not go easy on the outrageousness, but after a promising start, the film settles into a comfortable and safe groove.

reviews.name: Sean P. Means
reviews.message: “Cocaine Bear” reaches a point of diminishing returns, where everyone involved —onscreen, behind the camera and in the audience — realizes there’s not as much material here as was needed to fill 90-or-so minutes.

reviews.name: Amie Simon
reviews.message: Y’all know I was expecting a LOT of splatter, and I was not disappointed. The body count is high, the limbs are flying, there’s a really juicy brain shot, and praise be for all the practical F/X!

reviews.name: Preston Barta
reviews.message: 'Cocaine Bear' is a disappointment to those who know what's better. All the pieces are here. It just didn't know how to shred them and make them ooze with the joy the movie promised.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: Cocaine Bear makes for a very fun time. Horror fans will love to see the incredible kills and gore on display. This alone makes Cocaine Bear worth the price of admission.

reviews.name: Caffeinated Clint
reviews.message: Banks has baked a very entertaining and rather ingenious piece

reviews.name: Fausto Fernandez
reviews.message: Cocaine Bear is pure vice: a cartoon on speed (think Yogi Bear in South Park)... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Randy Meeks
reviews.message: The many protagonists are at fault for the film's creative stasis: they walk like cartoon characters lacking charisma and motivation. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Silly and contrived action-comedy caper....

reviews.name: Rubén Romero Santos
reviews.message: The approach required a director who had more love and respect for the B movie concept.  [Full review in Spanish].

reviews.name: Michael Calleri
reviews.message: This is not a great horror film, but it is a fun one if seen in a crowded movie theater with people having a rip-snorting good time screaming at the insanity. The film succeeds in its own way and certainly delivers on the horror side of the equation.

reviews.name: Sean Chandler
reviews.message: While I wish there was more time with the bear and less time with the very large cast, but it still just barely delivered enough schlocky fun to keep me entertained for 90 minutes.

reviews.name: Hernán Ferreirós
reviews.message: The problem with high-concept movies -- which premise you can explain in a single tweet -- is that once you present the concept on-screen, the only place to go is down. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Pablo O. Scholz
reviews.message: The encounters between the black bear and the characters border on parody. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jenn Adams
reviews.message: With a solid cast fully aware of the film’s mission, an over-the-top script with one foot in reality, and a truckload of gory special effects, Cocaine Bear proves to be much more than the sum of its parts.

reviews.name: Mary Beth McAndrews
reviews.message: Break out the mirrors and dollar bills because Cocaine Bear is one party you won’t want to miss.

reviews.name: Diego Batlle
reviews.message: Of course, if one comes to Cocaine Bear with low expectations and with a playful demeanor the experience can be pleasant, at least for a while... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: Cocaine Bear is a fun movie that works due to its impartial spirit and delirious sense of humor.

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: The objective of the film is, certainly, to offer us fun and a good dose of blood.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Rob Gonsalves
reviews.message: The tone is a very tricky needle to thread, but Banks does it.

reviews.name: Leonardo Garcia Tsao
reviews.message: Cocaine Bear isn't anything more than a desperate offering, trying to fill the void at the beginning of the year... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Niall Browne
reviews.message: More fluff than fur, Cocaine Bear lacks bite. It’s more like cocaine bore.

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: Makes the best of its premise and cast, pitting 15 good actors against a coked-up bear.

reviews.name: Rene Sanchez
reviews.message: Despite a few laughs and a couple of well-executed sequences, its wacky premise wears off rather quickly. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: It would benefit from being a lot more silly, a lot more of the time.

reviews.name: Luis Angel H. Mora
reviews.message: Cocaine Bear is as fun as it is scattershot. Full of great moments that shine separately, but that don't achieve a good cohesion between them. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Robin Holabird
reviews.message: Using vivid imaginations, writer Warden and director Banks send their pretend bear on a rampage...

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: Cocaine Bear betrays its invitation to excess and title's luster with a puritanism that, ironically, matches the biggest flaw of Banks' movie: superficiality. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Tony Baker
reviews.message: What I liked about this movie is that it was gory, it was unpredictable, I didn't even know who was going to live or die, and that always makes it more entertaining.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: Cocaine Bear has no style, no suspense, no functional comedy.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: It’s no “Snakes on a Plane,” but “Cocaine Bear” takes high-concept to another level and proves nothing is too outrageous for audiences desperate to laugh.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: Easily the best movie I've ever seen featuring a bear consuming a metric ton of cocaine. EASILY. Paddington could never.

reviews.name: Walter Chaw
reviews.message: It promises to be lawless, is what I'm saying, and very quickly shows itself to be entirely uninterested in transgressing boundaries.

reviews.name: Emma Simmonds
reviews.message: Ultimately, Jimmy Warden's script runs out of steam, but as Liotta and co grapple gamely with their furry adversary, they show the fun you can have by combining a B-movie concept with A-grade talent.

reviews.name: Margot Harrison
reviews.message: The whole thing feels like a half-hearted goof, a term paper on the real-life "cocaine bear" incident written by a kid who got bored of consulting Wikipedia and started making stuff up.

title: Knock at the Cabin
description: While vacationing at a remote cabin, a young girl and her parents are taken hostage by four armed strangers who demand that the family make an unthinkable choice to avert the apocalypse. With limited access to the outside world, the family must decide what they believe before all is lost.

characteristics.Producer:: M. Night Shyamalan, Marc Bienstock, Ashwin Rajan
characteristics.Writer:: M. Night Shyamalan, Steve Desmond, Michael Sherman
characteristics.Production Co:: Wishmore, FilmNation, Universal Studios, Dentsu, Blinding Edge Pictures, Perfect World Pictures

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: By completely dismantling and radically reworking the third act, Shyamalan has ended up with a film that leaves a bad taste in the mouth.

reviews.name: Fletcher Powell
reviews.message: You almost always have to decide if you’re willing to accept the obvious problems in [Shyamalan's] movies in order to also get the truly great stuff.

reviews.name: Stephen Kearse
reviews.message: As much as Shyamalan tries to cloak Knock at the Cabin’s central conflict in metaphysical horror and familial crisis, disbelief persists: The viewer is always aware that they are watching another trite and incurious M. Night Shyamalan film.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Lyles
reviews.message: A remarkably tense thriller with a killer premise placing the fate of humanity in the hands of one family. If it’s not Shyamalan’s best film, it’s undoubtedly in his top three.

reviews.name: Victor Pineyro
reviews.message: Shyamalan's obsession with the macabre, the weird and the disconcerting has turned him easily hooked to good premises that blur once you try to develop them. Dave Bautista is an incredible actor. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Ashvin Prakash
reviews.message: A movie with high stakes, but small horrors.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: Fans of the book will note that there will be a different ending. M Night Shyamalan is not Frank Darabont and does not yet have the directing gravitas to pull off that ending. In this current emotional atmosphere, it wouldn’t have been the right time.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: M. Night Shyamalan doesn’t reveal his hand until the very end. And then the discussion begins. Like so many of his films, “Knock at the Cabin” prompts many more questions than it answers.

reviews.name: Elissa Suh
reviews.message: Shymalan’s latest is compellingly perverse and wracked with a real sense of menace, making its hopeful denouement something of a betrayal.

reviews.name: Nicolás Delgadillo
reviews.message: A pretty profound idea to play with, but one that winds up clashing with the practicalities of the actual plot at hand.

reviews.name: Pablo Villaça
reviews.message: Knock at the Cabin works very well as we watch it, which is a step up from Shyamalan's latest efforts, which usually fell apart in real time. [Full review in Portuguese]

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: M. Night Shyamalan has built his reputation on psychological horror films with twist endings - but this one disappoints.

reviews.name: Linda Cook
reviews.message: "Knock at the Cabin" for suspense ... and a theme about sacrifice.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: Knock at the Cabin has enough going for it to warrant a watch. But it’d be wise to keep your expectations modest.

reviews.name: MaryAnn Johanson
reviews.message: There is only one thing worse than an M. Night Shyamalan movie with a twist ending. And that is one without a twist ending. Feels like a faith-based movie trying to sneak in under a disingenuous wire.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: Though at times you want it to deliver more on its promise, the conclusion sticks the landing in ways few Shayamalan films of late have managed to

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: While its questions about what we choose to put our faith in and why are as obvious as one late easy reveal, Knock at the Cabin earns two firm beliefs: in Shyamalan messing with vacations again, and in Bautista at his best.

reviews.name: Filipe Freitas
reviews.message: An artless film without the guts to bring the apocalyptic threat to life onscreen.

reviews.name: Marriska Fernandes
reviews.message: An intense apocalyptic thriller that's worth a watch.

reviews.name: Austin Burke
reviews.message: Dave Bautista is turning into an on-screen force. Filled with intense scenes and edge-of-your-seat moments, this film provides some nice thrills. That being said, the storytelling is clunky, and the ending falls short.

reviews.name: Trace Thurman
reviews.message: Removing the novel's ambiguity destroys a lot of the suspense that Shyamalan is trying to build.

reviews.name: Liam McEneaney
reviews.message: Only M. Night Shyamalan could make an apocalypse film that has audiences rooting for the end of the world, if only to bring the running time of 'Knock at the Cabin' to a merciful end.

reviews.name: Michael Atkinson
reviews.message: You have to wonder: Maybe Shyamalan’s merely a pious sentimentalist working in the wrong genre, cranking out the badtime stories only to compulsively douse them with the treacle of all-for-the-best theistic homilies.

reviews.name: Kimber Myers
reviews.message: ... Most of the pleasures of Knock at the Cabin arrive from two sources: Shyamalan’s masterful filmmaking and Bautista’s nuanced performance.

reviews.name: Jason Shawhan
reviews.message: I cannot remember the last time a film has left me this conflicted, angry, impressed and exhausted.

reviews.name: Candice Frederick
reviews.message: If there is some kind of allegory on violence that is supposed to be going on in “Knock at the Cabin,” the movie and its story are certainly not smart enough for it to come to fruition.

reviews.name: Joe Lipsett
reviews.message: Despite Dave Bautista's MVP performance and some great extreme close-up cinematography, Knock at the Cabin lacks ambiguity and the queerness feels like Gay 101 for straight people.

reviews.name: Mary Beth McAndrews
reviews.message: Technically beautiful and gorgeously cast, an uneven script keeps M. Night Shyamalan’s ‘Knock At The Cabin’ from packing a real punch.

reviews.name: Tim Grierson
reviews.message: Instead of pulling the rug out from under the viewer, Shyamalan goes in a direction that proves more disquieting, examining the nature of sacrifice and the bond between parents and children.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: M. Night's latest succeeds highly at one thing: proving to the world that Dave Bautista is the real deal. Any doubt about his acting ability should be left next to the popcorn in your seat.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: The world is a better place when Shyamalan just goes out there with a concept like this and does the damn thing.

reviews.name: Víctor López G.
reviews.message: It surprises in most of its development, in its formal games and in its display of pulse and containment while, at the same time, doesn't do it a tall when we realize that it's signed by an M. Night Shyamalan that never fails.

reviews.name: Kathleen Sachs
reviews.message: Shyamalan dazzles here with his gift for taking the kinds of ideas that once comprised the plots of pulp magazine stories, anthology television, and B movies and turning them into high art.

reviews.name: Eileen Jones
reviews.message: M. Night Shyamalan’s latest low-budget horror movie, Knock at the Cabin, is so overstuffed with exposition that even the end of the world is a letdown.

reviews.name: Jared Mobarak
reviews.message: The performances that Shyamalan coaxes out of his cast are extraordinary. And not just that of Bautista who has rightfully earned the majority of praise due to a career-best turn.

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: Twisted and confusing but I couldn't get it out of my mind.

reviews.name: Cody Leach
reviews.message: M. Night is always reliable in delivering intriguing premises that draw you in. This was no exception while it struggled to land the plane in the final act. Dave Bautista and Rupert Grint are standouts and have an iron grip on your attention.

reviews.name: Ben Turner
reviews.message: An ambitious idea that doesn't quite deliver, you'll buy into its premise only to find holes that could easily have been plugged. Though its cast behave like they're in a better film, Knock At The Cabin isn't greater than the sum of its parts.

reviews.name: Jenn Adams
reviews.message: Shyamalan puts his thumbs on the scales and dramatically changes Tremblay’s conclusion, shifting the story’s empathetic core and telling the audience in no uncertain terms who should be sacrificed and who should be saved.

reviews.name: Perri Nemiroff
reviews.message: A rock solid adaptation of the novel. There are changes, but both versions of the story work and both existing is bound to make the conversation/analysis of this scenario even richer.

title: X
description: In 1979, a group of young filmmakers set out to make an adult film in rural Texas, but when their reclusive, elderly hosts catch them in the act, the cast find themselves fighting for their lives.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Gore|Drug Use|Strong Sexual Content|Graphic Nudity|Language|Strong Bloody Violence)
characteristics.Producer:: Jacob Jaffke, Kevin Turen, Harrison Kreiss

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: Separately, X and Pearl might not have made my 10 Best of 2022 list; together, how could they not?

reviews.name: Steph Cozza
reviews.message: A gruesome slasher reminiscent of classic horror.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: Ends with a wholly satisfying finale and avoids the pitfalls of frustrating the audience, as so many independent horror films seem to do. It’s a slower burn for sure, but what a bloody, gory, rewarding ride.

reviews.name: Jared Mobarak
reviews.message: I can give X the benefit of the doubt [with hindsight], accepting it as an entrypoint into a much larger world regardless of how incomplete it ultimately feels on its own.

reviews.name: Samuel Leggett Jr.
reviews.message: X was true to its name, explicit sexual scenes, horrify scenarios & every more on the stories backdrop. But as a horror film Ti West nails it with his touch on horror story telling and worst case scenario perspective for every character it’s a insane ride

reviews.name: Candice Frederick
reviews.message: It’s crass and ghastly, with an on-the-nose premise fit for the often- sensationalist slasher genre and the salacious X-rated cinema embedded in this story.

reviews.name: Josie Melendez
reviews.message: The film itself goes beyond being merely a ‘blood and guts killer time’ with an array of porn star characters. It feeds into your adrenaline and spikes it up to ten.

reviews.name: Eric Marchen
reviews.message: If you're looking for a slow burn horror flick with plenty of atmosphere and faux-grindhouse aesthetics then X gon' give it to you!

reviews.name: Geordie Gray
reviews.message: The characters are fleshed-out and kooky — you’ll mourn when they meet their inevitable slaughter. And for a slasher, the acting is remarkably good: Jenna Ortega and Mia Goth in particular are scene-stealers.

reviews.name: Celia Mattison
reviews.message: X reanimates perennial fears of aging, older women, and one’s fading relevance.

reviews.name: Jordy Sirkin
reviews.message: X is a daring slasher, filled with unexpected twists that leave viewers stewing in uncomfortable moments and horrifying realizations.

reviews.name: Jessica Scott
reviews.message: X is a bold horror film that might just be the best dirty movie you’ve seen all year.

reviews.name: Ben Turner
reviews.message: If you go into this with your eyes open, it delivers a well-crafted slasher horror on all counts, even if its finale and body-count are hardly a surprise.

reviews.name: Zoë Rose Bryant
reviews.message: Ti West skillfully blends style with substance in A24’s X, delivering a riff on The Texas Chain Saw Massacre with a few subversive – and sexy – twists.

reviews.name: Rob Gonsalves
reviews.message: Whatever West is trying here doesn’t ultimately land, maybe because West himself doesn’t seem to care about any of these people.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: Raw, emotional, upsetting, and unafraid to take its audiences to grotesque places, X is one of the very best films of the year.

reviews.name: Cody Leach
reviews.message: X manages to tap into the nostalgic style of 70's horror while being a breath of fresh air for the genre. Ti West shows through his masterful directing, while winking at the audience, that you can put a ton of artistic flair into a "dirty movie."

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: Ti West’s “X” is an unashamed ode to slasher movies that manages to capture what makes the good ones good while still being hampered by what makes the bad ones bad.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: It pays homage to the adult film industry of the 70s, but I'm afraid it loses its guts by going through the easy and boring paths of conventional exploitation slasher. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jennifer Heaton
reviews.message: Now this is the modern-day answer to The Texas Chain Saw Massacre we’ve been waiting for!

reviews.name: Matt Glasby
reviews.message: There's lashings of sex and gore, plus a few surprises along the way.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: Smart, savvy and spectacularly staged while straddling and embracing that fine line between pleasure and pain.

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: Pure fun, X intelligently exploits the genre's codes without transgressing and incorporating small doses of humor for the seasoned viewer. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Víctor López G.
reviews.message: An exquisite filmic anachronism that, disguised as the usual slasher, develops a discourse that gets under the skin and that, ultimately, elevates it as one of the greatest and riskiest titles of 2022.

reviews.name: Josh Parham
reviews.message: The impressive direction and delightful performances, anchored by a terrific central turn from Goth, make this an enthralling horror entry that can satisfy the hunger for exciting spectacle and more sophisticated storytelling.

reviews.name: Andrew Wyatt
reviews.message: West's best film to date: a gooey, ebullient orgy of the lewd and the learned, the squalid and the sumptuous.

reviews.name: Jordan Ruimy
reviews.message: There’s nothing original about West’s highly stylized film, it’s just a down and dirty horror jam with a decent batch of jump-scares.

reviews.name: Elsa Fernández-Santos
reviews.message: ... A film tribute to 70's B-movies, particularly Texas Chainsaw Massacre and Deep Throat.

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: There's more sincerity in a good porn film... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Alachia Queen
reviews.message: X, first hour of the film is an homage to 70s psycho-sexual-film making and the last 45 minutes is a psycho-biddy/slasher. It's interesting to say the least but at no point was this a scary film.

reviews.name: Alejandro G. Calvo
reviews.message: A real delight, a genius within the genre that while paying homage to the classics, applies a rolling pin to expand the plot towards the unexpected. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Matthew Pejkovic
reviews.message: While certainly creepy and provocative at times, X stumbles from the pretentious pedestal this “elevated” horror film has propped itself upon.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: It's Mia Goth's show. The English-Brazilian actress is building a fine repertoire in the horror genre as someone who likes to dive into the deep end of psychotic-tinged stories with a human element coercing through it.

reviews.name: Kristy Strouse
reviews.message: Overall, X is an entertaining and vivid throwback horror, with a mesmerizing performance from Goth, even if it doesn't slash quite as deep as it intends.

reviews.name: Fausto Fernandez
reviews.message: A lubricated and bloody nightmare where desire, pain, coitus, and murder are inseparable parts of the same basic act, animal and profoundly human. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Josh Larsen
reviews.message: ... a slightly unfocused twist on the sex-and-death genre.

reviews.name: Diego Batlle
reviews.message: Equally entertains and frightens… a genuine cinephile's feast. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message:
A quality horror film. 
[Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Todd Jorgenson
reviews.message: Aside from its throwback grindhouse visual aesthetic, the film provides only hit-or-miss laughs and thrills, relying on stock characters and gratuitous gore rather than refreshing the formula.

reviews.name: Joe Lipsett
reviews.message: West's return to horror is beautifully shot and features several stand-out female performances. The relationship between porn and horror isn't as novel as critics made it out to be, but the innovative "stutter cuts" alone make X worth checking out

title: M3GAN
description: M3GAN is a marvel of artificial intelligence, a life-like doll programmed to be a child's greatest companion and a parent's greatest ally. Designed by brilliant toy-company roboticist Gemma (Get Out's Allison Williams), M3GAN can listen and watch and learn as she becomes friend and teacher, playmate and protector, for the child she is bonded to. When Gemma suddenly becomes the caretaker of her orphaned 8-year-old niece, Cady (Violet McGraw, The Haunting of Hill House), Gemma's unsure and unprepared to be a parent. Under intense pressure at work, Gemma decides to pair her M3GAN prototype with Cady in an attempt to resolve both problems--a decision that will have unimaginable consequences.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Some Strong Language|A Suggestive Reference|Terror|Violent Content)
characteristics.Producer:: Jason Blum, James Wan, Couper Samuelson

reviews.name: Matt Pais
reviews.message: Sharper and more satisfying than we have any right to expect a movie like this to be.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: Needless subplots and superfluous characters tend to distract, but when the malevolent AI is front and center, the movie really hums.

reviews.name: Sean Chandler
reviews.message: A surprisingly effective and clever killer doll film. M3GAN instantly leaves her mark and solidifies herself as a new horror icon. But the real surprise is all the extra layers and ideas about technology, grief, and taking the easy way out.

reviews.name: Federico Furzan
reviews.message: M3GAN is good at keeping us hooked to a film that we know how it will turn out. It never plays safe when putting children in danger and body count is terrifyingly high. This is one silly, but highly effective film.

reviews.name: Robert Horton
reviews.message: Pleasing in its familiar, unsurprising lines, which are basically those of a Twilight Zone episode. I am not complaining.

reviews.name: Tom Shone
reviews.message: After quite a long build-up, the film doesn’t provide as much killer-doll action as we deserve, but the scenes we get are highly entertaining.

reviews.name: Paul Mount
reviews.message: ... Whilst M3gan is a bit too broad to serve as  Black Mirror-style ‘cautionary’ tale, its strength lies in the fact that Megan is a machine created by humanity rather than animated by some supernatural entity or other.

reviews.name: Laura Bradley
reviews.message: ...good, gory (if fleeting) fun...

reviews.name: Filipe Freitas
reviews.message: Cinematically, M3gan remains soft at the core, contaminated by harmful robotization while following the codes of Hollywood’s easy scares.

reviews.name: Kristy Strouse
reviews.message: M3gan is definitely fun, but it succumbs to tropes and familiarity in a way that makes it feel reductive.

reviews.name: Michelle Jaworski
reviews.message: With strong performances from Allison Williams and Violet McGraw, ‘M3GAN’ fully embraces the campiness.

reviews.name: Erik Childress
reviews.message: There's a real brain operating here amidst the slow burn into technological madness that Housebound director Gerard Johnstone wisely focuses on that keeps the narrative on tilt more than your usual killer doll films

reviews.name: Bob Chipman
reviews.message: A do-not-reinvent-the-wheel movie that works because you can tell a ton of effort went into what matters.

reviews.name: Amanda the Jedi
reviews.message: Sometimes cinema is just laughing along with a murder robot.

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: The movie is unsalvageable because the actors are less expressive than the robot.

reviews.name: Jaby Koay
reviews.message: The way it built up was so perfect because it kind of reels you in with the emotional hook.

reviews.name: Crockett Houghton
reviews.message: If you don’t mind watching a story that you’ve already seen, done slightly worse, but with great visuals and decent special effects, then this could be a fun one for you.

reviews.name: Gabi Zietsman
reviews.message: Overall, there's a youthfulness in the film that's not prevalent in the horror genre, and the writers toe a fine line between the doll's witty modern dialect and it coming off as 'adults-trying-to-speak-teenager'.

reviews.name: Doug Walker
reviews.message: If you're not laughing at the mere picture of Megan, this film is not for you. It's enjoyment lies in how seriously it takes the campiness. On that level, the film is a lot of fun.

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: Solid, fun, enough to have a nice afternoon at the movies. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Susan Granger
reviews.message: Silly, slashy and subversive - aimed at teenagers and those who consider Artificial Intelligence to be a treacherous threat...

reviews.name: Sarah Marrs
reviews.message: M3GAN lives somewhere in the middle of a hysterical send up of tech and modern parenting in the grand tradition of murder doll horror movies starring one of the best cinematic murder dolls of all time.

reviews.name: Frank Wilkins
reviews.message: You will say “that wouldn’t happen,” or “that’s not how that would play out” no fewer than a dozen times, but the screams of “didn’t see that coming” or “okay, that’s disturbing as hell” will far outweigh any of its shortcomings.

reviews.name: Chauncey K. Robinson
reviews.message: M3GAN is a smart film that uses horror to go after consumer culture and the potential dangers of artificial intelligence. It strikes a good balance between dark comedy and the scares.

reviews.name: Emmanuel Noisette
reviews.message: Despite being rather predictable, it was so funny that I forgot to be scared.

reviews.name: Chris McCoy
reviews.message: Now if you’ll excuse me, I have to go work on my “M3GAN was right!” memes.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: M3GAN isn’t ostensibly a comedy, but it’s funny as f—.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: It's winking, knowing, silly, satirical, slick and highly engineered all at once, overtly pushing buttons and demanding a response — and, thankfully, mostly earning it.

reviews.name: Matthew Haynes
reviews.message: M3GAN was an absolute blast and a great shocker for horror movies so far, it took an already well crafted premise and made it much more terrifying in its own unique way. M3GAN is a must watch and a great addition to Sci-Fi horror

reviews.name: Philip De Semlyen
reviews.message: M3GAN rollicks along with all the slickness and shocks you’d expect from a film produced by Insidious’s James Wan. It always keeps you in on the joke -- and it’s a killer joke.

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Entertaining enough to earn its place as one of 2023’s first breakout hits, and to make its title character the stuff of creepy legend.

reviews.name: Joey Keogh
reviews.message: As much fun as it is, when it comes to modern killer doll movies, M3GAN is a major step up from Annabelle, but still can’t compete with the granddaddy of them all. [Chucky] would never willingly leave that stupid kid alive.

reviews.name: Luke Goodsell
reviews.message: Artificial intelligence has gotten a bit of a bad rap of late, but it's about to enter its camp era thanks to M3GAN, an all-in horror-comedy that plays like Frankenstein meets The Bad Seed for the TikTok crowd – you know, for kids.

reviews.name: Damien Straker
reviews.message: Fun satirical elements fail to overcome M3GAN’s lack of originality and artistic finesse.

reviews.name: Sebastian Zavala Kahn
reviews.message: What the film wants to do is entertain us with a sadistically hilarious story, populated by slightly cartoonish but interesting characters, and full of sufficiently satisfying (and in some cases, somewhat violent) moments. Full review in Spanish.

reviews.name: Michael Ward
reviews.message: A crowd-pleaser of the highest order; an instant cult classic is born.

reviews.name: Ashvin Prakash
reviews.message: It's a lot of fun - loved the humor along the way and the pacing and editing is done very well, but in terms of originality, this is a story we've seen before.

reviews.name: Vincent Mancini
reviews.message: M3GAN is fun: kinda smart, kinda stupid, and in either case punching way above its weight for a horror movie released in January.

reviews.name: Jess Goodman
reviews.message: Sharply scripted and self-aware, the film takes what’s otherwise a predictable plot and puts events in the hands of a pint-sized girlbot/sasspot who’s ready to see her adversaries burn (and honestly, who hasn’t felt that way once or twice?).

reviews.name: Paula Vázquez Prieto
reviews.message: In fact, the film could be framed in the line of trauma as a form of terror, but it does so by successfully utilizing genre resources, eliciting fun with that iconographic modern Prometheus that remains as effective as ever. [Full review in Spanish]

title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods
description: From New Line Cinema comes "Shazam! Fury of the Gods," which continues the story of teenage Billy Batson who, upon reciting the magic word "SHAZAM!," is transformed into his adult Super Hero alter ego, Shazam.

characteristics.Producer:: Peter Safran
characteristics.Production Co:: New Line Cinema, Warner Bros., DC Entertainment

reviews.name: Douglas Davidson
reviews.message: The truly frustrating thing about "Fury of the Gods" is all the potential it contains, not just its own standalone story, but how unhinged a third film could be now that so much of the setup and emotional baggage has been explored.

reviews.name: Jeff Beck
reviews.message: It may boast a few impressive cast members, but with its toned-down levity & unengaging storyline, it becomes just another flat, forgettable entry that fits right in with the other bland DC films of the past decade.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …Shazam 2 doesn’t aim to do much more than re-tread the ’kid that’s friends with superheroes’ theme of the original film, but the laws of diminishing returns applies…

reviews.name: Sean P. Means
reviews.message: “Shazam! Fury of the Gods” is serviceable superhero storytelling, but it’s missing the great spark of absurdity that made the first movie so engaging.

reviews.name: Kent Garrison
reviews.message: Zachary Levi's Shazam is a really fun character, and it's a shame they can't find the right use for him.

reviews.name: Sheraz Farooqi
reviews.message:
Shazam: Fury of the Gods is wholesome family fun but flat and very safe. Thematic arcs felt familiar, villains weren’t captivating & VFX was shoddy

With superhero films now, if you aren’t fresh, you’re forgettable.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: The villains’ motive is at best incoherent, and possibly nonexistent, and the movie’s overall tone is so flippant, our emotional investment in the drama is rendered nil.

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: The low-key hang-out family movie vibe [of the first Shazam] has been ditched in favor of a bunch of loud  sound effects and glossy, lifeless CGI.

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: Some baffling decisions made here but overall, Shazam 2 is a mostly fun time with a fair amount of heart.

reviews.name: Alton Williams
reviews.message: Shazam! Fury of the Gods is a disappointment that takes the wonderful work of the first film and has no idea what to do with it.

reviews.name: Frank Swietek
reviews.message: An uneasy mixture of YA superhero flick, warmhearted family movie, and effects-laden action picture, it proves once again that more does not translate to better.

reviews.name: J. Don Birnam
reviews.message: Helen Mirren and Lucy Liu give it their all, but the childishness and lack of consequence renders even the coolest action sequences and effects meaningless

reviews.name: Caffeinated Clint
reviews.message: Where Shazam! Fury of the Gods suffers in comparison to the 2019 original is in its erratic, confused tone and swollen screenplay

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...one of the worst comic-book adaptations to hit theaters in a good long while.

reviews.name: Alex Bentley
reviews.message: The film has sequel-itis in the worst way. Everything has to be bigger, which totally negates the charm that the first film had.

reviews.name: Neal Pollack
reviews.message: Like the first Shazam! movie, it has a warm heart and semi-believable family relationships. It certainly doesn’t take itself too seriously. It’s noisy and obnoxious, but also kind of fun.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Stumbles down the narrow line between “kid-friendly” and “just plain juvenile.”

reviews.name: Brendan Cassidy
reviews.message: Shazam! Fury of the Gods is better than Black Adam...but I find myself forgetting it soon after it ends.

reviews.name: Louisa Moore
reviews.message: The best way to sum up this review is “c’mon, guys, it’s not that bad.” I realize that isn’t exactly a ringing endorsement for a movie, but it’s good enough to provide a mildly amusing escape for a couple of hours.

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: Unfortunately, it falls into the trap of exaggerating what worked in the original, going overboard in almost every aspect of the narrative and losing authenticity along the way. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Sarah Knight Adamson
reviews.message: What a fun hero movie, there's so much to love about this film, as the main character is heartwarming and endearing as he questions his every move.

reviews.name: Matt Rodgers
reviews.message: Shazam! Fury of the Gods doubles down on the same charm which made the original soar and the resulting film is a sequel that’s easily the equal of its enjoyable predecessor.

reviews.name: Robert Roten
reviews.message: While this movie is not as good as the original 2019 film, it is still entertaining in terms of action, humor and spectacle.

reviews.name: Susan Kamyab
reviews.message: DC has always struggled to make solid, coherent superhero movies. One of the few times they got it right was with the first "Shazam". Sadly, lightening fails to strike twice in "Shazam! Fury of the Gods".

reviews.name: Victor Stiff
reviews.message: Sandberg’s lack of interest in character development and reliance on style over substance calls back to the superhero movie era we all wish we could forget.

reviews.name: Julian Lytle
reviews.message: A mistake of a movie crafted with good intentions, but completely loses the core of this family of characters with its poorly thought out antagonists and journey.

reviews.name: Derek Sante
reviews.message: Kids will like it and parents will be able to stand it, but most of the film is by the numbers, so don't expect too many surprises.

reviews.name: Jackie K. Cooper
reviews.message: Zachary Levi is annoying; Helen Mirren is wasted; nothing works as good this time out as it did before.

reviews.name: Adam Mullins-Khatib
reviews.message: The original film left nothing of substance for this superhero sequel.

reviews.name: Mike Ryan
reviews.message: The whole concept of superhero universes, especially recently, is to create a feeling of importance, even when that really isn’t the case. So it’s weird and strangely refreshing to watch one of these where that’s 100 percent not the case.

reviews.name: Daniel Chin
reviews.message: The disappointing sequel to Shazam! is the first of four leftover films that DC will release during an awkward year of transition...

reviews.name: Tony Baker
reviews.message: There was nothing really exciting about it.

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: The original was adorkable, and the follow-up is dismissible. Shazam! Fury of the Gods is a soul-crushing disappointment. Sandberg’s follow-up is the ultimate antonym to the original—a dull, dark, and unfunny follow-up with no magic left in the tank.

reviews.name: Charles Koplinski
reviews.message: Again, there’s not much new here, but the light-hearted approach – which puts Mirren’s serious turn in a  humorous light- makes all the difference.

reviews.name: Chris Joyce
reviews.message: The story is uncomplicated and very straightforward, the focus on family that sits at the heart of the narrative is both engaging and impactful.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: The quirky humor, mostly from Jack Dylan Grazer, makes it more fun than not. Despite some baffling choices and an ending that pulled every punch, this is a sequel that offers plenty of entertainment - even if it isn't close to being spectacular.

reviews.name: Sean Chandler
reviews.message: It lose some of the charm of the original by focusing on bigger set pieces, but it still delivers plenty of laughs, action, and emotion.

reviews.name: Josie Melendez
reviews.message: Si estás buscando algo más allá de chistes que no siempre son cómicos, una trama sin propósito definido y personajes subdesarrollados, entonces no es la película para ti.

reviews.name: Dave Golder
reviews.message: Full of heart, warmth and charm, this is a slight, frothy follow-up that is only occasionally overly sentimental.

reviews.name: Chris Wasser
reviews.message: The first Shazam! outing was a hoot. It successfully combined the endearing, goofball energy of Penny Marshall’s Big with the plucky sci-fi charm of Richard Donner’s Superman. In contrast, this bulky, effects-heavy follow-up is a joyless mess.

title: The Little Mermaid
description: In Disney's beguiling animated romp, rebellious 16-year-old mermaid Ariel (Jodi Benson) is fascinated with life on land. On one of her visits to the surface, which are forbidden by her controlling father, King Triton, she falls for a human prince. Determined to be with her new love, Ariel makes a dangerous deal with the sea witch Ursula (Pat Carroll) to become human for three days. But when plans go awry for the star-crossed lovers, the king must make the ultimate sacrifice for his daughter.

characteristics.Producer:: Howard Ashman, John Musker
characteristics.Writer:: Roger Allers, Ron Clements, John Musker
characteristics.Distributor:: BV International Pictures [no], Buena Vista Distribution Co. Inc.
characteristics.Production Co:: Walt Disney Pictures, Silver Screen Partners IV

reviews.name: Kevin Carr
reviews.message: Efficient and charming, this beautiful animated classic was responsible for breathing new life into the studio in the 80s.

reviews.name: Carson Timar
reviews.message: The film carries all the style of modern Disney while holding on to the tired tropes of Disney's past, truly becoming a clear turning point in the studio and its ideology in how to write characters and stories.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: A flawless blend of heart-wrenching drama, witty dialogue, and magnetizing songs.

reviews.name: Mattie Lucas
reviews.message: Now occupies a very special place in the pantheon as the film that gave birth to a new Disney era.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: Everything is just right in this cheerful adaptation of the Hans Christian Andersen tale ... In addition to reviving the animated art form, The Little Mermaid also brought melody back to the movies.

reviews.name: Ruth Maramis
reviews.message: I still very much enjoy The Little Mermaid, despite some of its narrative problems I mentioned. It's certainly a gorgeous movie and rewatching it was a pretty satisfying walk down memory lane.

reviews.name: Danielle Solzman
reviews.message: While hand-drawn animation may be a thing of the past, The Little Mermaid beautifully holds up some thirty years later.

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: All together, it makes for an incredibly entertaining and empowering film, a classic that I never tire of watching.

reviews.name: James Plath
reviews.message: The Little Mermaid launched what could only be called a second Golden Age for Disney.

reviews.name: Kathleen Carroll
reviews.message: Audiences of all ages are bound to fall in love with this bubbly, thoroughly enchanting fish story.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...perfectly pleasant and consistently watchable...

reviews.name: Michael Wilmington
reviews.message: The Little Mermaid -- impudent, grandiose, a multilevel crowd-pleaser -- almost returns the Disney animated features to their glory traditions of the '30s and '40s.

reviews.name: Dave Kehr
reviews.message: It may not be a transcendent masterpiece of the Disney canon, but The Little Mermaid is still very heartening: It suggests the Disney magic isn`t lost after all.

reviews.name: Gary Thompson
reviews.message: A feature-length movie with the spirit, if not the splendor, of the Disney classics.

reviews.name: Desmond Ryan
reviews.message: The latest Disney offering looks back to the studio's unrivaled heritage. It has the look of classic animation. More important, it has the skill required to make it work.

reviews.name: Ralph Novak
reviews.message: It's hard not to leave this movie with a glowing feeling.

reviews.name: Jay Boyar
reviews.message: In adapting this animated film from Hans Christian Andersen's sad and beautiful fairy tale, writers/directors John Musker and Ron Clements came up with a bright and perky movie.

reviews.name: Roger Hurlburt
reviews.message: From the opening frames of the this underwater fantasy, you`ll agree that the magic is back at Disney. Perhaps it never left.

reviews.name: Kilmeny Fane-Saunders
reviews.message: This remains an enduring delight.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Gantz
reviews.message: The animators deliver where it counts, in the expressions of Ariel and Prince Eric, whose love-at-first-sight is sweet but not saccharine.

reviews.name: Dustin Putman
reviews.message: [Blu-ray Review] One of those special and rare animated pics that does just about everything exceedingly well. A must-buy!

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: Doesn't quite work as a narrative, but manages to induce awe with its timeless soundtrack and production quality.

reviews.name: Nell Minow
reviews.message: Superb, entertaining animated musical has some scary stuff.

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: The long-awaited proof that Disney animation could, in fact, return almost the quality and beauty of its Golden Age.

reviews.name: Chris Hicks
reviews.message: This is unquestionably the best animated film in many years and is therefore highly recommended.

reviews.name: Richard Corliss
reviews.message: You could wish upon a star and not conjure up a more joyous animated movie than this graceful retelling of the Hans Christian Andersen tale.

reviews.name: Jonathan Rosenbaum
reviews.message: Within the apparently necessary aesthetic and ideological limitations (such as making the hero and heroine Americans surrounded by foreign servants a la Pinocchio), the animation manages to be fairly energetic.

reviews.name: James Berardinelli
reviews.message: A fantastic success.

reviews.name: Variety Staff
reviews.message: May represent Disney's best animated feature since the underrated Sleeping Beauty in 1959.

reviews.name: Nathaniel Rogers
reviews.message: A coming of age fable for both Disney and the mermaid heroine

reviews.name: Bill Chambers
reviews.message: The Little Mermaid was a mirage, not an oasis.

reviews.name: Jeffrey M. Anderson
reviews.message: Still a great entertainment and a welcome addition to any Disney library.

reviews.name: Forrest Hartman
reviews.message: The hand-drawn animation is terrific, and the soundtrack, which includes Part of Your World, Under the Sea and Kiss the Girl, is among Disney's best.

reviews.name: Eric Henderson
reviews.message: The Little Mermaid is the story of one packrat pre-tween princess whose undersea kingdom is only matched in depth by her remarkable sense of consumer-minded entitlement.

reviews.name: John J. Puccio
reviews.message: ...cute, romantic, well-animated, well paced, and filled with more good music than Disney had produced in quite some time.

reviews.name: Geoff Andrew
reviews.message: This return to traditional Disney territory is geared to captivate children while allowing them to maintain their street cred, largely by combining extravagant animated technique with ranging musical styles.

reviews.name: Widgett Walls
reviews.message: Huggable, lovable Disney. Before the corporation went dumpster diving.

reviews.name: James Rocchi
reviews.message: A surprising success, thanks largely to Alan Menken and Howard Ashman's brilliant songs.

reviews.name: Michael A. Smith
reviews.message: The re-birth of the Disney musical.

title: Crater
description: "Crater" is the coming-of-age adventure story of Caleb Channing (Isaiah Russell-Bailey), who was raised on a lunar mining colony and is about to be permanently relocated to an idyllic faraway planet following the death of his father (Scott Mescudi). But before leaving, to fulfill his dad's last wish, he and his three best friends, Dylan (Billy Barratt), Borney (Orson Hong) and Marcus (Thomas Boyce), and a new arrival from Earth, Addison (Mckenna Grace), hijack a rover for one final adventure on a journey to explore a mysterious crater.

characteristics.Producer:: Shawn Levy, Dan Levine, Dan Cohen

reviews.name: Jennifer Green
reviews.message: But the set-up also feels a little flawed -- one would assume that kids who've grown up in a monochromatic dome on the moon would be somehow more different from kids today.

reviews.name: Valerie Complex
reviews.message: "Crater" is a film with something to say about the labor force as well as an environmental message about cherishing and preserving the Earth and all it has to offer.

reviews.name: Symphony Barnes
reviews.message: Dodgy script moments aside, Crater is a worthwhile space film full of excitement, with a wonderful message at the centre of it.

reviews.name: Collin Garbarino
reviews.message: Despite some aspects of the plot feeling contrived, I was ­surprised by Crater’s ability to pull off an emotionally satisfying ending.

reviews.name: John Kirk
reviews.message: That Stand By Me nostalgic sense of friendship is what Crater tries to capture and export to a science-fiction setting. And despite its Disney packaging (ie: no profanity, no sex or violence), it mostly succeeds.

reviews.name: Robert Kojder
reviews.message: Crater is slightly more ambitious than the average family film, with an endearing focus on friendship with winning performances (the flashbacks between Isaiah Russell-Bradley and Scott Mescudi are moving) and an unexpected emotional punch

reviews.name: Nick Allen
reviews.message: Makes the characters, and its audience, experience the hard moments that may crystallize into such optimism

reviews.name: Tara Bennett
reviews.message: Crater is scripted like a fragile house of cards, relying on far too many coincidences in service of moving the plot along.

reviews.name: Noel Murray
reviews.message: In a clever use of metaphor, the filmmakers have built an appealing world of wonders, hidden below the moon’s barren surface — suggesting there are fragments of hope embedded within even the grimmest landscapes.

reviews.name: Danielle Solzman
reviews.message: There are things that one expects from a Disney film but Crater falls short of the studio's standards.

reviews.name: Amanda Guarragi
reviews.message: Crater takes itself a bit too seriously, and it doesn’t feel like an adventure at all. Even though it is sentimental, it doesn’t have the excitement that other sci-fi films usually have.

reviews.name: Brian Lloyd
reviews.message: Ultimately, 'Crater' is fine and passable, almost to the point where it's kind of boring. There was undoubtedly a better version of this movie that could have been made and should have been made but wasn't.

reviews.name: Mike Scott
reviews.message: A wholesome, sci-fi kid adventure made for families to enjoy together, with all the slightly cornball, Disney-safe underpinnings that implies.

reviews.name: Douglas Laman
reviews.message: The requirements to fit inside the box of a standard Disney movie means audiences are told rather than explicitly shown the ruinous world of Crater.

reviews.name: Kevin Carr
reviews.message: Touching and well balanced, this offers some friendship comfort without getting too silly.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It’s all rather mediocre.

reviews.name: Todd Jorgenson
reviews.message: The young actors develop an endearing rapport, although the script leaves them feeling more like contemporary kids at space camp rather than inhabitants of a faraway world.

reviews.name: Robert Daniels
reviews.message: “Crater” is more than its fun adventure.

reviews.name: Ricardo Carlot
reviews.message: Where Crater lacks in the story, the other elements of the film help it find its legs. From the cast, production, and character developments, Crater is a solid sci-fi adventure movie.

reviews.name: Jason Flatt
reviews.message: Crater is a great kid’s movie. The VFX of its imaged lunar world as swell, the characters and their journies are all impactful, and the positivity the movie is able to maintain without coming across as either hokey or preachy is impressive

reviews.name: Charles Koplinski
reviews.message: The conflicts the characters encounter are unnecessary and nonsensical, events that do nothing more than build frustration rather suspense regarding just what will be found at the titular location.

reviews.name: Petrana Radulovic
reviews.message: It’s innovative, in a way that celebrates its familiar genre tropes, instead of snarking at them.

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: Crater’s aspirations are greater than its execution. A film made for the cinematic search engine optimization age that may have lasting legs, the story is dull and stagnant when it should be nothing but extraordinary.

reviews.name: Luke Gorham
reviews.message: It’s all inoffensive enough, and young kids... will likely be mildly entertained by this decidedly wholesome trifle featuring performers who are actually around their age, but for anyone past puberty, there’s simply nothing to hang on to here.

reviews.name: Marco Vito Oddo
reviews.message: It abuses clichés, never deviates from its formulaic script, and fails to surprise the viewer.

reviews.name: Frank Scheck
reviews.message: While the disparate thematic elements don’t mesh together seamlessly in Crater, the film offers enough fun and thrills to swell the ranks of aspiring astronauts.

reviews.name: Brandon Yu
reviews.message: The film is surprisingly nimble at incorporating an emotional core that makes its story more interesting than the adventure itself.

reviews.name: Christie Cronan
reviews.message: Disney Crater has more than one giant hole - it left a few plot holes too. Don't expect to feel all of the Disney feels & come away with an Earth shattering new favorite movie. An easy to watch, easy to digest, and overall "forgettable" out-of-space film.

reviews.name: Tessa Smith
reviews.message: There’s a good story in there somewhere, but it ultimately falls flat. It's hard to talk about without spoilers, but there are some very poor story decisions made that take too much away from the good.

reviews.name: Frank Swietek
reviews.message: Though “Crater” isn’t the pits, in the end the outer-space fable of friendship and family proves a bland affair, even when it aims to generate some excitement or touch on deeper emotional currents.

reviews.name: Casey Chong
reviews.message: A flawed but surprisingly heartfelt and well-acted coming-of-age space adventure.

reviews.name: Mark Dujsik
reviews.message: It's simply too bad the movie's story bypasses most of the elements that make this world so intriguing and believable.

reviews.name: Christopher Lloyd
reviews.message: Space adventures for tweens is on the menu for this Disney+ adventure, which may not feature the best production values but boasts a great cast and empathetic storytelling.

reviews.name: Peter Martin
reviews.message: Earns its way into the heart as a movie that is aimed at young people without ever talking down to them. Instead, it treats the audience as equals, which is an incredibly rare thing nowadays.

reviews.name: Brian Orndorf
reviews.message: “Crater” is for patient viewers, and director Alvarez generates a warm sense of bonding and partnership with the space odyssey.

reviews.name: Hope Madden
reviews.message: Crater cobbles together a lot of cliched ideas but can’t find any depth to explore. Instead Alvarez delivers a superficial and forgettable road trip movie in space.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: A good-looking movie, with decent effects...about as logical as any version of "Lost in Space" or "Space Camp...." But the bland script's sentimental moments don't really play, and the comedy...leaves a lot to be desired.

reviews.name: Michael Nordine
reviews.message: It’s sci-fi informed by a Gen-Z sensibility, with a particular focus on those Zoomers who can’t imagine a bright future on the planet they actually inhabit — an ever-expanding demographic, one imagines.

title: Scream VI
description: Following the latest Ghostface killings, the four survivors leave Woodsboro behind and start a fresh chapter.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Language Throughout|Brief Drug Use|Strong Bloody Violence)
characteristics.Producer:: William Sherak, James Vanderbilt, Paul Neinstein
characteristics.Production Co:: Radio Silence, Paramount Pictures, Project X, Spyglass Media Group

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: Only when it stops the story cold to throw a bravura setpiece our way does it actually become exciting and propulsive.

reviews.name: Richard Lawson
reviews.message: While still a far cry from the elegance of Wes Craven’s original, Scream VI is the best installment in the series since the second film. It’s tart and suspenseful and has reignited my faith in a once cherished, then tarnished brand.

reviews.name: Alejandro Turdo
reviews.message: Looks like a Scream sequel written by ChatGPT. All mandatory ingredients are in, everything any Scream entry should have, but you can't help noticing its artificial flavor. Hardcore fans might be amused, but there is nothing new to offer here.

reviews.name: Rob Gonsalves
reviews.message: It’s just pausing on its way to becoming content on Paramount+, where it will submerge into the back catalog and seldom be heard from again.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It’s another exercise in ouroborosian indulgence, with the usual third-act whiplash twists and Scooby-Doo mask-removals revealing that the movie is about nothing but itself.

reviews.name: Amanda the Jedi
reviews.message: It may fumble the premise and more unique moments with its disappointing reveal but SCREAM VI is certainly a step in the right direction for the franchise.

reviews.name: T.J. Callahan
reviews.message: Don’t expect any new found intelligent dialogue or character development, but there’s much  character assassination – in more ways than one. What Scream VI brings for horror fans is enough blood and gore to make you feel like you need a shower afterwards.

reviews.name: Ashvin Prakash
reviews.message: A fun sequel that effectively amps up the violence and meanness of the kills and centers on a strong sibling dynamic, though it doesn't pull the swings it needs to make this a memorable film.
