reviews.message: Bullet Train is a thrill ride of excitement, action, and comedy. The cast complements each other with their wit and sarcasm and then duke it out in some awesome fight sequences.

reviews.name: Chase Hutchinson
reviews.message: An ostensible action film that is so light on well-crafted fights one hesitates to even classify it as such, Bullet Train can best be described as a low-rent Quentin Tarantino imitation though without anything of its own to stand on.

title: Synchronic
description: When New Orleans paramedics and longtime best friends Steve and Dennis are called to a series of bizarre and gruesome accidents, they chalk it up to a mysterious new drug found at the scene. But after Dennis' oldest daughter disappears, Steve stumbles upon a terrifying truth about the supposed psychedelic that will challenge everything he knows about reality -- and the flow of time itself.

characteristics.Producer:: Justin Benson, Aaron Moorhead, David Lawson Jr., Michael Mendelsohn
characteristics.Production Co:: Rustic Films, Patriot Pictures, Love & Death Productions, Pfaff & Pfaff Productions, XYZ Films

reviews.name: Dallas King
reviews.message: Benson and Moorhead have a visual style full of creativity and flair... Sequences in Synchronic are immersive and suitably hallucinatory.

reviews.name: Cris Kennedy
reviews.message: There is humour in the screenplay, but also serious socio-historical ideas about the way a young black man is seen across different eras.

reviews.name: Josh Parham
reviews.message: The effort to construct another inventive sci-fi concept is appreciated, but the final product is underwhelming.

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Synchronic is a peculiar film with flaws, but one that succeeds in trying something completely different. At its heart is a message of appreciating the moment, embodied by an actor who shines in the spotlight.

reviews.name: Collier Jennings
reviews.message: Synchronic is a trippy sci-fi thriller that's grounded in human emotion, thanks to a layered and compelling performance from Anthony Mackie.

reviews.name: Chris Mello
reviews.message: At its worst, some of Synchronic's most rote ideas brush up against sociopolitical concerns in a way that seems thoughtless and callous.

reviews.name: Grant Watson
reviews.message: If you are a fan of speculative fiction - science fiction, fantasy, and horror - and you do not watch the films of Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead, then you are essentially failing as a fan.

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead... continue to break the limits of the film genre. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Matt Fowler
reviews.message: The movie makes superb use of New Orleans as a a city that hums with hauntings and harrowing history. Synchronic isn't a home run, but a decent time travel triple is always welcome.

reviews.name: Caffeinated Clint
reviews.message: a swift, intelligent and thought-provoking sci-fi thriller

reviews.name: MaryAnn Johanson
reviews.message: Just because a tale is science fiction doesn't mean that plausibility and cohesion are not required. Yet we can see the narrative strings pulling along the puppet-characters, and in an ugly direction.

reviews.name: Tori Brazier
reviews.message: Despite some bumpiness, Synchronic is still worth checking out.

reviews.name: José Martín
reviews.message: Mackie and Dornan's sincere work knows how to provide an authenticity rarely achieved in [these kinds] of proposals, usually more concerned with prioritizing spectacle over the dramatic arc. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jim Ross
reviews.message: The film's tight running time leaves [the emotional angle] comparatively starved for attention, and empathy levels generated by the film suffer for it. Still, there are enough intelligently-approached ideas to keep SYNCHRONIC engaging and smart.

reviews.name: Rory Doherty
reviews.message: Despite its messiness, Synchronic is suitably weird and sufficiently fun.

reviews.name: David Stratton
reviews.message: Mackie and Dornan do their best with their intrepid characters (though Dornan is sidelined for much of the time), while the women have little opportunity to register as interesting characters.

reviews.name: Carey-Ann Pawsey
reviews.message: But something about the film just did not hit the mark for me. Despite the attempt at tension and cool sci fi stuff, Synchronic struggled to hold my attention.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: When a movie takes you on the kind of ride that Synchronic does, in such a stunning, sharp and thrilling fashion, and with such depth at is core, its tiny imperfections fade from memory quickly.

reviews.name: Andrew Parker
reviews.message: The attempt to make a different sort of time and reality blurring narrative is admirable, but Synchronic never gels into something truly satisfying.

reviews.name: Victor Stiff
reviews.message: Benson and Moorhead plunge viewers into a woozy existential nightmare to deliver a message that is at once bleak and beautiful.

reviews.name: Alix Turner
reviews.message: Moorhead and Benson deliver another multi-genre drama with a broad scope, this time with a bigger budget and bigger cast. Afraid I miss their less mature style though.

reviews.name: Graeme Tuckett
reviews.message: Mackie and Dornan are both fine, though the script gives them nothing much to do except banter and argue.

reviews.name: Jake Wilson
reviews.message: Less successfully realized is the bond between the two heroes. Dornan is not as badly miscast here as he was in Fifty Shades of Grey, but Dennis is never a terribly engaging character.

reviews.name: Mark Kermode
reviews.message: A sci-fi inflected story...this might be the least successful of the creators' films, it does look a bit on the cheap...the initial idea is really interesting, but when you get down to it, it's a straight-to-video B movie...

reviews.name: Liam Maguren
reviews.message: Moorhead and Benson deliver enough to put this film above more forgettable fare.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Moody and strange, this offbeat dramatic horror spirals to heights of absurdity that are grounded in a nicely played central relationship.

reviews.name: John Bleasdale
reviews.message: The Capote Tapes show a talent that seemed to go to waste while at the same time teasing us with the possibility that there is more yet to come.

reviews.name: Daniel Theophanous
reviews.message: An enthrallingly complex film, one that deserves second viewing and will mature well with age. But mostly, it's a film that speaks of the directors' great imagination and near-genius.

reviews.name: Kevin Maher
reviews.message: By turns gloomy (heavy shadows, ominous score) and deeply goofy (see plot premise), the film is underpinned by some easygoing chemistry between the co-leads, Anthony Mackie and Jamie Dornan.

reviews.name: Alistair Harkness
reviews.message: Like Brandon Cronenberg's recent Possessor, this is bold, ideas-driven sci-fi horror told with real flair.

reviews.name: Rachael Harper
reviews.message: Synchronic is a thoughtful twist on the genre.

reviews.name: Mary Beth McAndrews
reviews.message: Now they've been trusted with a bigger budget and bigger stars for their latest film, SYNCHRONIC. They stay true to their themes of brotherhood and cosmic happenings, but on a much larger scale that proves their talents as filmmakers.

reviews.name: Leo Brady
reviews.message: Synchronic has two edgy performances by Jamie Dornan and Anthony Mackie making it an excellent combination.

reviews.name: Tim Robey
reviews.message: Shot with a doleful urban grittiness, Synchronic suggests one of Philip K Dick's narcotised mind-benders spliced with the existential gloom of Scorsese's Bringing Out the Dead.

reviews.name: Nicola Austin
reviews.message: With an intriguing central mystery and a curious twist on time travel, Synchronic makes for one trippy sci-fi journey.

reviews.name: Rob Aldam
reviews.message: A fascinating, challenging and entertaining sci-fi horror.

reviews.name: Dan Jolin
reviews.message: A smart indie sci-fi which has much to say and some great ideas, all wrapped up in a designer-drug-based premise that makes it sound less interesting than it actually is.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: Synchronic is frankly just silly and tedious, with faintly absurd and jeopardy-free time-travel scenes and a dramatic focus hopelessly split between Dennis and Steve's separate but equally tiresome lives.

reviews.name: Kat Hughes
reviews.message: Moorhead and Benson make moves into the big movie leagues with this star-powered, brain-frazzling exploration of the bonds of friendship and the constructs of time

reviews.name: Emma Wolfe
reviews.message: If you're a fan of sci-fi, you will love this film. If you're a fan of emotional horror movies, you'll also really enjoy it.

title: Infinity Pool
description: While staying at an isolated island resort, James (Alexander Skarsgård) and Em (Cleopatra Coleman) are enjoying a perfect vacation of pristine beaches, exceptional staff, and soaking up the sun. But guided by the seductive and mysterious Gabi (Mia Goth), they venture outside the resort grounds and find themselves in a culture filled with violence, hedonism, and untold horror. A tragic accident leaves them facing a zero tolerance policy for crime: either you'll be executed, or, if you're rich enough to afford it, you can watch yourself die instead.

characteristics.Producer:: Andrew Cividino, Rob Cotterill, Jonathan Halperyn, Karen Harnisch, Anita Juka, Daniel Kresmery, Christina Piovesan, Noah Segal
characteristics.Production Co:: Elevation Pictures, Celluloid Dreams, Film Forge., 4 Film, Hero Squared, Croatian Film Association

reviews.name: David Stratton
reviews.message: It seems a shame that the film’s promising first half is swamped by its second half with its hallucinogenic descent into sex and violence...

reviews.name: Cris Kennedy
reviews.message: ... You cannot turn away, regardless of how intense the performances are, how luridly psychedelic is the lighting, how much of an acid trip is the editing, how mordant is cinematographer Karim Hussain's eye for the macabre and banal.

reviews.name: Oti
reviews.message: It is a provocative, chilling exploration of moral descent and dehumanization. It brilliantly blends dystopia and hedonism, creating an unsettling atmosphere that leaves a lasting impact.

reviews.name: KT Mahe
reviews.message: Infinity Pool dives into the depraved unchecked privilege of wealth and power. Aesthetically - primal, sensual and evocative.

reviews.name: Simon Miraudo
reviews.message: Super entertaining and deliciously gory, with another stellar Mia Goth turn. But this modern riff on Westworld isn't as novel or transgressive as you'd hope. Infinity Pool is extreme but not subversive.

reviews.name: Jake Wilson
reviews.message: It’s a wacky but quite original premise, and Cronenberg has found some interesting actors to bring it to life, especially Mia Goth, showing that her recent turn as a bloodthirsty starlet in Ti West’s Pearl by no means exhausted her bag of tricks.

reviews.name: Jim Schembri
reviews.message: Deploying the type of grisly, ultra-realistic effects he used to great effect in 2020’s Possessor, Cronenberg conjures a marvellously nightmarish scenario of bent sci-fi concepts and psychological derangement.

reviews.name: Andiee Paviour
reviews.message: Leave it to a Cronenberg to turn a deluxe resort into a death-dealing cloner playground.

reviews.name: Brian Rowe
reviews.message: A disappointing late January release that will likely come and go, and here’s hoping next time Brandon Cronenberg will use his talent for dazzling visual storytelling for something more involving on a narrative level.

reviews.name: Fletcher Powell
reviews.message: Skarsgård is fantastic ... and Goth is even better.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: Brandon Cronenberg continues to function as a Mini-Me to his famous dad David, regurgitating Pop’s favorite themes without really carving out his own niche.

reviews.name: Brian Orndorf
reviews.message: Plays like a Great Value version of a David Cronenberg picture.

reviews.name: Brian Viner
reviews.message: ... A psychological thriller-horror that shapes up to be very good indeed, only to become regrettably overwrought in the final third.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: It is as engrossing as it is grotesque. Whether you find the film repulsive or sensual, or maybe both, Infinity Pool is certainly worth experiencing.

reviews.name: Leonardo Garcia Tsao
reviews.message: Somehow, while it offers several disturbing moments, the film doesn't dive deep and remains on the surface. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Antonio G. Spíndola
reviews.message: Infinite death should be seen for its thematic richness and the outstanding authorial signature of Brandon Cronenberg, in whose powerful images lies the germ of interesting debates and suffocating nightmares. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: While it’s too extreme for blockbuster audiences, Infinity Pool will satisfy those with a taste for the unusual. It also shows Cronenberg is more than a clone of his father.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Brandon Cronenberg is more focussed on visually arresting imagery than mining the material for something unnervingly resonant. That said, there's a terrific sense of menace.

reviews.name: Dulcie Pearce
reviews.message: Things all get a bit Clockwork Orange, with the drugged-up gang putting on terrifying masks and breaking into a house to cause horror and pain... Sadly, the movie loses direction, making it more gory than story.

reviews.name: Tom Shone
reviews.message: With its ominous soundtrack and atmosphere of escalating dread, the movie unfolds with the uncanniness of a dream, but something is missing at its core: Cronenberg’s gaze has the glassy imperturbability of his father, David, tricked out...

reviews.name: Kevin Maher
reviews.message: Brandon Cronenberg, son of David, continues to rehash his father’s themes and preoccupations with this wearisome grand guignol body horror about the primal power of, yep, sex, death and reproduction.

reviews.name: Mark Kermode
reviews.message: It may not be for everyone, but I dived deep into Infinity Pool – twice – and enjoyed the hell out of the experience.

reviews.name: Katie Hogan
reviews.message: There is excitement and energy that the first half the film that the second part of the film cannot keep up with.

reviews.name: Adam Sweeting
reviews.message: It’s a powerful theme, occasionally leavened by flashes of satirical black humour, and Skarsgård skilfully portrays a man watching in disgust as his soul is sucked out of him, but the film feels stretched at two hours.

reviews.name: Andy Lea
reviews.message: ... The holiday-from-hell theme quickly switches into a sci-fi satire about the immorality of the one per cent.

reviews.name: Leslie Felperin
reviews.message: Brandon Cronenberg definitely has a way with words, but he’s even more of a craftsman when it comes to visuals, especially trippy, CGI-laced montages.

reviews.name: Linda Marric
reviews.message: Cronenberg incisively critiques global inequalities in a world where being rich can not only buy you anything, it can allow you to get away with murder over and over again.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: It’s a movie straining for more than it’s achieving, moment by moment, but Goth’s toxic energy always holds the attention.

reviews.name: Brian Lloyd
reviews.message: 'Infinity Pool' has all of the wit and viciousness of a JG Ballard or William S. Burroughs story, all of it slinky social satire and savagery at every turn.

reviews.name: Tom Duggins
reviews.message: It’s hard to fault the magnetic craft of this exquisitely unpleasant picture, like a broiling jacuzzi of hallucinatory sex and violence that you might briefly dip a toe into, if you dare.

reviews.name: Alistair Harkness
reviews.message: Cronenberg has found a provocative way to explore the sometimes barbarous nature of this easy-to-hate social class.

reviews.name: Amelia Harvey
reviews.message: At times this film is hard to follow and—clocking in at nearly two hours—would have benefited from a judicious edit, but the uneven pacing isn’t enough to spoil such a grotesque send-up of a hedonistic holiday where the rules don’t apply.

reviews.name: Anton Bitel
reviews.message: Brandon Cronenberg’s resort-set third feature dives deep into a blocked writer’s fantasies and fears.

reviews.name: Sophie Butcher
reviews.message: A slick, satirical, insane thrill-ride.

reviews.name: Neil Smith
reviews.message: Infinity Pool delights in finding fresh ways to disturb and nauseate the audience. You do start to wonder, though, if there’s anything more to it.

reviews.name: Filipe Freitas
reviews.message: Sensorially stirring, the film succeeds mostly in the visual department by combining saturated colors, image overlapping and alluring tonalities to depict inexplicable oddities, both physical and mental.

reviews.name: Alan French
reviews.message: Infinity Pool is maximalist in every sense of the word. It’s good to see what Cronenberg is capable of, with big stars and a bigger budget.

reviews.name: Nicolás Delgadillo
reviews.message: A solid film with some standout moments and I enjoyed it more thoroughly than Possessor.

reviews.name: Paul Mount
reviews.message: It descends into a miasmic whirlpool of sex, violence, and depravity, but it’s hard to avoid the conclusion that Infinity Pool hasn’t really got much to say beyond the fact that people do some fucked-up things sometimes. Who knew?

reviews.name: Geoffrey Macnab
reviews.message: Blood-churning moments are combined with a depth of characterisation you don’t always get in more conventional horror fare. In its morbid and provocative way, the film is often funny but it’s thought-provoking and very creepy too.

title: The Woman King
description: The Woman King is the remarkable story of the Agojie, the all-female unit of warriors who protected the African Kingdom of Dahomey in the 1800s with skills and a fierceness unlike anything the world has ever seen. Inspired by true events, The Woman King follows the emotionally epic journey of General Nanisca (Oscar®-winner Viola Davis) as she trains the next generation of recruits and readies them for battle against an enemy determined to destroy their way of life. Some things are worth fighting for....

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Partial Nudity|Brief Language|Sequences of Strong Violence|Some Disturbing Material|Thematic Content)
characteristics.Producer:: Cathy Schulman, Viola Davis, Julius Tennon, Maria Bello

reviews.name: Whang Yee Ling
reviews.message: The movie fails to fulfil its potential except as a military action epic.

reviews.name: Steve Crum
reviews.message: A dazzler from Terence Blanchard’s symphonic score to Polly Morgan’s eye pleasing cinematography. Acting is A-1, particularly by Davis and Mbedu.

reviews.name: James Kendrick
reviews.message: Viola Davis is a force unleashed, heading up a full-blooded tale of conflict set against the backdrop of the slave trade that offers both a twist on the traditional male-dominated warrior-epic and a look at a part of history Hollywood typically ignores

reviews.name: Amber Wilkinson
reviews.message: Its the emotional sparring between the women - as fierce as anything on the battle ground - that really holds the attention

reviews.name: Jeffrey M. Anderson
reviews.message: If it had been a story about white people, it would have been a snore. But we have rarely, if ever, seen a movie quite like this one about powerful Black women, and the energy onscreen is infectious.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …goes all in as a popular entertainment, rolling back the male-dominance of the action genre and replacing it with something smart, dynamic and female driven…

reviews.name: Benjamin Wiebe
reviews.message: As these women take their place in the kingdom of Dahomey and assert their power, The Woman King truly takes on new meaning, and finds relevance in the modern era.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: The film is shot impeccably well, scored passionately, and gives the viewer something to savor as they leave the theater.

reviews.name: Justin Brown
reviews.message: It's not a perfect film but acting-wise - this is a masterclass. Pacing was tight and effective despite lacking in some character development. This is a really good film.

reviews.name: Brandon Collins
reviews.message: The performances, action scenes and cinematography were fantastic. I think the representation of bad ass black women was incredible.

reviews.name: Neil Soans
reviews.message: Pacing issues and historical inaccuracies aside, The Woman King has great action and moving characters brought to life by a fantastic ensemble cast.

reviews.name: Scroll Staff
reviews.message: A giddy mix of history and fantasy.

reviews.name: Kshitij Rawat
reviews.message: ...as a piece of entertainment, The Woman King works very well. The action is extremely well-staged and is visceral and brutal and endlessly fun.

reviews.name: Tim Brayton
reviews.message: A wildly watchable and compelling movie, one of 2022's best popcorn films.

reviews.name: Filipe Freitas
reviews.message: Between the historical African ballad and the feminist epic, The Woman King advances unspectacularly academic, annoyingly predictable, and blatantly contrived.

reviews.name: Sarah Boslaugh
reviews.message: Gina Prince-Bythewood’s film offers all the pleasures of an old-school epic but with a fresh take—the heroes in this film are Black women, led by Viola Davis in an inspiring performance as the military leader Nanisca.

reviews.name: Sheraz Farooqi
reviews.message:
The Woman King is a powerful film with Viola Davis playing and incredible lead. 

The dedication and craft put into this film is evident with strong performances and thoughtful moments.

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: Gina Prince-Bythewood directs the best battle epic since “Braveheart” and “Gladiator." It's that good, applying a diverse cast to good old-fashioned spectacle storytelling. Is it revisionist history? Of course, but it's still the best movie of the year.

reviews.name: Fletcher Peters
reviews.message: Gina Prince-Bythewood’s action flick stars a number of young actresses joining the ranks of Agojie, but Mbedu really kills it with plenty of stunts and an emotional tale of mothers and daughters.

reviews.name: Samuel Leggett Jr.
reviews.message: The Woman King is one of the best films of 2022! Viola Davis commands this film with her presence of power & emotional grace. Every other cast member are just as powerful & engaging. Amazing dedication to scripting, choreography, stunt work, & directing

reviews.name: Diane Carson
reviews.message: Films often elect spectacle or substance. To its credit, The Woman King offers both in a rousing tale of women warriors while mounting a devastating historical and cultural critique.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: A rousing saga.

reviews.name: Reginald Ponder
reviews.message: Poignant, proud, and powerful. What is remarkable is that this story has never been told in such magnitude and is a feat worthy of all the history books.  The strength in combat matched the strength in will.

reviews.name: Frank J. Avella
reviews.message: Viola Davis has her second-best role to date (love Ma Rainey) as Nanisca, the kick-ass and fearless leader. Lashana Lynch kills (literally and figuratively) as Nanisca's loyal lieutenant.

reviews.name: Robin Clifford
reviews.message: I applaud the femme-focus of “The Woman King” and its depiction of strong-willed, strong-bodied women who earned their place of power.

reviews.name: Jonathan Sim
reviews.message: But the main selling point of The Woman King is its performances, with Davis and John Boyega standing out as especially phenomenal in this film.

reviews.name: Ricardo Rosado
reviews.message: An epic story that gets lost in an uneven and bloated film encumbered by subplots that lead nowhere. Fortunately, the collection of misfires doesn't get in the way of enjoying this old-fashioned production... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Javier Ocaña
reviews.message: The film is more notable for the story it tells rather than how it tells it, with numerous action and fight sequences that are as precise as they're devoid of personality... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Alexandra MacAaron
reviews.message: 'The Woman King' artfully and seamlessly blends some familiar movie genres — following in the tradition of big-screen sagas like Gladiator, Braveheart, and Last of the Mohicans — with a fresh female perspective. And, Viola Davis rules!

reviews.name: Rubén Romero Santos
reviews.message: It does not seek to question masculinity, but limits itself to replacing the Leonids on duty with hypermasculinized women.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: For all its formulaic plotting and pedestrian dialogue, The Woman King is fresh in every other way: Its visual palette, its setting and art direction, its voice and perspective. It’s as beautiful to look at as it is tonally fierce – as it is predictable

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: Prince-Bythewood’s achievement is urgent, brilliant filmmaking and Davis’s performance is bound to become iconic.

reviews.name: John McDonald
reviews.message: “Inspired by real historical events” means in Hollywood-speak: “A grain of truth in a bed of fiction and fantasy”

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: Not that they have to here, but the phenomenal quartet that is Davis, Lynch, Mbedu and Atim could lift any material.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: Just a good-old-fashioned swords-and-sandals epic told with a fresh, diverse spin. Viola Davis is a cannonball in this, which is the most interesting/best performance she’s given since Fences.

reviews.name: Harris Dang
reviews.message: The Woman King is a genuine crowd-pleaser that delivers grand entertainment in terms of blockbuster scale, punchy set-pieces and a formidable cast. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Jane Freebury
reviews.message: Set against a dark backstory, this exhilarating tale of Amazon women, brimming with female energy, has more going for it than most superhero flicks

reviews.name: Eli Glasner
reviews.message: In this sisterhood of soldiers there’s more empathy.  It’s not that they're weak, but that they understand the price of being strong.

reviews.name: Peter Gray
reviews.message: A wholly exciting feature that overcomes any conventionality with its fierce female spirit, and that’s more than enough to warrant a passionate celebration.

reviews.name: Sandra Hall
reviews.message: The dialogue is generic -- the formal kind constructed to suit all periods -- but the actors give it all the authenticity it needs, clearly delighted by the ebullience of their characters.

title: AKA
description: In this intense action thriller, a special ops agent goes undercover within a criminal organization and unexpectedly befriends the boss's young son.

characteristics.Producer:: Rémi Leautier
characteristics.Production Co:: Netflix France, Nolita Cinema, Inoxy Films

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: The gritty action-pic has its moments when it chills, as the hero uses his fighting skills.

reviews.name: Tatat Bunnag
reviews.message: While the plot is familiar and doesn't offer anything out of the ordinary, the storytelling and thrilling action sequences make AKA an entertaining watch and worth checking out for diehard fans of the genre.

reviews.name: John Sooja
reviews.message: The action is well-paced, choreographed, and sequenced, and the story is compelling enough, even though it borrows its ideas from many other thrillers that have come before it.

reviews.name: Juan Pablo Russo
reviews.message: Even though AKA had all the characteristics to be a fun action movie, it resulted in disappointment. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Pete Volk
reviews.message: Worth watching if you’re interested in the new wave of French action cinema, and one of its most intriguing stars.

reviews.name: Chris Joyce
reviews.message: AKA works as an action film, relying heavily on intense violence and unflinching brutality. Where it lacks is the depth of the story and characters, keeping the majority of the players at arm's length and as strangers.

reviews.name: Noel Murray
reviews.message: AKA doesn’t add any new wrinkles to the undercover cop genre; but Florent Astolfi’s cinematography is suitably moody, Etienne Forget’s score provides texture and drive, and Lenoir and Dalibert (who co-wrote the script) keep the conflicts clear.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: AKA does action quite well, and drama not as well as it could, and intrigue and suspense not particularly well at all. Yet... it’s good enough in performance and direction to satisfy.

reviews.name: Jordan Lyon
reviews.message: With good performances from its cast, AKA leads the audience down a violent and bloody two-hour journey. The violence might be too much for some. However, for action lovers, AKA will be a film worth visiting.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: a solid if generally unsurprising terrorist thriller built around a French undercover killing machine with “particular skills" ...from the team that made the "Lost Bullet" movies.

title: Plane
description: In the white-knuckle action movie PLANE, pilot Brodie Torrance (Gerard Butler) saves his passengers from a lightning strike by making a risky landing on a war-torn island -- only to find that surviving the landing was just the beginning. When most of the passengers are taken hostage by dangerous rebels, the only person Torrance can count on for help is Louis Gaspare (Mike Colter), an accused murderer who was being transported by the FBI. In order to rescue the passengers, Torrance will need Gaspare's help, and will learn there's more to Gaspare than meets the eye.

characteristics.Producer:: Lorenzo di Bonaventura, Mark Vahradian, Marc Butan, Gerard Butler, Alan Siegel, Jason Constantine, Eda Kowan, Ara Keshishian
characteristics.Production Co:: G-BASE, MadRiver Pictures, Di Bonaventura Pictures, Olive Hill Media, The Searchers NV

reviews.name: James Croot
reviews.message: Plane offers a sometimes breathless, white-knuckle ride that should particularly appeal to those raised on mid-’90s actioners like Con Air, Air Force One and Sudden Death.

reviews.name: Peter Gray
reviews.message: This is pure popcorn entertainment that delivers on nasty-minded action and heroic temperaments that won’t insult your brain cells when you opt to cheer on the unfolding physicality.

reviews.name: Anthony Morris
reviews.message: A big part of the fun of Plane - and Plane is a lot of fun - is the way it rapidly cycles through genres fast enough to touch on all the good stuff without ever making it too obvious that we've seen it all before.

reviews.name: Patrick Cremona
reviews.message: The plot is hardly innovative -- and some of its more outlandish elements really stretch credibility -- but this is still a gripping enough thriller, boosted by the entertaining lead performances.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: Overlook the forced sentimentality and Plane manages to be a taut thriller with a balance of action, blood, shooting, and heroics that seem plausible. You won’t feel silly cheering or cringing and the popcorn will sit satisfied in your belly.

reviews.name: Sarah Cartland
reviews.message: Solid and enjoyable filmmaking that knows its limits. No overflowing passenger lists, no shoehorned subplots, it does exactly what it says on the tin, and then some. Truly, "redemption can be found in the most unusual places."

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …Plane is a straight-up, no-nonsense, gritty action flick that delivers plentiful thrills and spills…

reviews.name: JD Duran
reviews.message: Gerard Butler has that Nicolas Cage thing of not phoning in a performance, he's so magnetic in these movies.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: If you like well-made action flicks that don’t need a sequel setup, it’s money well spent. Butler knows what he's doing, and Colter excels in a role with a few layers.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: It's a dumb but entertaining film.

reviews.name: Emiliano Basile
reviews.message: A film that will be remembered as "that plane movie with Gerard Butler". [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Hanna Flint
reviews.message: Plane does not reinvent the wheel but does land an action-movie punch.

reviews.name: Benjamin Wiebe
reviews.message: Plane is a film that is an experience to behold in cinemas, and an entertaining one at that.

reviews.name: Pablo Vázquez
reviews.message: ... Gerard Butler becomes a worthy heir of the macho hero tradition, the same guy we wouldn't want as a father or a friend, but who comes in handy as a casual 'embedder' or hostage negotiator.

reviews.name: Sergio F. Pinilla
reviews.message: Conceived to be enjoyed on the big screen, with no more fuss over the proper movement of action and emotion itself. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Mikel Zorrilla
reviews.message: ... An enjoyable experience for anyone who's an old-school action flick lover seeking simple, to-the-point narratives that don't get overcomplicated. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Mark Jackson
reviews.message: Plane, much like 1994's "Speed," 2014's "Non-stop," and last year's "Ambulance," is a one-word-titled thriller-adventure-actioner that mostly takes place in a vehicle. Lots of old-school fun.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: Plane should have been far more weird and wild than it is, but it’s still a very serviceable and above-average actioner from Jean-François Richet. It doesn’t quite stick the landing, but at least the in-flight entertainment is decent.

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: This one is more solid than you’d expect it to be, refreshingly straightforward and knowing in what its job is and how to execute it without much fuss.

reviews.name: Clarisse Loughrey
reviews.message: But Plane is stifled by just how ordinary it is, and how closely it hews to the standard tropes of action films with longer, more descriptive -- yet less ridiculous -- titles.

reviews.name: Kevin Maher
reviews.message: Even by Butler’s B-list standards, this is borderline inept.

reviews.name: Brian Viner
reviews.message: ... A story that has all the authenticity of a conman's smile, yet unfolds with a kind of crazed energy that might appeal to those looking for hollow popcorn entertainment.

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Plane does exactly what it says on the boarding pass. Gerard Butler is the king of big dumb action, getting the tone just right for those in search of uncomplicated thrills.

reviews.name: MaryAnn Johanson
reviews.message: Entertainingly ridiculous? Or ridiculously entertaining? The slick of wild nonsense slapped over an uninspired undercoat is enjoyable enough while you’re onboard, and then it’s instantly forgettable.

reviews.name: Wendy Ide
reviews.message: It may be big, brawling and somewhat inelegant in approach, but this Gerard Butler vehicle is an aviation fuel-powered good time.

reviews.name: Andy Lea
reviews.message: French director Jean-François Richet keeps the action tense, thrilling and reassuringly preposterous.

reviews.name: Leslie Felperin
reviews.message: It would be easy to nitpick action-thriller Plane for its plot holes, old-school machismo and paint-roller-broad characterisation of Asian villains. But it’s also an adrenaline-pumping banger, skilfully executed by Jean-François Richet

reviews.name: Robbie Collin
reviews.message: Plane plays things resolutely old school, from the electronic score zee-yowing away in the background to the script’s pub quiz sprinklings of pilot jargon, and above all the cartoonish brutality of its violent set-pieces.

reviews.name: Andrew Gaudion
reviews.message: It delivers exactly what you would expect from a Gerard Butler film called Plane – and there’s a simple pleasure to be had in just how thrifty it is at doing that.

reviews.name: Dulcie Pearce
reviews.message: Plane does not reinvent the wheel but does land an action-movie punch.

reviews.name: Sebastian Zavala Kahn
reviews.message: It's a thriller with no filler, taking less than two hours to finish, and containing enough tense sequences and shootouts to satisfy any fan of the genre. Add to that a very committed Butler, and we have the winning recipe. Full review in Spanish.

reviews.name: Guillermo Courau
reviews.message: Richet shines in directing action scenes... Add to that Butler's charisma and the film results in an even film that may not have peak moments worthy of a standing ovation, but neither does it have moments to make you yawn. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Rafaela Sales Ross
reviews.message: Gerard Butler is a treat – the runtime seems to fly by.

reviews.name: Pablo O. Scholz
reviews.message: The action is fast-paced, and the hand-to-hand combat is precisely choreographed. Jean-François Richet kept his cool in the editing room and didn't resort to strange cuts to add vertigo to the fights... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jay Horton
reviews.message: A lack of pretension shouldn’t excuse the utter absence of creative ambition.

reviews.name: Alistair Harkness
reviews.message: Jean-François Richet keeps the action sleek and the tension high. Butler, meanwhile, has rarely been better.

reviews.name: Olly Richards
reviews.message: This is just the kind of tosh you want it to be. Brisk, easy, brutish. It has explosions, punch-ups, shoot-outs and more than one bit where someone gets smacked in the face with a big hammer. How much more could you reasonably ask? It’s a blast.

reviews.name: Marc Burrows
reviews.message: A pleasingly slight and comfortingly formulaic action flick with less plane in it than the title would suggest.

reviews.name: Rex Reed
reviews.message: A first-rate action thriller.

reviews.name: John Nugent
reviews.message: What starts in a comfortable disaster-movie mould quickly handbrake-turns into a generic, by-the-numbers action thriller, serving up a stale platter of fist fights, gun battles and hostage-taking.

title: Anna Nicole Smith: You Don't Know Me
description: From director Ursula Macfarlane (Untouchable) and producer Alexandra Lacey comes an unflinching and humanizing examination of the life, death and secrets of Vickie Lynn Hogan -- better known as model and actress Anna Nicole Smith. From her first appearance in Playboy in 1992, Anna Nicole's dizzying ascent was the very essence of the American dream, brought to a tragic halt with her untimely passing in 2007. With access to never-before-seen footage, home movies, and interviews with key figures who have not spoken out until now, ANNA NICOLE SMITH: YOU DON'T KNOW ME reveals new insights into the story of the quintessential blonde bombshell hardly anyone really knew.

characteristics.Producer:: Alexandra Lacey

reviews.name: Sophie Gilbert
reviews.message: Smith’s life was sad, in many ways -- but it was also significant in so many other ways that this bumpy, questionable portrait doesn’t begin to unpack.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: A film that’s revealing, humanizing and honest about finding the course of her life as sordid and even dishonest by design is exactly the sort of documentary biography Smith deserved.

reviews.name: Martín Fernández Cruz
reviews.message: ... dedicates itself to showing the hidden side of this figure, and proposes, that in one way or another, destiny is something we build. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Preston Barta
reviews.message: ‘You Don’t Know Me’ leaves you with incredible sadness, whether you are familiar with [Smith's] story or not. Through this deeply personal chronicling of her life, you feel the nails of the inescapable monster that is fame.

reviews.name: Kayleigh Donaldson
reviews.message: Is the point of this to show the pain Smith put herself through to achieve perfection? It just feels like yet another excuse to leer at someone who was gawked at from birth.

reviews.name: Richard Roeper
reviews.message: A solid and straightforward look at the life and times of the small-town Texas girl who for a time in the 1990s was as famous as just about anyone on the planet.

reviews.name: Randy Myers
reviews.message: Macfarlane’s sad portrait provides deeper context to the tragic life of the former stripper, model and actress.

reviews.name: Audra Heinrichs
reviews.message: You Don’t Know Me is Blonde-esque in that it fails to care why Smith might’ve felt the need to lie even before achieving fame, and later, infamy.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It’s frustrating to watch You Don’t Know Me meander around the substance of Smith’s heart, her moral center, and come to a smudgy conclusion: It’s complicated!

reviews.name: Cady Lang
reviews.message: Ultimately more of a voyeuristic cautionary tale than an accounting of a complex woman’s humanity.

reviews.name: Calum Marsh
reviews.message: Smith deserved better than how she was treated. And she deserves better than this.

reviews.name: Amanda Guarragi
reviews.message: Apart from the new footage, this doesn’t expand on the story everyone knows.

reviews.name: Anna Bogutskaya
reviews.message: While a sub-genre of documentaries reassessing the maligned women of the Noughties is thriving, Anna Nicole Smith: You Don’t Know Me can barely contain its contempt for its subject matter.

reviews.name: Chris Vognar
reviews.message: It remains a visually engaging portrait that depicts Smith as more than just a little girl lost. The film argues that, despite a powerful self-destructive streak... she often knew exactly what she was doing.

reviews.name: Brian Lowry
reviews.message: While there are some new details in the telling, the net effect leaves the Smith that people didn't know, other than those meticulously airbrushed photo spreads, largely untouched.

reviews.name: Noel Murray
reviews.message: This is an in-depth film about a person many presumed had no depth at all.

reviews.name: Courtney Howard
reviews.message: This exploration and would-be exoneration of Anna Nicole Smith’s tragic life becomes the kind of exploitation it seeks to condemn.

reviews.name: Angie Han
reviews.message: You Don’t Know Me aims to cut past the mythology to reveal the flesh-and-blood woman underneath, and in doing so assembles a mostly sympathetic, mostly compelling portrait of an all-American tragedy.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: It’s an effective retelling, though the film could have concentrated more on her tragicomic relationship with her oil plutocrat husband.

reviews.name: Susie Bright
reviews.message: “You Don’t Know Me” producers needed to be made of sterner stuff if they wanted a memorable picture.

title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
description: Bitten by a radioactive spider in the subway, Brooklyn teenager Miles Morales suddenly develops mysterious powers that transform him into the one and only Spider-Man. When he meets Peter Parker, he soon realizes that there are many others who share his special, high-flying talents. Miles must now use his newfound skills to battle the evil Kingpin, a hulking madman who can open portals to other universes and pull different versions of Spider-Man into our world.

characteristics.Genre:: Kids & family, Action, Adventure, Comedy, Fantasy, Animation
characteristics.Director:: Bob Persichetti, Peter Ramsey, Rodney Rothman
characteristics.Producer:: Avi Arad, Amy Pascal, Phil Lord, Chris Miller, Christina Steinberg
characteristics.Production Co:: Sony Pictures Animation, Avi Arad, Pascal Pictures, Lord Miller
characteristics.Sound Mix:: SDDS, DTS, Dolby Atmos, Dolby Digital

reviews.name: Jennifer Bisset
reviews.message: Over 140 animators combined computer animation with a hand-drawn style to mimic a comic book look. Inventive visuals, fresh storytelling and embracing the comic books' wackiness helped make the first non-white Spider-Man one of the best.

reviews.name: Kate Boyle
reviews.message: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse was a fantastic film.  It is a great coming-of-age story that teaches us we are all unique and that’s what makes us great.

reviews.name: Joseph Garcia
reviews.message: What they have here is something special. Not only does it look unique, but it also feels very forward-thinking in terms of animation.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Harris
reviews.message: The film works as a refreshing origin story for Miles Morales, and the filmmakers offer a unique visual style that's never really been seen before in a CG-animated picture.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: But then you run into the storytelling – a frustrating swirl of highs and lows that shortchanges its most interesting component and emotional core.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: It manages to be more than the easy cash-grab it could have been by supplying audiences with something uncommon, both within the superhero genre and in the medium of animation.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: Generally speaking, it's an acceptable animated product of arachnid superheroes, but it doesn't seem as great as it's being marketed to me. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Kip Mooney
reviews.message: It's the best animated film of the year, and one of the best movies of the year period.

reviews.name: Rick Marshall
reviews.message: Into the Spider-Verse isn't just the best of the character's origin films, it's right up there among the best Spider-Man movies ever made.

reviews.name: Alex Bentley
reviews.message: You may not think that you need to give your time to yet another Spider-Man movie, but you would be wrong. Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse expands the character into fantastic different directions and could be the start of something completely new.

reviews.name: Jim Rohner
reviews.message: It's an absolutely delightful watch and one of the finest examples of the excitement and joy of which cinema is capable.

reviews.name: Fletcher Powell
reviews.message: I can't come up with enough superlatives to describe how much darn fun Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse is.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Zhang
reviews.message: A resoundingly successful experiment that will open countless doors to the weird, wonderful world of comic books.

reviews.name: Mark Cassidy
reviews.message: Spectacular, amazing, astonishing - whatever Spidey-related adjective you choose, it'll fit.

reviews.name: Isaac Feldberg
reviews.message: An audaciously, almost unbelievably alive piece of pop art made by people who really respect and understand the hope at the core of the superhero mythos.

reviews.name: David Hogan
reviews.message: Spider-Verse manages to tell a comic book origin tale, a heart-warming family tale and a grand-scale multiversal threat tale and nails all three perfectly. More please!

reviews.name: Victor Pineyro
reviews.message: This is not only the best Spider-Man movie that has ever been made, but it ranks on the top of the very own superhero genre. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Kelechi Ehenulo
reviews.message: Universal in its approach by leaving a beaming smile across your face, Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse beautifully reminds you why you love Spider-Man in the first place.

reviews.name: Matt Cipolla
reviews.message: Into the Spider-Verse ends on a whimper, but at least there's still something under all those masks. And you know what? I liked what I saw beneath those big, webby eyes.

reviews.name: Zehra Phelan
reviews.message: Major audience appeal both of the child and adult variety, it's a wondrous web-slinging caper.

reviews.name: Allen Almachar
reviews.message: It's a progressive, inclusion-focused film with a central message letting us know that we can all accomplish amazing things if we set our minds to it.

reviews.name: Steven Prokopy
reviews.message: Feels the most like a comic book than any other superhero movie to date, if for no other reason than it could only exist in a rendered space where a variety of animation styles could be brought together into a truly wild and electric journey.

reviews.name: Doug Walker
reviews.message: The best Spider-Man movie I've ever seen, period.

reviews.name: CJ Sheu
reviews.message: Believe the hype. Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse is both the best animated film of 2018 and the best Spider-Man film ever.

reviews.name: Damond Fudge
reviews.message: Spider-Verse is a fast-paced, fun and fresh take on an origin story we all know so well ... The animation is amazing, combining different techniques ... to create a whole new graphical style we really haven't seen up to this point.

reviews.name: Ben Sachs
reviews.message: Actually captures the sensation of getting absorbed in a comic book.

reviews.name: Federico Furzan
reviews.message: A punk version of a story of which we've seen adaptations before. But never something as bold as this. [Full review in Spanish].

reviews.name: Charlotte Harrison
reviews.message: There's a perfect balance between humor and pathos, a regular stream of jokes occasionally intersected with moments of real heart.

reviews.name: Chris McCoy
reviews.message: Impossible shots coupled with a breezy screenplay make this the most fun superhero movie since Sam Raimi shot an upside down Toby Maguire kissing Kirsten Dunst.

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: Combined with the fast-paced action sequences and an energetic soundtrack, the film is a heady cocktail of entertainment.

reviews.name: Nicolás Delgadillo
reviews.message: It's a literal and symbolic passing of the torch, easily the best Spider-Man film since Sam Raimi's Spider-Man 2, and one of the best animated and superhero films of all time.

reviews.name: Hannah Lodge
reviews.message: Spider-Verse looks more like a gorgeous comic than a reproduction of a live action film.

reviews.name: Charles Solomon
reviews.message: It's fresh, it's funny without being snarky, [and] it's dramatic without an over-reliance on special effects.

reviews.name: Josh Wilding
reviews.message: With a diverse cast and a vibrant, exciting world which feels fresh and different compared to what we're used to seeing in the genre, Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse is a silver screen Spider-Man classic.

reviews.name: Noah Berlatsky
reviews.message: The movie vibrates with ambition and enthusiasm.

reviews.name: Linda and Al Lerner
reviews.message: This first animated Spider-Man movie gives these filmmakers the freedom to expand the universe with more characters, humor, diversity and far more action.

reviews.name: Kate Gardner
reviews.message: Spider-Verse is a triumphant work of art that is beautiful to behold, that gets better with each additional viewing. It embraces the truly remarkable spirit that makes Spider-Man so popular and why he is so important to so many fans.

reviews.name: Karl Delossantos
reviews.message: It's a bright and bold loving critique of the superhero genre and a much needed hard reset.

reviews.name: Grant Watson
reviews.message: Now and again this seemingly endless conveyor belt of capes and criminals just occasionally really knocks one out of the park.

reviews.name: Dominic Griffin
reviews.message: Spider-Verse shows that there are no actual limits to superhero stories on the big screen, so long as they aren't tethered to how many Robert Downey Jr. quips they can fit.

title: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish
description: This fall, everyone's favorite leche-loving, swashbuckling, fear-defying feline returns. For the first time in more than a decade, DreamWorks Animation presents a new adventure in the Shrek universe as daring outlaw Puss in Boots discovers that his passion for peril and disregard for safety have taken their toll. Puss has burned through eight of his nine lives, though he lost count along the way. Getting those lives back will send Puss in Boots on his grandest quest yet. Academy Award® nominee Antonio Banderas returns as the voice of the notorious PiB as he embarks on an epic journey into the Black Forest to find the mythical Wishing Star and restore his lost lives. But with only one life left, Puss will have to humble himself and ask for help from his former partner and nemesis: the captivating Kitty Soft Paws (Oscar® nominee Salma Hayek). In their quest, Puss and Kitty will be aided--against their better judgment--by a ratty, chatty, relentlessly cheerful mutt, Perro (Harvey Guillén, What We Do in the Shadows). Together, our trio of heroes will have to stay one step ahead of Goldilocks (Oscar® nominee Florence Pugh, Black Widow) and the Three Bears Crime Family, "Big" Jack Horner (Emmy winner John Mulaney, Big Mouth) and terrifying bounty hunter, The Big Bad Wolf (Wagner Moura, Narcos).

characteristics.Producer:: Mark Swift

reviews.name: Aisha Jordan
reviews.message: What a time we live in where our cartoon characters can give us the space to explore mental health and the importance of leaning on our community.

reviews.name: Douglas Davidson
reviews.message: Riding the line between the silliness of the "Shrek" Universe from which it came and something far more Grimm, "Puss in Boots: The Last Wish" explores the value of appreciating where you are and what you have ...

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: It does a fine job of balancing its knockabout humor with a surprisingly somber tale of how the specter of death can limit one’s ability to fully embrace and enjoy life.

reviews.name: Jack Bottomley
reviews.message: The Last Wish is a spellbinding, funny, and gorgeous piece of animated storytelling that restores this franchise to past glory. The real cat in the hat is back, and his boots are very much made for walking!

reviews.name: Annie Banks
reviews.message: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish takes necessary risks without losing  to the assumption that all sequels lose their luster.

reviews.name: Matt Hudson
reviews.message: Emotional and surprisingly excellent, Puss in Boots: The Last Wish is one of Dreamworks' best and a real crowd-pleaser.

reviews.name: Edward Porter
reviews.message: ... the film is enjoyable in its way, partly thanks to a painted style that rejects the usual sheen of modern animation.

reviews.name: Ed Potton
reviews.message: Joel Crawford and Januel Mercado get the tone Goldilocks-right — not too scary, not too bland — and add some stylish angular slow-motion fight sequences.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: Its adventure loses its charm when the cat and his gang often travel through the same easy terrain where the surprise of fairy tales is absent. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Benjamin Wiebe
reviews.message: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish is an 11 year sequel with something to prove, and while its meta-textual elements don’t quite reach the highs of Shrek 2, it’s a work of art you must see this holiday season.

reviews.name: Jamie Healy
reviews.message: The Last Wish proves a sensational, swashbuckling return for everyone's favourite costumed cat.

reviews.name: Jaby Koay
reviews.message: It lived up to all of the hype... the story was so strong.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Coming in at a brisk 100 minutes & carrying enough pop culture humor to fill two movies, this sequel gives you the goods. It’s a ticket to the Antonio Banderas show. He puts in wonderful voice work, infusing the sword-savvy feline with charisma & passion.

reviews.name: Clarisse Loughrey
reviews.message: The Last Wish offers something different and unexpected: Puss has grown up with his audience.

reviews.name: Veronica Lee
reviews.message: The animation style is warm and uses high colour, the film's visual richness giving the impression almost that we're stepping into a picture book. It's very appealing.

reviews.name: Wendy Ide
reviews.message: Harnesses the familiar appeal of the self-aggrandising feline (Antonio Banderas), while also adopting a distinctive and original graphic visual style.

reviews.name: Brian Viner
reviews.message: It's witty and beautifully animated, though be warned that younger children might want to hide under the seat when the wolf comes along.

reviews.name: Tara Brady
reviews.message: There is a lot to like here, not least Ray Winstone’s Papa Bear. The forests are Skittle-coloured. The set pieces are wild and kinetic. But it is Banderas’s star power that saves the day.

reviews.name: Andy Lea
reviews.message: The animation is gorgeous, the action is zippy and Banderas is brilliant. After a lean few months for family animation, kids and parents should lap this one up.

reviews.name: Emily Breen
reviews.message: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish is a heartfelt adventure caper that tackles anxiety with surprising empathy and wit. A few cast members should have been lost in the woods but overall this one’s a winner!

reviews.name: Robbie Collin
reviews.message: There’s an entire pick ’n’ mix stand of eye candy here – more than enough to satisfy younger viewers. But alas, it’s all empty calories.

reviews.name: Dulcie Pearce
reviews.message: Banderas brings all the usual joy and energy to the character he made his own, and uses just the right amount of humour in the role, too.

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: If you are expecting something that will reinvigorate the genre, this will be a disappointment. However, what Puss In Boots: The Last Wish lacks in originality, it makes up for in laughs and heart.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish is a worthy sequel and Dreamworks Animation’s most ambitious, visually striking film in years.

reviews.name: Peter Bradshaw
reviews.message: How bland and forgettable this film is, without in the smallest way harnessing the real performing power of Banderas, Colman, Pugh, Winstone et al.

reviews.name: Doug Walker
reviews.message: Funny, poignant, beautifully animated, an absolute delight for children and adults. Hands down one of the best films of the year.

reviews.name: Alistair Harkness
reviews.message: In the tradition of Shrek, the film has fun deconstructing fairytale lore, though what really distinguishes it is the animation, which has a more painterly and pleasingly hand-crafted feel.

reviews.name: Kate Stables
reviews.message: What really elevates this sophisticated sequel is Banderas’ rich voicework, which reveals that, under Puss’ suave bluster, there’s a moody moggie discovering fear for the first time.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …while the formula is aging like the furrball protagonist, Puss in Boots is the cat’s pyjamas as far as comfort food for kids goes…

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: A brilliantly entertaining instalment of the Shrek franchise - with dazzling colours, great characters and jokes galore, it is unadulterated family entertainment.

reviews.name: Ben Travis
reviews.message: A cat always lands on its feet — and Puss In Boots: The Last Wish does so with considerable style, rapier wit, and surprising substance.

reviews.name: Abhishek Srivastava
reviews.message: This film is unquestionably among the best in the Shrek universe.

reviews.name: Michael Ward
reviews.message: ...quite the fun surprise to uncover at year’s end.

reviews.name: Rob Thomas
reviews.message: “The Last Wish” consistently delivers good jokes for young and old, dazzling visuals, and an earnest message about living the life you’ve got.

reviews.name: JimmyO
reviews.message: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish is a solid return for the imaginative and comedic fairy tale.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...a decent-enough animated endeavor that could (and should) have been so much better.

reviews.name: Pete Vonder Haar
reviews.message: Will lessons imparted about the appreciating what we have fly over the heads of younger kids? Possibly. Will off-handed references to drowning puppies? Possibly not.

reviews.name: Chris Sawin
reviews.message: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish is stylish and fun with sleek animation, a thrillingly adventurous story, off-the-wall humor, and fantastic writing that is penned in a way that rejuvenates what was thought to be a dead CGI animated franchise.

reviews.name: Jennifer Green
reviews.message: Shrek's charismatic cat buddy is back in fine form in this action-packed sequel. But Puss in Boots: The Last Wish might have done well to focus more on its characters, both familiar and new, and less on the nonstop action.

reviews.name: Amy Nicholson
reviews.message: [Antonio Banderas] plays this character with so much delight... I find him very funny and charming.

title: Tetris
description: "Tetris" tells the unbelievable story of how one of the world's most popular video games found its way to avid players around the globe. Henk Rogers (Taron Egerton) discovers TETRIS in 1988, and then risks everything by traveling to the Soviet Union, where he joins forces with inventor Alexey Pazhitnov (Nikita Efremov) to bring the game to the masses. Based on a true story, "Tetris" is a Cold War-era thriller on steroids, with double-crossing villains, unlikely heroes and a nail-biting race to the finish.

characteristics.Producer:: Gillian Berrie, Len Blavatnik, Gregor Cameron, Claudia Schiffer, Matthew Vaughn

reviews.name: Cory Woodroof
reviews.message: It might be a wee bit too cutesy for its own good, but it’s also a stunning testament to just picking a good story not a lot of people know about and telling it seriously with a imaginative director, a rocksteady script and reliable actors.

reviews.name: Carla Hay
reviews.message: In this lively retelling of the Tetris game origin story, the 'race against time' plot developments are obviously exaggerated for the movie. However, the double dealings and business backstabbings ring true, in addition to navigating cultural differences.

reviews.name: Carla Renata
reviews.message: Drama, Intrigue, Politics and Financial Greed makes Tetris a memorable film from start to finish!  Who know a video game would've caused such global tension

reviews.name: James Delingpole
reviews.message: Taron Egerton is delightfully sympathetic as the tenacious Henk Rogers... But the star of the show has to be Roger Allam in a possibly career-best performance as Robert Maxwell.

reviews.name: Stephen Romei
reviews.message: The drawn-from-life drama Tetris is a bit like the video game it’s named after: slow to start but, once it warms up, a bit addictive.

reviews.name: Matt Conway
reviews.message: Tetris spins an amusing yet ephemeral tale in its Hollywoodization of real-world history.

reviews.name: Paul Whitington
reviews.message: Egerton leads the line energetically, and Allam is satisfyingly odious as Maxwell, the mogul with feet of clay.

reviews.name: Symphony Barnes
reviews.message: With all the many biopics these days, Tetris will likely become another forgotten one amongst them, thanks to its unfocused and exhaustive narrative.

reviews.name: Ruben Peralta Rigaud
reviews.message: A film that can be formidably seen while playing an extensive game of Tetris, and even still, not have a bad time.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Stephen A. Russell
reviews.message: It's a real East vs West battle with British and American people trying to get control of this game made in Soviet Russia. They're obviously not very big on the Capitalist game, but the capitalists are salivating at how much money this game will make.

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: A fun but complex romp about how different factions around the world, from the U.S. to Japan to Britain to the Soviet Union, all wanted a piece of that addictive video game.

reviews.name: Shawn Edwards
reviews.message: "Tetris" is intriguing and interesting. Gets a bit espionagy but it's totally fascinating. Taron Egerton completely commits and sneakily delivers perhaps the best performance of his career.

reviews.name: Lael Loewenstein
reviews.message: The film really captures being on the cusp of a technological breakthrough... Quite entertaining.

reviews.name: Wade Major
reviews.message: They're pushing the dramatization beyond what actually happened, but that said it's an awful lot of fun.

reviews.name: Frank Wilkins
reviews.message: Were it about anything other than a silly 8-bit game we’ve all played a million times, it probably wouldn’t work as well as it does.

reviews.name: Rene Sanchez
reviews.message: Despite its interesting story and Taron Egerton's commendable performance, it lacks the originality that characterized its source of inspiration. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: Who knew that sterile business meetings could be this riveting? The film convinces us that Tetris helped the U.S. win the Cold War as much as Ronald Reagan vs. Mikhail Gorbachev or Rocky Balboa vs. Ivan Drago. Tumbling blocks, tear down this wall!

reviews.name: Patrick Hicks
reviews.message: TETRIS manages to take a story about video game acquisition rights and level it up into an espionage thriller. While not every story beat connects, Egerton's portrayal of capitalist Henk Rogers keeps us entertained until the very last brick is stacked.

reviews.name: Tiffany Kelly
reviews.message: The film is strongest when it focuses on the friendship at the heart of the story.

reviews.name: Robert Denerstein
reviews.message: Lively and never dull, Tetris could be the only movie I’ve seen recently in which the outcome hinges on the invention of a hand-held device — Nintendo’s Game Boy — that’s not designed to blow anything up.

reviews.name: Jorge Loser
reviews.message: Tetris is a harmless stretched-out anecdote that comes at a time where corporate celebration arrives in a torrent... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Frank Swietek
reviews.message: Whether you’re a fan of the game or not, you should find “Tetris” an entertaining Cold War romp, so long as you’re not looking for a history lesson.

reviews.name: Alex Maidy
reviews.message: Tetris is an exciting movie that, like the game itself, is intricate, puzzling, confounding, and leaves you wanting more. This is a winner in every way and one of the best movies about technology and video games ever made.

reviews.name: Rohan Naahar
reviews.message: Like a gamer who resorts to button-mashing after initially resolving to take the elegant approach, Tetris disintegrates into a mess of its own making after a deliriously entertaining first half.

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: Tetris tells a fascinating true story that is so much more than the film’s name would suggest.

reviews.name: Nestor Bentancor
reviews.message: A solid dramatization, supercharged by an energetic lead performance and aesthetic flourishes. Not top-of-the-line, but it manages to entertain bit by bit. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Robert W. Butler
reviews.message: Despite its slow-building tension, Tetris is often drolly funny.

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: Stirring action and intrigue, cool period detail and layered characters, gifted director Jon S Baird manages to make a series of negotiations both fascinating and riotously entertaining.

reviews.name: Abhishek Srivastava
reviews.message: Tetris is an interesting watch that showcases a captivating story and a talented cast.

reviews.name: Mike Reyes
reviews.message: Tetris is a well-played game of historical fact and amusing fictional touches.

reviews.name: Amelia Harvey
reviews.message: The runtime isn’t helped by the repetitive nature of the script, but it’s nevertheless an eye-opening thriller about the little-known inception of one of the most iconic games in history.

reviews.name: Paul Mount
reviews.message: ... Out of necessity, turns what might have been a dry and dusty exploration of corporate greed and espionage into a fizzing and fascinating look back at the growing pains of one of the most famous video game titles of all time.

reviews.name: Richard Roeper
reviews.message: Taron Egerton fits perfectly into story of the classic game’s origins.

reviews.name: Justin Charity
reviews.message: As wild as this sounds on paper, in Tetris, the dispute is too tedious to appreciate.

reviews.name: Patrick McDonald
reviews.message: Taron Egerton has some nice conflicts to reconcile through his Hank character, & the big money adds tense drama to the film … one scene involving a fax machine. QUESTION: Is Hank  a hero for essentially making himself wealthy for the rest of his life?

reviews.name: Tim Stevens
reviews.message: Unfortunately, the good things unfold against a mountain of what doesn’t work.

reviews.name: Tom Shone
reviews.message: The weight of the story belongs entirely to the Russian inventor and his wife, and to the glimpses we get of pre-glasnost Muscovites trudging to and from empty grocery stores.

reviews.name: Rachel Ho
reviews.message: It finds itself in a wayward space: too serious to be campy, too campy to be serious.

reviews.name: Greg Cwik
reviews.message: That sense of apathy that plagues the film’s conception is what will ultimately register most with viewers — there’s simply nothing to be excited about here.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: It tells the fantastic story of how the popular video game Tetris was allowed out of Russia to be played by the masses around the world, but its depiction is too murky to be fully enjoyed.

title: Avengers: Endgame
description: Adrift in space with no food or water, Tony Stark sends a message to Pepper Potts as his oxygen supply starts to dwindle. Meanwhile, the remaining Avengers -- Thor, Black Widow, Captain America and Bruce Banner -- must figure out a way to bring back their vanquished allies for an epic showdown with Thanos -- the evil demigod who decimated the planet and the universe.

characteristics.Producer:: Kevin Feige
characteristics.Sound Mix:: DTS, Dolby Digital, SDDS, Dolby Atmos

reviews.name: Joseph Garcia
reviews.message: Your level of enjoyment depends on how invested you are in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. If you've been with [the franchise] since 2008, "Endgame" is an unparalleled experience – unlike anything that has come before and may ever come again.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Harris
reviews.message: Avengers: Endgame is not just a culmination of the last eleven years of the Marvel Studios cinematic saga but also a celebration of everything people have come to love about these characters.

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: I’m not sure if I would call the great completion of the Marvel Cinematic Universe the best comic book film of all time. Still, it’s certainly the finest conclusion to a greater ideal Hollywood has ever put together.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: From the very beginning “Avengers: Endgame” feels like something special, something unique, something unlike anything we’ve seen before. And even in its missteps it never loses that sense of spectacle and grandeur.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: Who could have anticipated that Marvel Studios and Disney would release a three-hour extravaganza whose exquisite character-focused scenes outshine the FX-driven action?

reviews.name: Victoria Luxford
reviews.message: Eleven years of Universe building, and this is the crescendo. It really pays off, I've never seen anything quite like it.

reviews.name: David Gonzalez
reviews.message: Avengers: Endgame broke me, put me back together, and decided to cut me again in one of the most impactful cinematic experiences of all time.

reviews.name: Lonita Cook
reviews.message: For me, it didn't fulfill the promise of Infinity War, but it did fulfill the promise of the previous twenty movies.

reviews.name: Nicholas Oon
reviews.message: I'm just grateful to have the privilege to watch this along with the rest of the world. It's not perfect, but it has been one hell of a ride.

reviews.name: Hosea Rupprecht
reviews.message: Here's the other really neat thing about Endgame: it made me think of priorities in life and what or who is worth sacrificing for, especially loved ones...

reviews.name: Nathan Mattise
reviews.message: The true superteam event releases marked something slightly different and spectacular...End Game over the original Guardians by a hair...

reviews.name: Robin Holabird
reviews.message: This goes beyond the usual scale.

reviews.name: Rick Marshall
reviews.message: A film that somehow manages to be as epic as fans hope and as dramatic as the MCU deserves.

reviews.name: Nick Levine
reviews.message: Films don't come any huger than this: the closing chapter to an 11-year saga in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, told across some 22 movies. And by the end of its three-hour runtime, there will definitely be tears.

reviews.name: Olly Richards
reviews.message: There really is very little that could be improved about Endgame. There's certainly no more that could be thrown at it.

reviews.name: Luiz Oliveira
reviews.message: So much of the art form is about storytelling, and bringing so many side stories and characters to a satisfying conclusion is tough, and the film blended a (rather) unpredictable plot with emotional character beats deftly...

reviews.name: Alex Bentley
reviews.message: Avengers: Endgame is everything Marvel fans could want and more. It will be interesting to see how the MCU moves into the future after the events in the film, but woe be upon anyone who doubts their ability to adapt and succeed mightily.

reviews.name: Fletcher Powell
reviews.message: I found Avengers: Endgame wonderfully satisfying.

reviews.name: Ian Simmons
reviews.message: There are [Marvel] movies that have been just as entertaining and a lot smarter than this one.

reviews.name: Richard Crouse
reviews.message: Feels like the end of the old cycle, the beginning of a reset. Old favourites gone, passing the mantle to others before they go. We even see a poster that reads, "Where do we go, now that they're all gone?"

reviews.name: Jeffrey Zhang
reviews.message: The MCU is the ultimate long game, and Endgame feels like its glorious final lap.

reviews.name: Mark Cassidy
reviews.message: Terms like masterpiece and game-changer are often thrown around a bit hastily, but not on this occasion.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: The fight scenes, while chaotic and intermittently exhilarating, are unable to avoid repetition; such is the nature of invincible entities dueling other invincible entities.

reviews.name: Charles Koplinski
reviews.message: "Avengers: Endgame" was a wonderful surprise, filling almost every minute (all 181 of them) with excitement, drama, humor, and visually interesting and entertaining intrigue.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: What The Russo Brothers did here is take high expectations and blow them out of the water with an emotionally thrilling finale. Get ready to be moved!

reviews.name: Richard Propes
reviews.message: The only thing that I know for sure has ended with the Marvel Cinematic Universe is my patience.

reviews.name: Kelechi Ehenulo
reviews.message: Endgame is nothing short of a deserved send-off to the Infinity Saga, stamping an impressive mark on the cultural psyche. It has been one hell of a ride.

reviews.name: Victor Pineyro
reviews.message: Part of the journey is the end, and this one is perfect for certain characters. An unprecedented movie in film history, and a very difficult feat to repeat. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Stephen A. Russell
reviews.message: Neither the best nor the worst of times in the franchise, it's a bit like a sugar rush. Endgame delivers both epics highs and a following crash that leaves you feeling oddly empty.

reviews.name: Matt Cipolla
reviews.message: It's that the movie itself is overblown and half-baked, and without the audience, it's something of a glorified in-joke.

reviews.name: James Hanton
reviews.message: If Infinity War wanted to blow you away, Endgame wants to punch you in the gut and leave you a speechless, quivering wreck.

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: The 22nd installment is a fittingly epic, three-hour finale that packs all of the fan service you could ever want, laced with somber tones and emotional payoffs that will cause even the genre's biggest detractors to shed a tear.

reviews.name: Steven Prokopy
reviews.message: It's one of the funniest movies of the 20-plus in the franchise, but it's also the one that made me the most emotional. But more than anything, it left me satisfied and thrilled that I kept watching them through the years.

reviews.name: Saibal Chatterjee
reviews.message: For fans of the most successful franchise in movie history, Avengers: Endgame delivers the world - and more.

reviews.name: Zehra Phelan
reviews.message: Epic and spectacular, an emotional rollercoaster that none of us will ever forget.

reviews.name: Allen Almachar
reviews.message: Avengers: Endgame is the most 'superhero movie' superhero movie ever made.

reviews.name: Nabila Hatimy
reviews.message: The film is almost three hours long; long enough to tie up loose ends, as well as give foundation to a new generation of Avengers. When all is said and done, this was the hardest goodbye in the Marvel Universe.

reviews.name: Ricardo Gallegos
reviews.message: A genuine, spectacular, and moving love letter from the Marvel family, the world of comics and the Russo brothers to modern pop culture. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Doug Walker
reviews.message: A good movie with a breathtaking third act for any comic book fan.

reviews.name: Brent McKnight
reviews.message: While there are a few ho-hum moments, there are equally stunning, stirring, triumphant ones where it's damn near impossible not to cheer.

title: Nope
description: A man and his sister discover something sinister in the skies above their California horse ranch, while the owner of a nearby theme park tries to profit from the mysterious, otherworldly phenomenon.

characteristics.Producer:: Jordan Peele, Ian Cooper

reviews.name: Steve Crum
reviews.message: Director-writer Peele clearly knows the business of suspending disbelief. I say “yup” to ‘Nope.’

reviews.name: C.H. Newell
reviews.message: Beneath the interesting and strange tale of aliens and UAPs is Peele shining a bright light from the sky onto Hollywood and American pop culture’s exploitation of Black people and animals.

reviews.name: KT Mahe
reviews.message: There's so much considered detail and nuance that is weaved into these fantastical themes which is bolstered by a lot of the characters taking control of their own narrative.

reviews.name: Oti
reviews.message: I've never felt that before. It was a completely new feeling especially in the sci-fi horror genre where you just don't get a lot of Black happiness and Black people and Black camaraderie.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: Yup.

reviews.name: Robert Koehler
reviews.message: This final confrontation is truly a spectacle...

reviews.name: James Wegg
reviews.message: Don't look up

reviews.name: Patrick Hicks
reviews.message: Feels like a modern take on a classic sci-fi story that would have made a really fantastic episode of The Twilight Zone.

reviews.name: William Jones
reviews.message: Jordan Peele's Nope innovatively uses the IMAX format in ways many wouldn't have believed possible to create an inescapably immersive experience.

reviews.name: Steph Cozza
