Entering her first semester of college, Tessa's guarded world opens up when she meets Hardin Scott, a mysterious and brooding rebel who makes her question all she thought she knew about herself -- and what she wants out of life.

characteristics.Writer:: Susan McMartin, Tamara Chestna, Jenny Gage, Tom Betterton
characteristics.Production Co:: Offspring Entertainment, Voltage Pictures, Diamond Film Productions, Wattpad

reviews.name: Natasha Alvar
reviews.message: This really is a dumpster fire of a movie, so please save your money for something more worthwhile.

reviews.name: James Croot
reviews.message: After is also one of those teen dramas where every emotion has to be underscored by a pop-song and a hair is never out of place.

reviews.name: Adrian Martin
reviews.message: Adapted from young adult fan fiction, not much happens in this adolescent love story, yet it becomes weirdly interesting.

reviews.name: Nicholas Bell
reviews.message: Of such deficient quality that it's unfathomable people will actually pay for a ticket to see this.

reviews.name: Brigid Presecky
reviews.message: The music is fun and the scenery is beautifully cinematic, in a way, but the story itself is neither.

reviews.name: Greg Carlson
reviews.message: Jenny Gage's sudsy After offers run-of-the-mill college romance targeted to the PG-13 demographic. The result, a far cry from the lustier stories upon which it is based, misses the mark despite an appealing performance from Josephine Langford.

reviews.name: Jim Schembri
reviews.message: The leads give it all they've got, and Australian actress Josephine Langford is impressive given the limited range of her role. The film looks pretty and director Jenny Gage, to her credit, knows the rhythms of teen melodrama well.

reviews.name: Stephen Romei
reviews.message: It's a movie well made for its target audience.

reviews.name: Vicky Roach
reviews.message: After makes 50 Shades Of Grey look like Anna Karenina.

reviews.name: Peter Gray
reviews.message: The film's illogical choices and standard teen romance mentality mean nothing that transpires on screen feels remotely fresh.

reviews.name: Leigh Paatsch
reviews.message: The first movie adaptation, and it looks fairly safe to say there won't be any more Afters after this After.

reviews.name: Sandra Hall
reviews.message: The key to the book's success lies in its artful amateurism. It replicates the tone of one teen confiding in another and in this anodyne screen translation, its intimacy is lost.

reviews.name: Julia Swift
reviews.message: Where are the real teen romances? This gives us a hint, but the script is so flawed that it's hard to buy anything the characters do.

reviews.name: David Nusair
reviews.message: ...an often aggressively generic scenario...

reviews.name: Lara Ben-Ameur
reviews.message: A lost opportunity. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Santiago Alverú
reviews.message: Full of light, pastel colors, enormous curtains, [a] bubble bath, and loud breathing while Taylor Swift plays. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jasmine Lim
reviews.message: The performances are spotty and half-hearted, even the most serious of lines are laughable.

reviews.name: Lauren Veneziani
reviews.message: Anna Todd's novel adaptation is this generation's Cruel Intentions. The PG-13 rating holds back the story some, but stars Josephine Langford and Hero Fiennes Tiffin have impeccable chemistry.

reviews.name: Maria Sherman
reviews.message: As assumed, After is remarkably horny and corny to the point of embarrassment.

reviews.name: William Venegas
reviews.message: I endured [the film until the end only because of professional duty. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: Films like After aren't necessarily the best kinds of films to talk to teenagers about sex. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Michael Fairbanks
reviews.message: It just...lingers, futilely praying that the leads can wring something out of this material.

reviews.name: Alci Rengifo
reviews.message: Because the cast is good and the movie is directed with a certain level of energy, we're never necessarily bored, just wondering when it will stop behaving.

reviews.name: Frank Ochieng
reviews.message: Gage's tepid teen romancer After plays it safe and never elevates this youth-oriented, pseudo-steamy sudser beyond its pedestrian pauses of passion. One has seen this slushy session of teen sexual angst numerous times before, folks.

reviews.name: Jim Judy
reviews.message: When the back-story of how a movie came to be ends up being more interesting than the finished product, that isn't going to help matters. (Full Content Review for Parents - Sex, Profanity, etc. - also Available)

reviews.name: Caroline Siede
reviews.message: The real problem with After is that it's a lifeless slog of thinly written clichés, one that's missing the charismatic spark of the actual One Direction boys.

reviews.name: Amanda Adame
reviews.message: A film for fans of the literary saga, but even they might wind up disappointed. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Frank Scheck
reviews.message: Come back, Twilight, all is forgiven.

reviews.name: Anne Brodie
reviews.message: Think Romeo and Juliet sans the poor outcome.

reviews.name: Molly Freeman
reviews.message: After is an intimate look at the ups and downs of first love that takes some nonsensical narrative turns, but is nevertheless a captivating romance.

reviews.name: Robert Abele
reviews.message: The kind of dispiriting effort that thinks it's scratching an itch for masochistic young girls, but primarily suggests that romance, desire and sexuality aren't worth genuinely exploring.

reviews.name: Ignacio Navarro
reviews.message: The soundtrack rounds up the accumulation of clichés that characterizes the entire film. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Kimber Myers
reviews.message: The problems may lie in Todd's novel, but regardless, characters act illogically, as though written by someone who napped through most of Intro to Psych and skipped English 101 altogether.

reviews.name: Mark Dujsik
reviews.message: After opens with some narration about how certain moments in life seem to define a person, and from there, the clichés pretty much don't stop.

reviews.name: John Fink
reviews.message: An uninspired picture that lives at the intersection of E.L. James, Nicholas Sparks, and the Freeform network.

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Much Ado About Absolutely Nothing.

reviews.name: Owen Gleiberman
reviews.message: An innocuous teen pulp soap opera that flirts with "danger" but, in fact, keeps surprising you with how mild and safe and predictable it turns out to be.

reviews.name: Gaspar Zimerman
reviews.message: A patina of high literature... is not enough to counteract the banality and insubstantiality of After. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Natalia Trzenko
reviews.message: This film is closer to Twilight that the perfect comedy of manners from Austen or the romantic tragedy from Brontë. [Full Review in Spanish]

title: Hereditary
description: When the matriarch of the Graham family passes away, her daughter and grandchildren begin to unravel cryptic and increasingly terrifying secrets about their ancestry, trying to outrun the sinister fate they have inherited.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Disturbing Images|Brief Graphic Nudity|Drug Use|Horror Violence|Language)
characteristics.Producer:: Kevin Scott Frakes, Lars Knudsen, Buddy Patrick

reviews.name: Jennifer Bisset
reviews.message: One of the horror genre's greats.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: Fine performances, a strong directorial debut, and soaked in the strategically menacing score by Colin Stetson, “Hereditary” slowly pulls you in before giving your nerves and your senses a good working over.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: Audiences expecting run-of-the-mill horror will be shocked out of their moviegoing complacency early on.

reviews.name: Olly Richards
reviews.message: Ari Aster's absurdly accomplished debut is the best horror movie of the year so far.

reviews.name: Jim Rohner
reviews.message: Pawel Pogorzelski's cinematography and Colin Stetson's score craft a visually and aurally ominous atmosphere that always hints and builds towards the ultimate evil reveal.

reviews.name: Emma Wolfe
reviews.message: So dark and so disturbing.

reviews.name: Lena Wilson
reviews.message: The film's chilling lesson is timely.

reviews.name: Jo Livingstone
reviews.message: The open-ended stakes of these genre experiments are rebellious at a time when horror movie messaging can feel so heavy-handed.

reviews.name: Fletcher Powell
reviews.message: Without a doubt, Hereditary really dug its hooks into me.

reviews.name: Patrick Cavanaugh
reviews.message: A complete assault on your mind, body, and soul that will leave you feeling battered and broken.

reviews.name: Jesse Hassenger
reviews.message: Part of the fun, if "fun" is even the right word for such an upsetting movie, comes from the uncertainty over what kind of horror show this is, exactly.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Zhang
reviews.message: Hereditary is a pitch black exploration of family dynamics and the fallout of dark supernatural secrets.

reviews.name: Isaac Feldberg
reviews.message: In the cruel, assured hands of writer-director Ari Aster, Hereditary comes off as an exemplary mood piece.

reviews.name: David Bax
reviews.message: Hereditary becomes more and more frightening, submerging the viewers in horror rather than splashing them with occasional waves.

reviews.name: Dennis Harvey
reviews.message: ...if you keep your expectations within reasonable control, you'll be rewarded with a tense and atmospheric-if not all that terrifying-experience...

reviews.name: Matthew St. Clair
reviews.message: It shouldn't be a huge surprise to see Toni Collette give a great performance. However, the things she does here are unlike anything else that she's ever done in her career.

reviews.name: Tom Meek
reviews.message: Things take a while to get to the occult and bloody, but when they do it's a quite visceral and grim awakening.

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: Toni Collette shines in a near horror masterpiece that stumbles in the final act as it ultimately shows its hand.

reviews.name: Stephen A. Russell
reviews.message: I found myself laughing at, not with, Hereditary's hammiest horror moments, culminating in a truly awful ending that spells everything out and yet is still riddled with plot holes big enough to bury a desecrated body in.

reviews.name: Matt Cipolla
reviews.message: Hereditary doesn't punch viewers in the gut for quite a while, gently poking them instead until the slightest twitch of a finger feels like the cruelest of punchlines.

reviews.name: Alex Hudson
reviews.message: This is a film that friends will dare one another to watch and then regret it instantly, and it takes a certain masochistic streak to enjoy.

reviews.name: Murjani Rawls
reviews.message: The testament of the effectiveness of the story and macabre nature of Hereditary really manifests long after you leave the theater.

reviews.name: Brent McKnight
reviews.message: Family drama about loss and tragedy folded into supernatural horror; hints and nods and few overt statements; an exquisite mix of skin-peeling tension, heart-pounding dread, jump scares, and gore. Hereditary left me a broken, gooey mess by the end.

reviews.name: Damond Fudge
reviews.message: Not only is Hereditary the slowest of slow burns this side of a Michael Mann film, it is also a near-masterpiece of horror filmmaking.

reviews.name: Dan Tabor
reviews.message: Hereditary is a super effective slow burn shocker, a perfect blend of art house sensibilities and transgressive surreal horror that coalesces into a modern classic of the genre.

reviews.name: Andrew Galdi
reviews.message: This was so stupid to me... Absolute, utter nonsense.

reviews.name: Avaryl Halley
reviews.message: I found it interesting enough.

reviews.name: Dan Scully
reviews.message: [A] film so deeply unsettling, so horrifying on an almost cellular level.

reviews.name: Paul Salfen
reviews.message: It's creepy as anything you're apt to see in recent memory and will haunt you long after you see it.

reviews.name: Chris McCoy
reviews.message: There have been great screamers before, but Collette takes it to the next level with a guttural howl from the depths of her putrefying soul.

reviews.name: Cameron Meier
reviews.message: The film successfully invokes true terror that lingers long after the projector flickers dark.

reviews.name: Katey Stoetzel
reviews.message: What Hereditary is most successful at, though, is capturing the constricting way death is inevitable, be it family members or your own...

reviews.name: Jay Krieger
reviews.message: Ari Aster's horror directorial debut is a masterclass in crafting unbearable tension and suspense that lay the foundation for terrifying conclusion audiences aren't soon to forget.

reviews.name: Jeff York
reviews.message: ["Hereditary"] falters at the finish line. Not only are the last 20 minutes desperate undisciplined, but the actions are screen don't tingle the spine.

reviews.name: Chris Sawin
reviews.message: Hereditary is a screamish plunge into nightmarish insanity. It is absolutely bizarre at times, spine tingling at others, and loaded with bonkers terror in between

reviews.name: Melissa Hannon
reviews.message: 'Hereditary' features fantastic performances, with Toni Collette giving her all. The film is absolute nightmare fuel and will make your heart pound almost the whole way through.

reviews.name: Karl Delossantos
reviews.message: It's shocking that this is a debut. It's assured in its style and meticulously plotted. Repeat viewings will be rewarded.

reviews.name: Josh Goller
reviews.message: Steeped in profound horrors tied to grief, guilt, resentment and mental illness, Hereditary tethers itself to real-world trauma before lifting off into the supernatural.

reviews.name: John Tones
reviews.message: 'Hereditary' is a real wonder, insane and disturbing, and continues to confirm the decade that we live as one of the most creative and stimulating in the history of horror movies. [Full Review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: An impressive calling card that writer-director Ari Aster can whip out at future studio pitches.

title: The Banshees of Inisherin
description: Set on a remote island off the west coast of Ireland, THE BANSHEES OF INISHERIN follows lifelong friends Pádraic and Colm, who find themselves at an impasse when Colm unexpectedly puts an end to their friendship. A stunned Pádraic, aided by his sister Siobhán and troubled young islander Dominic, endeavours to repair the relationship, refusing to take no for an answer. But Pádraic's repeated efforts only strengthen his former friend’s resolve and when Colm delivers a desperate ultimatum, events swiftly escalate, with shocking consequences.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Language Throughout|Brief Graphic Nudity|Some Violent Content)
characteristics.Producer:: Graham Broadbent, Peter Czernin, Martin McDonagh

reviews.name: Juan José Beteta
reviews.message: We're beholding a totally gratuitous drama, driven by inexplicable motives. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: CJ Sheu
reviews.message: The real instigator isn’t whimsy, but an encroaching modernity and its sense of linear history.

reviews.name: James Kendrick
reviews.message: a delicate balancing act, and McDonagh pulls it off with astonishing grace, punctuating the film’s humanity with heavy doses of ambiguity that keep you thinking and wrestling with the characters long after the credits have rolled

reviews.name: Milana Vujkov
reviews.message: Captures the fragile state of being a human in one grand swoop of wit and weltschmerz — the film’s contours elegantly morose, its humour dark and bitter-sweet, its inhabitants erratic and gloriously eloquent, its landscape a mystery onto itself.

reviews.name: A.S. Hamrah
reviews.message: Keoghan, one of the strangest actors working today, jerks his performances wildly between “this guy is the greatest actor I have ever seen” and “this kid is getting a little too weird.”

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: There’s no shortage of meaning or metaphor in this robust tale featuring the year’s best ensemble cast.

reviews.name: Stephen A. Russell
reviews.message: The rat-a-tat of rifles and thunderous clatter of cannons are but a momentary distraction, piercing the peaceful quiet of the fictional Island on which he lives in playwright and filmmaker Martin McDonagh’s dark parable The Banshees of Inisherin.

reviews.name: Diana Cheng
reviews.message: The juxtaposition of mellow, ponderous music with outward conflicts always makes interesting contrasts, just like mixing comedy with drama, humour and sadness, which McDonagh is so apt in doing.

reviews.name: Paul Thompson
reviews.message: The Banshees of Inisherin is a movie about men—their stupidity, their ambitions, and their inability to communicate—but Kerry Condon is the secret to the film’s success.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: It has some notable performances by the cast that offer, in a hidden way, readings about the absurdity that divides the ties of a nation, but many times its tragicomedy becomes dull and loses the desired dramatic wellness. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Capturing unstable humanity, along with black comedy and the brevity of life changing our decisions daily, within a motion picture isn’t easy work, but McDonagh strikes a nice balance of moods and tones.

reviews.name: Víctor López G.
reviews.message: 115 minutes that, more than a movie, shape a state of mind. One that, little by little, gets under your skin by force of sadness, a shady sense of humor and that kind of existentialism capable of breaking the spirit of the most optimistic human being.

reviews.name: Akhil Arora
reviews.message: Martin McDonagh paints a devastating portrait of men in general. The stupid in-fighting, the self-sabotage, and the endless quarrelling — instead of spending their lives doing something valuable for themselves and those around them.

reviews.name: Hugo Hernández Valdivia
reviews.message: The film has its charm because the director imprints valuable doses of humor. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Matt Neal
reviews.message: The most amazing thing about it is the fact it explores such huge ideas as the meaning of life, while simultaneously looking at the micro-aggressions of two stupid men with no capacity to deal with their own emotions.

reviews.name: Mike Scott
reviews.message: Writer-director Martin McDonagh’s brilliantly crafted film offers a master’s class in pacing, with each successive scene building on the previous one until it has grown from a small, sweet Irish tale into a pitch-black, gut-punch of a tragicomedy.

reviews.name: Brian Susbielles
reviews.message: McDonough cultivates within his dark comedic mind an original Irish fable rooted in James Joyce and W.B. Yeats.

reviews.name: John Lumsden
reviews.message: Witty dialogue tempers the cynical take on the human condition in The Banshees of Inisherin, which promises more black comedy from filmmaker Martin McDonagh.

reviews.name: Elaine Cho
reviews.message: The film's decision to loop in the actual events of the Irish Civil War to parallel Pádraic and Colm’s feud feels a bit clumsy.

reviews.name: Bruce Swansey
reviews.message: Realism coexists with artifice. It's a heartbreaking world, but hilarious. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Juan Jose Cruz
reviews.message: A memorable and audacious tale of self-destruction and how disturbing human relationships can be. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Randy Meeks
reviews.message: In a state of utter solitude, depression, and coldness, the real search is for a feeling, any feeling, in whatever form it comes. It isn't hard to understand these two protagonists... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Carlos Bonfil
reviews.message: ... A unique story about a wounded friendship and the disastrous consequences of an absurd disagreement. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Pablo Villaça
reviews.message: Martin McDonagh's humor resides in the wounds of his characters, who, suffering from inflamed emotional wounds, know how to aim precisely at the weak spots of those they want to hurt. [Full review in Portuguese]

reviews.name: Carlos Boyero
reviews.message: ... A tedious nonsense.

reviews.name: Gabi Zietsman
reviews.message: The Banshees of Inisherin is not the kind of comedy that will make you smile, but rather one where laughter quickly turns into tears at the absurd fragility of human relationships.

reviews.name: Luis Martínez
reviews.message: There is no other choice but to surrender. And laugh. If only for the sake of not despairing. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Fausto Fernandez
reviews.message: ... An everyday pursuit that doesn't fail to be the eternal quest to comprehend the meaning of our existence. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Pablo De Vita
reviews.message: ... The rawness with which McDonagh delivers his reflection on the cycle of life makes The Banshees of Inisherin an ingenious and melancholic parable about disenchantment. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Pablo O. Scholz
reviews.message: As with all good movies, this one has various layers. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Brian Gill
reviews.message: McDonagh is, for my money, the best writer in the business. Farrell and Gleeson are the perfect vessels for his unique brand of dark, heartbreaking, hilarity. A near perfect movie.

reviews.name: Steve Murray
reviews.message: An agonizingly slow watch, but it’s worth your patience mainly for the acting...

reviews.name: Santanu Das
reviews.message: The scenes with his pet donkey Jenny alone will stop you in the tracks.

reviews.name: Ayelet Dekel
reviews.message: a film that is grounded in profoundly powerful performances, and a script so clever and funny that I laughed out loud time and again, all the while fascinated, horrified, and deeply moved.

reviews.name: Nando Salvá
reviews.message: It offers the best catalog possible from its director's virtues. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Morgan Rojas
reviews.message: The tonal bait and switch from dark comedy to introspective, sensitive drama is what makes The Banshees of Inisherin among the year's best.

reviews.name: Sarah Ward
reviews.message: Simply watching Farrell's eyebrows as Pádraic faces his changing circumstances is entertaining, emotional and evocative; the depths and shades he can relay with a twitch, many actors can't muster with their entire bodies.

reviews.name: John Lui
reviews.message: McDonagh’s sparkling dialogue, with pathos and comedy infused into every line, is delightful as always. Farrell, Gleeson, Keoghan and Condon make the poetry feel like natural speech.

reviews.name: Cole Smithey
reviews.message:
Confucius comes into play. "If you seek revenge dig two graves, one for yourself."
Hala-feckin-luya.

reviews.name: Michael Ward
reviews.message: ...a stark reminder of how ego, pride, and an incessant need for control can consume anyone.  A film powerfully written and brilliantly constructed by Martin McDonagh.

title: Donnie Darko
description: In a funny, moving and distinctly mind-bending journey through suburban America, one extraordinary but disenchanted teenager is about to take Time's Arrow for a ride. After surviving a freak accident, Donnie (Jake Gyllenhaal) begins to explore what it means to be alive, and in short order to be in love, he uncovers secrets of the universe that give him a tempting power to alter time and destiny.

characteristics.Producer:: Sean McKittrick, Nancy Juvonen
characteristics.Production Co:: Gaylord Films, Pandora Cinema, Adam Fields Productions, Flower Films
characteristics.Sound Mix:: Dolby Digital, Surround, Dolby A, Dolby Stereo, Dolby SR

reviews.name: Erick Estrada
reviews.message: One of the best homages to Back to the Future. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Stephen Silver
reviews.message: Rewatching it now it's shocking how much it anticipated about life today. (20th anniversary)

reviews.name: Rafael Paz
reviews.message: Kelly adds to this central theme another of the topics that is constantly manifested throughout his work: the possibilities of the divine and the guilt of knowing those designs while we are alive.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: Every ounce of creativity is met with an equal serving of disappointing nebulousness.

reviews.name: Erik Anderson
reviews.message: It's a dense, complicated and amazing amalgam of genres and influences that really defies any constraints.

reviews.name: Rachel Wagner
reviews.message: I certainly didn't have an emotional bond with the film. Still, I admire the risk taking and what it has to say about mental illness.

reviews.name: PJ Nabarro
reviews.message: It's ultimately the piece's surprisingly sincere, compassionate edge which transmits the most.

reviews.name: Sean Axmaker
reviews.message: [Richard] Kelly winds so many ideas, so many questions, and so much marvelously strange experience through this ambitious film that you can forgive the few loose ends and overdone caricatures amidst the richness.

reviews.name: Ray Pride
reviews.message: The theatrical version is some kind of compacted masterpiece, hormonal, vital, dazed, blissfully unhinged... I'm too attached to Donnie Darko to worry over its wanton weirdness, its mix of concreteness and intangibility.

reviews.name: Kyle Aaronson
reviews.message: It remains an aesthetically filmed blend of off-beat comedy, mind-boggling sci-fi, and subjective storytelling that serves as a singular and timeless piece of cinema.

reviews.name: Tara Brady
reviews.message: Donnie Darko rightly made a star of Gyllenhaal.

reviews.name: Simon Kinnear
reviews.message: Gyllenhaal's breakthrough performance is simultaneously heartfelt, melancholy and mischievous.

reviews.name: Jamie Dunn
reviews.message: As pop as it is arthouse, as funny as it is tragic, Donnie Darko remains a remarkable one-off that's easy to adore.

reviews.name: Anton Bitel
reviews.message: Complex, inventive, gripping, strange, and in the end deeply moving, with more ideas in it than Hollywood has produced in the entire last decade.

reviews.name: R.L. Shaffer
reviews.message: An incredibly fascinating, star-making film that never fails to intrigue.

reviews.name: James Plath
reviews.message: Donnie Darko is a bit like a teenager: brooding, complex, rebellious, and difficult to comprehend.

reviews.name: Nick Schager
reviews.message: Defines itself through sustained mood, otherworldly intrigue and deep, abiding humanism.

reviews.name: Jason Best
reviews.message: A decidedly weird time-travel drama that puzzled viewers so much that many went back to see it again and again... Unfortunately, Kelly's extended version diminishes the film's impact.

reviews.name: Nick Rogers
reviews.message: Maybe Richard Kelly's fate is to be the cult-film circuit's Michael Cimino. He has yet to match the mood or magnitude of his debut - a collision of time-travel sci-fi, commentary on '80s malaise and teen angst that's simultaneously witty and poignant.

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: A brilliant and truly incredible piece of art that deserves to be watched...

reviews.name: Nick Davis
reviews.message: The film...asks the question: what if the universe as we live it, not just as we theorize it, really isn't as we imagine it? In making the mundane as bottomless as the cosmic, Donnie Darko has the guts to remain a riddle itself.

reviews.name: Rob Gonsalves
reviews.message: The drowsy surrealism and elaborate inconclusiveness of "Donnie Darko" will simultaneously guarantee it a rabid cult and put it way off limits to the don't-get-its.

reviews.name: Moira Sullivan
reviews.message: The directors cut of Donnie Darko by Richard Kelly was screened at the Venice Film Festivals a couple of years ago, a film I missed for sure when it was released in 2001 and one of those pearls like Blade Runner that just is haunting screening after scree

reviews.name: Lisa Alspector
reviews.message: Kelly is a supple and courageous storyteller, boldly free-associating as he mixes parody and satire with earnest psychodrama and coming up with plot points no one could anticipate.

reviews.name: Todd McCarthy
reviews.message: Donnie Darko has plenty of problems. But most stem from a young filmmaker overswinging on his first time up to the plate and hitting a deep fly out rather than a home run.

reviews.name: Beth Accomando
reviews.message: Kelly captures, better than any film in recent memory other than Election, what it feels like to be in high school.

reviews.name: Emanuel Levy
reviews.message: In its metaphysical concerns and challenging notions about personal and social responsibility, the film aims much higher than most American youth pictures.

reviews.name: Mark Bourne
reviews.message: Donnie Darko's flaws, though, are those of a young, talented filmmaker reaching beyond his current grasp. That's a more forgivable sin than soulless excess or hubris-fueled incompetence.

reviews.name: Chris Gore
reviews.message: You either love it or hate it. For those who loved it, I have only one word: overrated.c

reviews.name: Rumsey Taylor
reviews.message: A faithfully rendered head trip.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Overstreet
reviews.message: One of the most remarkable films of 2001, and it deserves a much larger audience than it has so far gained.

reviews.name: Jeffrey M. Anderson
reviews.message: Donnie Darko ranks among Gattaca, Pi and Dark City for pure imagination -- and surpasses them for astonishing execution.

reviews.name: Todd Gilchrist
reviews.message: The original was a movie for all those castaways who believe in unexplained phenomenon; the new version reads like a handbook on how to pick up women.

reviews.name: Brett Buckalew
reviews.message: The big screen, in any shape or form, is the ideal way to experience Donnie Darko, and so a re-release like this is a rare and welcome gift.

reviews.name: Martin Scribbs
reviews.message: Donnie Darko swings for the fences, and it goes yard.

reviews.name: Thomas Delapa
reviews.message: If the sum total of Donnie Darko is hard to figure, there's no questioning that its separate scenes add up to breathtaking filmmaking.

reviews.name: Rob Nelson
reviews.message: The [film's] pointedly bipolar tone might have been modeled on the wild mood swings of the Cure's adolescent-apocalypse epic Kiss Me, Kiss Me, Kiss Me from the white-hot summer of '87.

reviews.name: Jon Popick
reviews.message: If you believe Buffy the Vampire Slayer's Anya, there's something very malevolent about bunnies.

title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
description: Dr. Indiana Jones, a renowned archeologist and expert in the occult, is hired by the U.S. Government to find the ark of the covenant, which is believed to still hold the Ten Commandments. Unfortunately, Hitler's agents are also after the ark. Indy and his ex-flame Marion escape from various close scrapes in a quest that takes them from Nepal to Cairo.

characteristics.Producer:: Frank Marshall
characteristics.Writer:: Lawrence Kasdan, George Lucas, Philip Kaufman
characteristics.Sound Mix:: Dolby Stereo, Magnetic Stereo 6 Track, Surround

reviews.name: Vincent Canby
reviews.message: To get to the point immediately, Raiders of the Lost Ark is one of the most deliriously funny, ingenious and stylish American adventure movies ever made.

reviews.name: Roger Ebert
reviews.message: [Raiders of the Lost Ark] grabs you in the first shot, hurtles you through a series of incredible adventures, and deposits you back in reality two hours later -- breathless, dizzy, wrung-out, and with a silly grin on your face.

reviews.name: John Brosnan
reviews.message: A glorious mixture of spectacular, fast-paced action and sly humor.

reviews.name: Sheila Benson
reviews.message: There was the almost exhausting excitement of the film itself. And at the same time a second emotion, a rush of gratitude which almost brought tears for the contagious joy and -- not to be corny about this -- the strength of the film's positive vision.

reviews.name: Eleanor Ringel Cater
reviews.message: Raiders is the most fun to hit the screen since movies came in chapters. Reportedly, there are further adventures of Indiana Jones in the works. Let's hope so. Something this good deserves To Be Continued.

reviews.name: Patrick Taggart
reviews.message: It is, in short, a reminder of the very reason we go to movies. With its larger-than-life, wide screen images, the rich stereo sound, films such as Raiders of the Lost Ark are what will save the movie theater business from the video invasion.

reviews.name: Gary Arnold
reviews.message: It is a transcendent blend of heroic exploits, cliffhangers and chases distilled with nostalgia and wit from the pulp thrillers, comic books and Republic serials of the World War II era.

reviews.name: Arthur Knight
reviews.message: It's all done with such a great spirit of high adventure and good humor that you don't even begin to count the corpses... The finale suggests that Ford's Indiana Jones character will soon be back with further adventures, and I'm all in favor of it.

reviews.name: Gene Siskel
reviews.message: Yes, it's as entertaining as you have heard. Maybe more so. Raiders of the Lost Ark is, in fact, about as entertaining as a commercial movie can be.

reviews.name: Vern Stefanic
reviews.message: After watching just the first five minutes of Raiders of the Lost Ark, you’re hooked. You’re held captive in a action-packed world of adventure and romance and you can’t turn away because the thrills keep coming faster and faster, bigger and better.

reviews.name: Joe Pollack
reviews.message: Harrison Ford, who was Han Solo in Lucas' Star Wars, plays Jones in a hat and a generally unshaven condition that makes him look a great deal like the late Humphrey Bogart in Casablanca.

reviews.name: Terry Orme
reviews.message: To say the Raiders of the Lost Ark is action-packed is to understate the case. There is hardly a scene that does not take your breath away.

reviews.name: Jack Garner
reviews.message: Raiders is as snappy as the crack of a whip, as daring as a leap over a snake-infested ravine, as rowdy as a fistfight in a grimy bar in Nepal, and as much fun as you could ever want in a film.

reviews.name: Bruce R. Miller
reviews.message: [Raiders of the Lost Ark] is destined for some kind of popcorn immortality. Rare in this world of one-shot communication, it makes one want to see it again and again. Without question, it's the best film of the summer.

reviews.name: Joseph Gelmis
reviews.message: Raiders of the Lost Ark is a heady mixture of high adventure, street-smart humor and hardboiled romance in the midst of nonstop lethal battles between the forces of -- yes -- good and evil.

reviews.name: Sumner Rand
reviews.message: John Williams, who wrote the atmospheric musical backgrounds for Star Wars and Empire, has succeeded again for Raiders.

reviews.name: Kelly Scott
reviews.message: The moviegoing majority those of us who, for two hours at least, want to live and die with the characters up there on the screen can leave the theater satisfied with the special kind of escapist fun that people want from summer movies.

reviews.name: Joe Baltake
reviews.message: A terrific amount of novelty and gut-busting hard work might have gone into Raiders of the Lost Ark, for example, but much of it is cold and mechanical.

reviews.name: Desmond Ryan
reviews.message: ...Pretends to be nothing more than sheer entertainment, and it delivers with a voltage that keeps the movie crackling with tension. It is not what one would call an actor's movie, but both Ford and Allen make the most of what they are given to work with.

reviews.name: George Anderson
reviews.message: Only true children of the movies, like Lucas and Spielberg, could have brought such zest and conviction to Raiders of the Lost Ark. But the wide-eyed kid in all of us can thrill to their work.

reviews.name: Malcolm Johnson
reviews.message: Incredibly enough, "Raiders" packs more fun and excitement onto the screen than either [Jaws or Star Wars].

reviews.name: Terry Kelleher
reviews.message: Given the state of the motion-picture industry, perhaps Raiders of the Lost Ark is the most we can hope for this summer, or this year: well-made escapism, dripping with opulence.

reviews.name: Wayne Harada
reviews.message: "Raiders" is masterful in its peak-and-valley pacing, with exposition crisply placed within action. It is, without question, the year's most satisfying entertainment.

reviews.name: Burl Burlingame
reviews.message: Raiders of the Lost Ark has the texture of a film bursting with influences, and Lucas and Spielberg have managed to get them in without strain.

reviews.name: Elston Brooks
reviews.message: In the main, it's not acting or acting direction that makes "Raiders" such a fascinating attraction. It's action and action direction. It never abates.

reviews.name: Jack Mathews
reviews.message: The most exhilarating movie entertainment since Star Wars. I'd go back even father than that, but I don't want to sound crazy. I'll just say that if they were trading cards, I wouldn't take two Star Wars and a Superman for one "Raiders."

reviews.name: Bruce Bailey
reviews.message: This movie should make major heartthrobs out of Harrison Ford and Karen Allen. The electricity generated between [them] is reminiscent of the current that used to jump between Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall.

reviews.name: Noel Taylor
reviews.message: What Lucas has done, by creating the altogether splendid character of Indiana Jones, adventure-archeologist, is to provide us with a reminder of what the old Saturday morning adventure serials were all about.

reviews.name: Geraldine Brooks
reviews.message: Raiders of the Lost Ark is fizzy and decadent like a glass of lemonade; good, home-made lemonade with only the best ingredients, but lemonade nonetheless. It isn't trying to pass itself off as vitamin-fortified vegetable juice. This honesty is refreshing.

reviews.name: Neil Jillett
reviews.message: As Indiana Jones, Harrison Ford performs with a nice balance of exuberance and calculation, seriousness and tongue-in-cheek. He assumes a deadpan that doesn't quite mask lively intelligence. He never loses his head, or the snapped-brim hat that crowns it.

reviews.name: John Lapsley
reviews.message: What really lifts Raiders of the Lost Ark to the level of escapist entertainment it attains is the sheer film-craft of its producer and director.  The result is something one might describe as "new-improved nostalgia."

reviews.name: Alexander Walker
reviews.message: To tell the truth, there is so much that it might grow a little wearisome were it not for the playful complicity it cunningly establishes with us filmgoers.

reviews.name: JoAnn Rhetts
reviews.message: Without the tempo and the contrasting characters, about two hours of continual hanging from cliffs in "Raiders" leaves you with sore arms.

reviews.name: Lawrence O'Toole
reviews.message: It sends your mind on vacation, allowing you to submit without a care to the sensual. That sensuality, surrounding its audience in a way that the visual and aural puniness of TV never can, is as big and busy as the circus, and as grand as opera.

reviews.name: Eric Shorter
reviews.message: It lacks unity of aim, time, place and action. Worst of all, it lacks thrills... And to think that Mr. Spielberg was once rated as a director of talent. Sad, really.

reviews.name: Tim Pulleine
reviews.message: The casual plotting that might have passed muster in the ramshackle context of an old Republic serial just won't support a two-hour super-production, and the disproportion between means and ends becomes increasingly tiresome and ultimately exasperating.

reviews.name: Richard Freedman
reviews.message: Raiders is not merely an accurate updating of those Saturday afternoon serials about archaeological derring-do in the lost cities of the world. Without ever descending to mere camp, it's also a genuinely witty tribute to a more innocent age of moviegoing.

reviews.name: Terry Lawson
reviews.message: Raiders of the Lost Ark, you see, is the real lalapalooza, a slam-bang, rock-'em-sock-'em adventure film that's as smart and witty as it is comic-book thrilling and exciting.

reviews.name: Bernard Drew
reviews.message: Spielberg has directed it all brilliantly, finding his own way to tell a 1930s story in 1981's visual language. To my mind, It's the best movie he has ever made.

reviews.name: Kenneth Turan
reviews.message: [Ford's] is the most pleasing kind of hero, simultaneously wised up and aw shucks, someone who treats the whole picture as a sly joke he is sharing with the audience... This feeling of freshness is the one thing Raiders could use a bit more of.

title: Come Out Fighting
description: Set during WWII, in this military adventure, a small, specialized squad of U.S. Army African American soldiers are sent on an unofficial rescue mission behind enemy lines to locate their missing commanding officer. The squad upon battling their way through the German defenses encounter more than they bargain for when they locate a downed U.S. Army fighter pilot. With the help of their friends at the 761st tank battalion, known as "The Black Panthers," the squad must find a way to survive and make it back in one piece.

characteristics.Producer:: Dean Bloxom, Andre Relis, Steven Luke
characteristics.Production Co:: Redbox Automated Retail, Lionsgate, Schuetzle Company Productions, VMI Worldwide

reviews.name: Hope Madden
reviews.message: It's too bad because the cast and director should have worked better together.

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: A script filled with cliches.

reviews.name: Mike McGranaghan
reviews.message: A movie about the contribution of African-Americans in WWII could be both important and stirring. Come Out Fighting is neither.

reviews.name: Julian Roman
reviews.message: Come Out Fighting has good intentions but struggles to be rousing and cinematic. Moments of genuine camaraderie are muddied by low-budget visual effects, questionable editing, and poorly defined, generic Nazi antagonists.

reviews.name: Calum Marsh
reviews.message: [Luke's] writing is thin and tends regularly toward platitudes, with characters spouting wisdom like “the cards have to fall where they fall.”

reviews.name: Brian Orndorf
reviews.message: It’s not all disappointing, as the feature shows some signs of life, but there’s a better, more stirring effort to be made about the subject.

title: Fifty Shades of Grey
description: When college senior Anastasia Steele (Dakota Johnson) steps in for her sick roommate to interview prominent businessman Christian Grey (Jamie Dornan) for their campus paper, little does she realize the path her life will take. Christian, as enigmatic as he is rich and powerful, finds himself strangely drawn to Ana, and she to him. Though sexually inexperienced, Ana plunges headlong into an affair -- and learns that Christian's true sexual proclivities push the boundaries of pain and pleasure.

characteristics.Rating:: R (Language|Graphic Nudity|Sexual Dialogue|Some Unusual Behavior|Strong Sexual Content)
characteristics.Producer:: Michael De Luca, E.L. James, Dana Brunetti

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: Here's a film that is offensive only in how inoffensive it proves to be.

reviews.name: Richard Crouse
reviews.message: Feels like an elegantly made - the cinematography and score are top notch - night time soap opera.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: At least, the film goes out of the way to show the use of condoms.

reviews.name: Richard Propes
reviews.message: If this is love, no thanks.

reviews.name: Allen Almachar
reviews.message: In terms of story and character, this film is in desperate need of a safe word.

reviews.name: Dan Scully
reviews.message: Overlong, too clinical in design, and based on lowest common denominator entertainment (or so I'm told), Fifty Shades of Grey still manages to be engaging, funny, and unexpectedly human.

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: Given that this is her second film, [Sam] Taylor-Johnson directs the film with taste and care by focusing on the interactions between Ana and Christian rather than the sexual side of the story and the film looks stunning.

reviews.name: Brandon Davis
reviews.message: Fifty Shades of Grey will draw you in out of curiosity and possibly hopes of a good movie, then leave you wondering why you agreed to such a thing in the first place, much like the main character.

reviews.name: Nicholas Bell
reviews.message: Funny that no one seemed to understand in the making of Grey that watching two vaguely defined characters engage in ceaseless rounds of conservatively filmed grimaces and stifled moans gets tiresome quickly.

reviews.name: Leslie Combemale
reviews.message: There is little more critical than to say a third of the film had people laughing at dialogue, and the other two thirds wiggling in their seats, not from discomfort or innervation, but from boredom.

reviews.name: David Brake
reviews.message: You've seen worse; you've imagined better.

reviews.name: Helen Razer
reviews.message: Nice as it looks, this movie tastes bad...

reviews.name: Beth McDonough
reviews.message: Most of the actual sex has less erotic value than what can be found on late night HBO, and it certainly doesn't hold a candle to the graphic content of the novels or the erotic-charged hype surrounding the film.

reviews.name: Julie Crawford
reviews.message: You would've put the book down after reading the character's name on the third page: Anastasia Steele? Puh-lease!

reviews.name: Ed Frankl
reviews.message: [General audiences] might need to be handcuffed to their seats and wonder how something so wildly popular could be so stiflingly unerotic.

reviews.name: Amanda Greever
reviews.message: Every fiber of my being is screaming at her to send this man packing.

reviews.name: Sarah Cartland
reviews.message: The dialogue is terrible and Dornan's Grey is so humourless that any vaguely funny lines fall utterly flat. On the plus side Johnson does her best with what she's been given, Ana is a Thomas Hardy fan, and Grey has a nice kitchen.

reviews.name: Lisa Johnson Mandell
reviews.message: The entire palate of the film was cool and gray, which doesn't do much to incite passion. and I don't think we should blame the actors.

reviews.name: Rubén Rosario
reviews.message: Fifty Shades of Grey is that hot date you bring home to discover (s)he's a cold fish between the sheets.

reviews.name: Rosalynn Try-Hane
reviews.message: This is worth going to the cinema for, leave your expectations behind and relax and enjoy a visually beautiful film.

reviews.name: Pamela Powell
reviews.message: Sometimes a book should just remain a book and in the case of "Fifty Shades of Grey" that is exactly the case.

reviews.name: Oggs Cruz
reviews.message: [Fifty Shades of Grey] simply never gets anything right.

reviews.name: Megan Basham
reviews.message: Among the many mind-bogglingly implausible fantasies Fifty Shades of Grey sells, the one I think that most accounts for its popularity is the promise that shame of sexual sin can be alleviated by surrendering to it more fully.

reviews.name: Sebastian Zavala Kahn
reviews.message: I'm really worried about the fact that some people (especially girls) regard Mr. Grey as an object of desire, as some sort of ideal man. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Kiko Martinez
reviews.message: The second half of the film devolves into something that resembles tedious, melodramatic daytime TV.

reviews.name: Daniel Krauze
reviews.message: Grey is not a character, but a cluster of clichés... [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Uri Klein
reviews.message: It's superficial, it's manipulative, it's off-putting and embarrassing. But there's no denying that this says something about the moment in which the book was published and the movie released.

reviews.name: Robert Kojder
reviews.message: The script is abysmally bad, filled with Shakespearean dialogue such as "I won't touch you until I have your written consent", and "I don't make love, I f***... HARD"

reviews.name: Fico Cangiano
reviews.message: Dakota Johnson shines in this clunky, boring and domesticated sex ruse. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: John Lui
reviews.message: There is an awful lot of rose-tinted nostalgia here for a time when women sat passively while powerful men threw wealth at them, but the interesting difference here is that the power dynamic between Red Riding Hood and the Wolf shifts.

reviews.name: Matthew Bond
reviews.message: Shortage of exotic shenanigans apart, artist-turned-director Sam Taylor-Johnson has delivered a decently acted and technically well-made adaptation of what remains a fundamentally silly and, at times, simply rather unpleasant story.

reviews.name: Sarah Marrs
reviews.message: I've seen way worse movies aimed at men and boys, so I think everyone can chill out about a mediocre movie aimed at women.

reviews.name: Jason Francis Johnson
reviews.message: It may not be your conventional Valentine's Day date movie, but it looks set to give audiences more pleasure than pain.

reviews.name: Brooke Corso
reviews.message: The retention of the style of the book and its settings merges with a cinematic story more focused on buildup than execution.

reviews.name: Alex Heeney
reviews.message: The film's a hell of a ride, often a fun and thought-provoking one, even though it's all such camp.

reviews.name: Sr. Rose Pacatte
reviews.message: In the run-up to [Fifty Shades of Grey]'s opening, I was surprised at the promotional efforts of NBC's "Today" show in the daily banter of the hosts and beyond.

reviews.name: Carolyn Cox
reviews.message: Fifty Shades of Grey is so much smarter than its source material, but smarter in this case doesn't mean better. Not where it counts, at least.

reviews.name: Eleanor Ringel Cater
reviews.message: Alas, I was a reluctant Dominant because the movie itself is such a mousey, uninvolving little thing that somebody had to step up.

reviews.name: Jan Moir
reviews.message: The most anticipated release of the year is not much more than a spanking great bore.

reviews.name: John Powers
reviews.message: Then the lights went down, and guess what? Fifty Shades of Grey turned out to be not just entertaining-at least until the clunky, exasperating final minute-but it also knows exactly what it's doing.

title: Queenmaker: The Making of an It Girl
description: In the height of heiress-era NYC, an anonymous blogger infiltrated Manhattan's elite, bringing socialite celebrities to new heights; when the website's creator was unmasked, the mastermind was not who anybody expected.

reviews.name: Ty Burr
reviews.message: What has been a glitzy documentary about glitz becomes something far more resonant, profoundly sad, and, in the end, weirdly uplifting.

reviews.name: Chris Vognar
reviews.message: Rose’s story and its past connection to the celebrity world of status and image open up a world of ideas regarding identity -- its symbolism, its fluidity, and its very meaning.

reviews.name: Radhika Menon
reviews.message: The documentary tries to tell too many stories and ends up not telling any of them completely.

reviews.name: Coleman Spilde
reviews.message: Though certainly disappointing, the film is still a uniquely mystifying look at a bygone era that will satisfy those who were steeped in its libelous thrills.

reviews.name: Glenn Kenny
reviews.message: The sleight of hand Drucker uses... delivers its particulars with a wallop. And the finale is as compassionate as it is sad and unnerving.

reviews.name: Noel Murray
reviews.message: There’s a strong point of view here, as Drucker scrutinizes an era that established a lot of the codes and aspirations of our own influencer-saturated times.

title: Broadway
description: Nelly has escaped from her wealthy and controlling family. As she dances in a strip club, she meets Markos, a small yet charismatic gangster, who helps her run away from her stepfather's henchmen. Markos soon becomes her protector and lover. He brings her into Broadway, Athens, an abandoned entertainment complex squatted by a small community of dancers, tramps, thieves and a captive monkey. For a while, everything goes well, even when Broadway hosts a mysterious man, injured and covered with bandages, wanted dead by Athens' most dangerous mafia. However, when Markos gets arrested and imprisoned, the newcomer will take an unexpectedly important place in the gang.

characteristics.Producer:: Bertrand Gore, Amanda Livanou
characteristics.Production Co:: Neda Film, Digital Cube, Blue Monday Productions

reviews.name: Dennis Schwartz
reviews.message: An uneven crime drama.

reviews.name: John Paul King
reviews.message: An ambitiously sweeping narrative that feels like equal parts film noir and Charles Dickens as it takes us into a colorful and morally ambiguous underworld...

reviews.name: Rich Cline
reviews.message: While the setting ripples with knowing details, the storytelling is awkward and elusive. And the film is never as transgressive as it pretends to be.

reviews.name: Avi Offer
reviews.message: Audacious and unconventional, but ultimately underwhelming and less than the sum of its many parts.

reviews.name: Kelli Weston
reviews.message: Amid some uneven characterizations, the cast enlivens “Broadway” with their compelling performances, sealed by a stirring finale and a characteristically soaring score from Gabriel Yared.

reviews.name: Gary M. Kramer
reviews.message: Broadway is entertaining when Massalas keeps the characters and the viewers guessing, but things get predictable once the story begins in earnest.... While the plotting is disappointing, the film looks great.

reviews.name: Dennis Harvey
reviews.message: An urban fantasia in the cult-cinema mode of Diva, Wings of Desire...

reviews.name: Roger Moore
reviews.message: Solidly suspenseful Greek film noir set among Athen pickpockets, men and a pole dancer laying low by night, putting on “shows” to distract their marks during the day...

title: Aladdin
description: Aladdin is a lovable street urchin who meets Princess Jasmine, the beautiful daughter of the sultan of Agrabah. While visiting her exotic palace, Aladdin stumbles upon a magic oil lamp that unleashes a powerful, wisecracking, larger-than-life genie. As Aladdin and the genie start to become friends, they must soon embark on a dangerous mission to stop the evil sorcerer Jafar from overthrowing young Jasmine's kingdom.

characteristics.Genre:: Kids & family, Musical, Comedy, Fantasy, Adventure, Romance
characteristics.Producer:: Dan Lin, Jonathan Eirich

reviews.name: Kate Boyle
reviews.message: Overall, a decent attempt at remaking a treasured animated classic.

reviews.name: Swara Salih
reviews.message: Aladdin works when it focuses on its characters. The world it builds is nice and lavish but without authentic depth. That combined with the lack of wonder and mystery keeps this from being as revolutionary as it would have liked to be.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: …every element here is a pitiful downgrade on the original…

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: While Smith and Massoud do display some buddy chemistry, it’s Naomi Scott’s fierce performance as Jasmine that’s the real showstopper.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: The characters of Ritchie's film feel like they're trying to replicate better performances than they could ever hope to achieve.

reviews.name: David Gonzalez
reviews.message: Aladdin does not try to reinvent the wheel, but it made sure it didnt break it. The film is a welcomed addition to the Disney live-action library.

reviews.name: Lonita Cook
reviews.message: Let me tell you: Will Smith is back.

reviews.name: Hosea Rupprecht
reviews.message: Aladdin is as fun as a magic carpet ride, so sit back and enjoy the unbelievable sights and indescribable feeling...

reviews.name: Michael J. Casey
reviews.message: A movie loaded with missed opportunities.

reviews.name: Alex Bentley
reviews.message: It's unlikely that the new Aladdin will be the cultural touchstone that the original was, but it has plenty of memorable moments that complement well the iconic ones many of us hold near and dear.

reviews.name: Jesse Hassenger
reviews.message: Still, as cynical and pointless an operation as this remake cycle has often been, Aladdin is a bit livelier than the equivalent Beauty and the Beast.

reviews.name: Richard Crouse
reviews.message: Despite the updates and the pomp Aladdin feels underwhelming by the time the end credits roll. The songs frequently interrupt the flow of the story, creating a stop-and-go feel that sucks some of the film's momentum away.

reviews.name: Candice McMillan
reviews.message: When the sand settles, Aladdin is more fun than needs fixing.

reviews.name: Joey Morona
reviews.message: The movie addresses the problematic aspects of the original to make it more modern and relatable.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: A fully computer-animated Abu is the first of many changes that furnish a hint of phoniness in a world that now demands a greater suspension of disbelief.

reviews.name: Charles Koplinski
reviews.message: Visually, this is a stunning feat along with incredible action stunts and choreography.

reviews.name: Andrew Gaudion
reviews.message: Aladdin is much like its protagonist; flawed, a little clumsy, but ultimately quite winning; a diamond in the rough.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: It is nonsense that tests my patience quota for two eternally boring hours. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: A nostalgic magic carpet ride that might not be "a whole new world" of original filmmaking, but is a welcome familiar world after the depressing downer "Dumbo" (2019).

reviews.name: Zehra Phelan
reviews.message: Ritchie leaves behind his trademark slow downed style of editing in favour of some questionable speeded up dance sequences which look cheap and badly edited in the flamboyancy of imagination clearly taken from Bollywood.

reviews.name: Allen Almachar
reviews.message: The production was so focused on making us remember the past that it did little to make the present memorable.

reviews.name: Nabila Hatimy
reviews.message: This is one film that we would watch for the sake of it but come out of the theatre wishing for the good ol' days.

reviews.name: Nikki Francisco
reviews.message: Sure, it's almost exactly like the animated version, but they gave Jasmine the feminist edge that was sorely lacking in the cartoon.

reviews.name: Damond Fudge
reviews.message: This live-action version of the Disney animated classic does a very good job capturing most of what made the original magical ... while expanding on the story and the characters.

reviews.name: Charlotte Harrison
reviews.message: Will Smith puts a fun spin on proceedings. He brings his "A" game, which we haven't seen in some of his recent outings.

reviews.name: Ryan Silberstein
reviews.message: Aladdin shows superior technical craftsmanship in so many aspects of the film, but its failure to reckon with a change of medium, bungling of story, and underwhelming characters, means that it is ultimately unsatisfying.

reviews.name: Julian Lytle
reviews.message: An unimaginative remake that can be entertaining but feels empty and forgettable.

reviews.name: Damian Levy
reviews.message: There's enough here to make the film stand out on its own. Whether it stands out for the right reasons is up to the viewer.

reviews.name: Edward Porter
reviews.message: An unsubtle, fast-moving film with plenty of jokes and a visual style that would suit a themed Las Vegas hotel, it's certainly not an all-time Disney great, but I can see it being a half-term hit.

reviews.name: Nathaniel Rogers
reviews.message: The design is gawdy without the joy of camp. The pacing is manic. The editing is bizarre.

reviews.name: Daniel Barnes
reviews.message: You can never unsee dance sequences directed by Guy Ritchie.

reviews.name: Paul McGuire Grimes
reviews.message: My wish is that this would have been a better movie. The Disney whimsy and magic is lacking in Aladdin.

reviews.name: Katie Smith-Wong
reviews.message: Thankfully, Aladdin is not a shot-for-shot remake, which gives Ritchie room to provide his own unique take. In turn, he incorporates little touches amid clever chase scenes and entertaining dialogue to lift the film.

reviews.name: Jeff York
reviews.message: The film is breathless, while never taking a breath, and when everything is big, brassy, and bold, even a manic genie has trouble standing out.

reviews.name: Mathew DeKinder
reviews.message: "Aladdin" delivers the goods, especially when the music is playing, and while it may not be exactly what you wished for, it's close enough.

reviews.name: Christy Lemire
reviews.message: It's fine... A very straightforward, big spectacle musical.

reviews.name: Rhys Tarling
reviews.message: None of the filmmaking or acting really conveys that wonder of discovery; of falling in love. It's a facsimile of that feeling; a not-so-cheap copy. And, weirdly enough, it inspired in me only a small sense of loneliness.

reviews.name: Sarah Musnicky
reviews.message: Arguably Disney's best live-action adaptation to date.

reviews.name: Felix Vasquez Jr.
reviews.message: Guy Ritchie's remake is mediocre, time filling fodder and that's about the best compliment I can give it.

reviews.name: Kate Rodger
reviews.message: Fun-time singalong - four stars of family entertainment.

title: Ad Astra
description: Thirty years ago, Clifford McBride led a voyage into deep space, but the ship and crew were never heard from again. Now his son -- a fearless astronaut -- must embark on a daring mission to Neptune to uncover the truth about his missing father and a mysterious power surge that threatens the stability of the universe.

characteristics.Producer:: Anthony Katagas, Rodrigo Teixeira, Arnon Milchan, James Gray, Jeremy Kleiner, Dede Gardner, Brad Pitt
characteristics.Production Co:: 20th Century Fox, New Regency Pictures, RT Features, Plan B Entertainment, Bona Film Group, MadRiver Pictures, Keep Your Head

reviews.name: Jeffrey Harris
reviews.message: Ad Astra showcases the struggle of looking into the abyss and explores how Roy’s father succumbed to it, and if Roy will suffer that same fate. This is where Ad Astra finds its strength.

reviews.name: M.N. Miller
reviews.message: Ad Astra is as much about the void we create in our personal lives as it’s about space travel; we are more honest with complete strangers than we are with ourselves and the ones we love.

reviews.name: Keith Garlington
reviews.message: (Gray) dazzles through his audacious uses of light, color and physics. His penetrating close-ups are just as compelling, never losing sight of the human element.

reviews.name: Brian Eggert
reviews.message: Ad Astra is rooted in a human drama that unravels somewhere between Earth and the rings of Neptune, two stations as distant as the storys father and son.

reviews.name: Taylor Baker
reviews.message: Episode 49: Hustlers / Ad Astra / Two Lovers / ALTIPLANO

reviews.name: Lonita Cook
reviews.message: I loved that it really centered on Brad Pitt's character, and his journey... I personally think [Tommy Lee Jones] is a little bit wasted.

reviews.name: Nicholas Oon
reviews.message: While on a quest to discover other intelligent beings in this galaxy, Ad Astra instead tells us that there are still plenty of discoveries to be made in the people around us.

reviews.name: Eddie Harrison
reviews.message: ...the build up is more effective that the take-away, which isn't quite as rich or developed as the quest...

reviews.name: Milana Vujkov
reviews.message: A selfish story about selfishness.

reviews.name: George Fenwick
reviews.message: It's thrilling, adventurous and beautiful to look at, while also provoking deep philosophical and emotional questions in viewers along the way.

reviews.name: Jason Adams
reviews.message: Nary an emotive wince did Ad Astra wring from me with its tale of paternal woes writ interplanetary. Not a tear was jerked -- they all froze in their ducts like ice.

reviews.name: Yasmin Omar
reviews.message: Ad Astra is first-person cinema at its finest: an intimate, insular study of tortured masculinity, pulsating with an air of gentle melancholy that tugs at the heartstrings.

reviews.name: Collier Jennings
reviews.message: Ad Astra is visually stunning as well as emotionally devastating.

reviews.name: Greg Wetherall
reviews.message: A sci-fi masterpiece as thought-provoking as it entertaining.

reviews.name: Tori Brazier
reviews.message: It's worth watching, especially if you enjoy a space film, but it just doesn't quite add up to a perfect cinematic equation.

reviews.name: Alex Bentley
reviews.message: Ad Astra is an extraordinary film that contains a vision for the future that's both appealing and cautionary, as well as a technical wizardry that makes our solar system feel reachable and wondrous at the same time.

reviews.name: Fletcher Powell
reviews.message: It certainly has something to say. I just wish it hadn't said it so very loudly.

reviews.name: Jesse Hassenger
reviews.message: Given the effectiveness of Gray's more genre-y moments ,his insistence on paring his stories down to a kind of quietly masculine anguish feels perverse.

reviews.name: Richard Crouse
reviews.message: Pitt, in a largely non-verbal performance save for copious voiceover, shows his emotions through the cracks, allowing the character to reveal himself in the contemplative but compellingly unsettling way.

reviews.name: Jeffrey Zhang
reviews.message: A powerful meditation on fathers, sons, and masculinity, Ad Astra profoundly deconstructs a traditional character archetype with a deft hand.

reviews.name: Mike Massie
reviews.message: It's awfully cautious and plodding, regularly amplifying the wonder and the mystery, but letting down with its revelations.

reviews.name: Grant Watson
reviews.message: The equivalent of a painter completing their masterpiece by punching a fist through it.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Pitt's wicked combination of movie star allure and acting talent make you buy into this gripping father-son space drama, which marches to the beat of its own drum.

reviews.name: Robert Slack
reviews.message: Ad Astra is more a father son story wrapped up in an existential exercise than it is any traditional sic-fi film.

reviews.name: Matthew St. Clair
reviews.message: A seamless mood piece about loneliness, colonization, and fatherhood and ranks highly among the current onslaught of space movies.

reviews.name: MontiLee Stormer
reviews.message: This should feel like a thrill ride IN SPACE, not like an actual 3-day trip to the moon where you wish the pulmonary embolisms developing in your legs would kill you.

reviews.name: Joanne Laurier
reviews.message: One of the difficulties is that Ad Astra is a space movie with a fundamental lack of interest in what's out there, in the form of intelligent life or otherwise.

reviews.name: Yasser Medina
reviews.message: It seems unusual to me that the narrative of the space odyssey ends with a hopelessly conventional and unsurprising solution. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jason Fraley
reviews.message: There may be alien life out there, but sometimes we have to appreciate the life right in front of us.

reviews.name: Ricardo Gallegos
reviews.message: An introspective, philosophical, and moving film, with ideas that shook me and left me breathless. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: CJ Sheu
reviews.message: This is a deep (though not complex) and emotional film that only achieves full force in a darkened room before a large screen.

reviews.name: Damond Fudge
reviews.message: While it won't be everyone's cup of tea, especially paced as it is, Ad Astra is a true work of science fiction art.

reviews.name: John Serba
reviews.message: It's a suspenseful, extraordinarily well-made action film.

reviews.name: Shikhar Verma
reviews.message: James Gray's Ad Astra is an inwards journey about the necessity to feel things.

reviews.name: Casey Chong
reviews.message: The special effects are seamless while the entire production design on the outer space sequences has a sense of realism and lived-in feel to it.

reviews.name: Shawn Edwards
reviews.message: Brad Pitt is a movie star, and he uses every bit of his star DNA to carry Ad Astra. It's the performance of his career.

reviews.name: Tessa Smith
reviews.message: What could have been a great sci-fi movie was bogged down with dialogue and no real story. It is extremely boring and not worth a watch. Skip this one.

reviews.name: J Hurtado
reviews.message: [T]he best way to experience Ad Astra, is to let it wash over you, allow its masterful use of light and sound to enhance an already incredible piece of writing and a tremendous performance from Pitt.

reviews.name: Matt Cipolla
reviews.message: If anything, it's best to experience Ad Astra without trying to be active in the story. Try too hard to look back and the past will just become a cosmic joke.

reviews.name: Damian Levy
reviews.message: Stunning filmmaking. But a story that is overly dependent on emotional beats that fall flat, knocks it down a few pegs.

title: The Fabelmans
description: Young Sammy Fabelman falls in love with movies after his parents take him to see "The Greatest Show on Earth." Armed with a camera, Sammy starts to make his own films at home, much to the delight of his supportive mother.

characteristics.Rating:: PG-13 (Drug Use|Brief Violence|Some Strong Language|Thematic Elements)
characteristics.Producer:: Kristie Macosko Krieger, Steven Spielberg, Tony Kushner
characteristics.Production Co:: Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Reliance Entertainment, Amblin Partners

reviews.name: Federico Furzan
reviews.message: The Fabelmans is an intimate adventure through the life of Hollywood's most important filmmaker.

reviews.name: Nick Boyd
reviews.message: Overall, the movie provides an effective mix of comedy and drama, and offers a nostalgic glimpse at the Spielberg family,

reviews.name: Elissa Suh
reviews.message: Reichert’s movies are a gently burrowing, though never timid, force.

reviews.name: James Kendrick
reviews.message: a probing family drama that is also suffused with a genuine love of the art of cinema and all its potentials

reviews.name: A.S. Hamrah
reviews.message: These computer guys, Bennie explains to Sammy in The Fabelmans, “they’re gonna change the whole world.” That’s something young Steven absorbed more deeply than Ford’s instructions about where to put the horizon.

reviews.name: Matt Brunson
reviews.message: An origin story that’s both sweet and bittersweet.

reviews.name: Max Copeman
reviews.message: Spielberg tells his story with irresistible brio and a deep undercurrent of melancholy, ensuring that this grounded family tale contains as much wonder as his biggest blockbusters.

reviews.name: Steve Crum
reviews.message: An absorbing, revealing motion picture.

reviews.name: Ross Anthony
reviews.message: As the viewer, you'll feel that intimacy, careful attention to detail, and loving direction. Each character comes to screen with rich unique stories behind them.

reviews.name: Tom Shone
reviews.message: ... The film is a gem — twinkling with innocence but inset with the hard rock of experience.

reviews.name: Symphony Barnes
reviews.message: It’s nice to see a woman in a semi-autobiographical narrative of a male filmmaker who doesn’t appear as just another flat character.

reviews.name: Gabriel Quispe
reviews.message: Spielberg meditates on the impact of the moving image on reality... and the contradictory feelings of the author: not showing the truth breeds remorse, creating convincing fiction brings pride. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Nilton Arana
reviews.message: Beyond romanticizing the filmmaking profession, the film proliferates by sincerely showing the sacrifice and work required to surrender to it. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Michelle Jaworski
reviews.message: It's Steven Spielberg's most personal movie yet.

reviews.name: John McDonald
reviews.message: The Fabelmans is not simply Spielberg’s autobiography, it’s a manifesto on behalf of popular film – a passionate affirmation that movie making is an art, not a hobby (as his father believed), or a product.

reviews.name: Suchin Mehrotra
reviews.message: It’s a simple idea, but a powerful one. That the true magic of the movies isn’t what’s unfolding on the big screen but when you turn the camera around to the looks of awe and wonder on the faces of its audience.

reviews.name: Brian Susbielles
reviews.message: Michelle Williams is certainly a lead performance, and Judd Hirsch’s short appearance gives the entire theme to Sammy’s – and Spielberg’s – home vs family struggles.

reviews.name: Allison Rose
reviews.message: After watching The Fabelmans, one has to wonder what Spielberg’s future would have been like had he grown up with different parents.

reviews.name: Poulomi Das
reviews.message: Despite The Fabelmans' dreamlike quality, there's something singularly bittersweet about how Spielberg approaches his past -- as if simultaneously honouring his upbringing and mourning it.

reviews.name: Jeff Beck
reviews.message: The Fabelmans may be a light, average film that's not particularly memorable, but thanks to an exceptional ensemble and an intriguing story of how a cinematic genius got his start, it becomes well-worth the somewhat lengthy two and a half hour investment.

reviews.name: Gisela Savdie
reviews.message: A true tribute to the seventh art. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Amie Simon
reviews.message: THE FABELMANS is a lovely, human & very relatable story. The additional layer showing you the love of cinema ... from a Director who’s telling you how & when he fell in love with it, and a whose films you also love, is what makes the film truly special.

reviews.name: Nandini Ramnath
reviews.message: It’s personal this time, but in keeping with Spielberg’s cinema, professional too.

reviews.name: Shubhra Gupta
reviews.message: Even though the film is based on Spielberg's life, it manages quite artfully to not feel too artful; it refuses to turn itself into a fable.

reviews.name: Saibal Chatterjee
reviews.message: Michelle Williams, in a role that is as crucial to the film as that of the boy who would be a consummate Hollywood gamechanger, shines the brightest.

reviews.name: Carlos Boyero
reviews.message: The Fabelmans isn't perfect, it has its lows and it doesn't steal your heart away, but it possesses admirable and complex moments. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Jorge Loser
reviews.message: Sammy/Spielberg demonstrates that cinema transforms the quotidian and that it has the power to elevate anything above its own truth. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: David Walsh
reviews.message: Important art does not emerge from being cut off—or holding oneself apart—from broader realities, even if the source of that separation lies outside one’s immediate control, in definite historical and ideological difficulties.

reviews.name: Anupama Chopra
reviews.message: The Fabelmans is a film that shifts something inside you.  Working through one of the most crushing events of his own life, Spielberg exhorts us to discover, yet again, the enduring magic of the movies.

reviews.name: Luis Martínez
reviews.message: Spielberg imagines and idealizes himself into pure pleonasm.  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Randy Meeks
reviews.message: The Fabelmans is one of the most classic and elegant films that has screened in theaters in the past years and as a conversation between the director and his childhood, it couldn't be more stimulating, beautiful, and sad. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Sukanya Verma
reviews.message: Spielberg was born with a camera in his eye. And this one movie, he'd been recording all his life.

reviews.name: Dan Buffa
reviews.message: Spielberg made a nice little fable about his life, but there are zero chances taken and little urgency to the film. LaBelle does his best to inhabit the young man, but the role swallows him up in certain scenes and just leaves him standing idle in others.

reviews.name: Whang Yee Ling
reviews.message: While this fictionalised story of a boy and his camera works well as a series of funny, touching anecdotes about a young artist suffering for his art, an attempt at giving it psychological depth falls flat.

reviews.name: Cian Geoghegan
reviews.message: The Fabelmans is at-once a crowd-pleaser and an art film, each operating at its highest level, a dichotomy I doubted even Spielberg could balance.

reviews.name: Carlota Mosegui
reviews.message: A humble and moving autobiopic from the great Steven Spielberg. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Sergi Sánchez
reviews.message: The most beautiful thing about this magnificent personal film in which accuracy isn't as important as the re-imagined real events is how Spielberg shares his vision of the world through the art of filmmaking. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Hugo Hernández Valdivia
reviews.message: In addition to giving credibility to the different times and places in which the action takes place, it gives an account of the economic vicissitudes and the emotional ups and downs of the family;  [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Leonardo Garcia Tsao
reviews.message: ... A loving tribute to the medium, afflicted by a melodrama that's afraid of its own shadow. [Full review in Spanish]

reviews.name: Maria Lattila
reviews.message: With a classic score from John Williams and precise direction from Spielberg, The Fabelmans is one of the finest films about cinema itself. While it does occasionally succumb to sheer melodrama, it’s Spielberg at his most sincere and honest.

title: Attachment
description: ATTACHMENT is a horror romance about Maja, a has-been actress in Denmark, who falls in love with Leah, a young, Jewish academic visiting from the UK. When Leah suffers a mysterious seizure, Maja fears their whirlwind romance might be cut short and decides to follow Leah back to her home in London. There, Maja meets her new downstairs neighbour: Leah’s mother, Chana. An overbearing, seemingly religious and highly secretive woman, Chana seems resistant to all of Maja’s attempts to win her over. And as Maja notices strange occurrences in the building, she begins to suspect that Chana’s secrets could be much darker than first anticipated.

characteristics.Genre:: Drama, Mystery & thriller, Horror, Comedy, Romance, Lgbtq+
characteristics.Producer:: Thomas Heinesen
characteristics.Writer:: Gabriel Bier Gislason, Gabriel Bier Gislason

reviews.name: Gavia Baker-Whitelaw
reviews.message: Rooted in Jewish folklore, this queer horror-comedy sees a woman unexpectedly move in with her girlfriend’s mother – an eccentric and overbearing figure who seems oddly obsessed with supernatural threats.

reviews.name: Shelagh Rowan-Legg
